$x_1$ is wild rice of species/variety $x_2$.
$s_1=c_1$ is a weed of species $s_2$.
$v_1$ weeds out plants $s_1=c_1$ of species $s_2$ from $v_3$ with/leaving result/remnant/remainder $v_4$.
$x_{1}$ is food/feed/nutriment for $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is edible/gives nutrition to $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a burrito/Mexican dish of ingredients wrapped in a tortilla including ingredients $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a quantity of couscous of ingredients including $x_2$
$x_1$ is a pizza with topping/ingredients $x_2$.
$x_1$ is chometz.
$x_{1}$ is a/the knee/elbow/knuckle [hinged joint, body-part] of limb $x_{2}$ of body $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Metaphor: a sharp bend/curve. See also {korcu}, {jarco}, {jganu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of hydrogen (H); [metaphor: light, flammable].
$ca_1=ci_3$ crawls on surface $ca_2$.
valsi.notes: Cf. {cidni}, {cadzu}, {cidydzu}, {cidykla}, {reskla}. Similar to walking but without standing on feet.

valsi.definition: $t_1$ kneels on surface $t_2$ on limb $c_2=x_3$ of body $c_3=x_4$.
$x_{1}$ is an infant/baby [helpless through youth/incomplete development] of species $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a caterpillar (larva of butterfly or moth - not sawfly) of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a flower bud of plant/species $x_2$.
$d_1=c_1$ is a duckling of species/breed $d_2=c_2$.
$l_1$ is a children's story about plot/subject/moral $l_2$ by storyteller $l_3$ to audience $l_4$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the gland [body-part] secreting $x_{2}$, of body $x_{3}$; $x_{2}$ is a secretion of $x_{1}$.
number/quantity: 3,000 expressed with comma.
(adjective:) $x_{1}$ is awake/alert/conscious.
$x_{1}$ repairs/mends/fixes $x_{2}$ for use $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: A repair may be incomplete, fixing only one of the possible uses of $x_2$, hence $x_3$. See also {cfila}, {spofu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (person) explains $x_{2}$ (event/state/property) to $x_{3}$ with explanation $x_{4}$ (du'u).
valsi.notes: Explanation $x_4$ is an underlying mechanism/details/purpose/method for $x_2$ (= velcki for reordered places), generally assumed to be non-obvious; metaphorical usage with the various causal relations (i.e. jalge, mukti, krinu, rinka, nibli, zukte) is possible, but the non-obviousness, and the existence of an explainer with a point of view makes this word not a simple expression of cause. See also {cipra}, {danfu}, {jalge}, {jinvi}, {krinu}, {mukti}, {nabmi}, {preti}, {rinka}, {sidbo}, {zukte}, {tavla}.

valsi.definition: $s_1=c_1$ daydreams about $s_2$; $s_2$ is a daydream of $s_1=c_1$.
$b_1=c_1$ awakens/becomes awake under conditions $b_3$.
$g_1$ (person/agent) wakes up $c_1$.
(adjective:) $x_{1}$ is wild/untamed.
$g_1$ ties $j_1$ to $j_2$ with $c_1$.
$x_{1}$ is moist/wet/damp with liquid $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ learns $x_{2}$ (du'u) about subject $x_{3}$ from source $x_{4}$ (obj./event) by method $x_{5}$ (event/process).
$x_{1}$ is a thread/filament/wire [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (property - ka) is a dimension of space/object $x_{2}$ according to rules/model $x_{3}$.
$d_1=c_1$ is a quantityof/contains/is made of mud from source $d_2$ of composition $d_3$, moist due to liquid $c_2$.
quantifier selbri: convert 3 to cardinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is a set with the trio of members $x_{2}$.
$l_1$ is an implicitly metaphorical lujvo with meaning $l_2$ and arguments $l_3$ built from metaphor $l_4$.
valsi.notes: Used to refer to metaphorical lujvo that do not contain any -pev- rafsi (for {pe'a}). The word {cimjvo} is itself an example of cimjvo.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is infinite/unending/eternal in property/dimension $x_{2}$, to degree $x_{3}$ (quantity)/of type $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also everlasting, eternity, (= {cimnytei}), eternal (= cimnyteikai or {temcimni}). See also {vitno}, {renvi}, {munje}, {fanmo}, {sisti}.

valsi.definition: $t_1=c_1$ is an eternity.
$j_3=c_1$ is a/the black hole.
quantified selbri: convert 3 to ordinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is third among $x_{2}$ ordered by rule $x_{3}$.
$r_1$ (event/state) moistens $c_1$ with liquid $c_2$ under conditions $r_3$.
Xinjiang
$x_{1}$ (agent) kisses/busses $x_{2}$ at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is an oak, a type of tree of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a lion/[lioness] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is August of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$p_1$ is a transsexual person.
$x_{1}$ is a wrinkle/crease/fold [shape/form] in $x_{2}$.
$j_1=c_1$ courts/flirts with $j_1$, exhibiting sexuality/gender/sexual orientation $c_3$ (ka) by standard $c_4$.
$x_{1}$ is an insect/arthropod of species $x_{2}$; [bug/beetle].
$x_{1}$ is thin in direction/dimension $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$; [relatively short in smallest dimension].
$s_1$ is a string of $s_2$ material.
$m_1=c_1$ is sexy/hot/attractive to $m_2$ in aspect $m_3$ by standard $m_4=c_4$.
$x_{1}$ feels emotion $x_{2}$ (ka) about $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also mood/humor (= {nuncni}). See also cmavo list {ci'o}, {cumla}, {jilra}, {nelci}, {xendo}, {ckeji}, {cortu}, {jgira}, {kecti}, {kufra}, {manci}, {prami}, {steba}, {zungi}, {badri}, {burna}, {gleki}.

valsi.definition: number/quantity: 30 [thirty].
number/quantity: 300 [three hundred].
$x_{1}$ (abstraction) interests/is interesting to $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ is interested in $x_{1}$.
valsi.notes: Use $x_1$ tu'a for non-specific interest in an object; interested in (= {selci'i}). See also {zdile}, {kucli}, {manci}, {kurji}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ in activity/state $x_{2}$ exhibits sexuality/gender/sexual orientation $x_{3}$ (ka) by standard $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ courts/flirts; $x_3$ could be a ka <gender or role>, ka <attraction to a gender>, or ka <type of activity>, etc.; (adjective:) $x_1$ is sexual/sexy; $x_1$ is flirted with/courted by $x_2$ (= {cinfriti}, {cinjikca}). See also {gletu}, {pinji}, {plibu}, {vibna}, {vlagi}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ [material] is a paint of pigment/active substance $x_{2}$, in a base of $x_{3}$.
$p_1$ paints surface $p_3$ with paint $p_2=c_1$.
$x_{1}$ is a/are tong(s)/chopsticks/pincers/tweezers/pliers [tool/body-part] for $x_{2}$ to pinch $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is a panda of genus/species $x_2$.
$x_1$ checks/investigates/examines/inspects $x_2$ for property $x_3$.
$l_1$ experiments $l_2=c_2$ by means $l_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a bird/avian/fowl of species $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is an emu of variety/species $x_2$.
valsi.notes: This could also be used for any member of the Dromaius genus, of which there is currently only one surviving species.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a falcon (genus 'falco').
$x_1$ is a cuckoo of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a hoatzin of breed $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ (process/event) is a test for/proof of property/state $x_{2}$ in subject $x_{3}$ (individ./set/mass).
valsi.notes: Also examination, proxy measure, validation; (a set in $x_3$ must be completely specified). See also {ciksi}, {troci}, {jarco}, {pajni}, {saske}.

valsi.definition: $p_1$ is a test-paper from source $p_2$ for/proof of property/state $c_3$ in subject $c_4$.
$ce_1$ is an historian of the history of $ci_2$ according to standard $ce_3$.
$ct_1$ teaches history $ci_1$ to audience $ct_2$ by method $ct_5$ (event).
$x_{1}$ loses person/thing $x_{2}$ at/near $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ loses property/feature $x_{2}$ in conditions/situation $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event (rare for cirko), or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {po'ecri}, posyselcri for unambiguous {semantics}). See also {facki}, {ralte}, {sisku}, {claxu}, {jinga}, {pleji}, {canja}, {sfasa}, {dapma}, {binra}, {mipri}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains cheese/curd from source $x_{2}$.
$m_1$ (person/object/event) is historical among community of persons $m_2$ (mass).
tense interval modifier: thrice; objectively quantified tense; defaults as time tense.
$v_1$ is historical/a landmark/watershed in the history of $c_2$, according to $v_2=c_3$, in aspect/for reason $v_3$ (nu/ka).
$x_{1}$ inscribes/writes $x_{2}$ on display/storage medium $x_{3}$ with writing implement $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ is a scribe.
valsi.notes: Also $x_3$ writing surface. See also {papri}, {penbi}, {pinsi}, {tcidu}, {xatra}, {pixra}, {prina}, {finti} for 'author' or specific authorial works, {barna}, {pinka}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ smiles/grins (facial expression).
$c_1=f_1$ smiles at $f_3$ under conditions $f_4$.
$x_1$ is of size/measurement $x_2$ in dimension/aspect $x_3$
$t_1$ (hours, minutes, seconds) is the daylight saving time of state/event $t_2$ on day $t_3$ at location $t_4=c_3$.
$x_{1}$ (mass) system interrelated by structure $x_{2}$ among components $x_{3}$ (set) displaying $x_{4}$ (ka).
valsi.notes: $x_1$ (or $x_3$) is synergistic in $x_4$; also network; $x_2$ also relations, rules; $x_3$ also elements (set completely specified); $x_4$ systemic functions/properties. See also cmavo list {ci'e}, {cmima}, {girzu}, {gunma}, {stura}, {tadji}, {munje}, {farvi}, {ganzu}, {judri}, {julne}, {klesi}, {morna}, {tcana}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ eats/ingests/consumes (transitive verb) $x_{2}$.
$k_1$ is a kid of goat species $k_2$.
$z_1=c_1$ is younger than $z_2$ by amount $z_4$.
$m_1$ is cute to $m_2$ in aspect $m_3$.
$x_{1}$ is young/youthful [relatively short in elapsed duration] by standard $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Also age (= {nilnalci'o}); (adjective:) $x_1$ is junior. See also {cnino}, {slabu}, {verba}.

valsi.definition: $t_1=c_1$ is youngest among $t_4$.
$x_{1}$ is a history of $x_{2}$ according to $x_{3}$ (person)/from point-of-view $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a season/is seasonal [cyclical interval], defined by interval/property $x_{2}$, of year(s) $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also anniversary (= {citsydei}, {na'arcitsydei}), jubilee (= {mumnoncitsi}); the period of time may be short or long as indicated by $x_2$, and may occur every year or every nth year as indicated by $x_3$ (default every year); ($x_2$ and/or $x_3$ may need metaphorical restriction: djecitsi, pavdeicitsi; also equinox, solstice, time of year. See also {cedra}, {crisa}, {critu}, {dunra}, {ranji}, {temci}, {vensa}, {jbena}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ migrates to $x_2$ from $x_3$ over path/route $x_4$ in season $x_5$.
$x_{1}$ is a louse/flea [blood-sucking arthropod] of species/breed $x_{2}$, parasitic on $x_{3}$.
$x_1=c_1=d_1$ is a monster/freak of species $x_2=d_2$, monstrous/freakish in property $x_4=c_3$ according to $x_3=c_4$.
$x_{1}$ is strange/weird/deviant/bizarre/odd to $x_{2}$ in property $x_{3}$ (ka).
valsi.notes: Also alien, mysterious, deviant, queer, unusual, exotic. See also {ranxi}, {rirci}, {fange}, {banli}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of rubber/latex from source $x_{2}$ of composition including $x_{3}$.
$b_1$ is bedcloth of material $b_2$.
$x_1$ is a bedbug.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of coffee from source/bean/grain $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Brew based on a seed/bean/grain; e.g. also chicory coffee, decaf, postum. See also {tcati}, brewed from a leaf, {barja}, {cakla}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a blanket / quilt.
$x_{1}$ has/is characterized by property/feature/trait/aspect/dimension $x_{2}$ (ka); $x_{2}$ is manifest in $x_{1}$.
$k_1$ goes to bed from $k_3$.
$k_1$ is a bedroom in structure $k_2$ surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor $k_3$ (mass/jo'u).
$cl_1$ rises/gets up/leaves bed.
$x_{1}$ is a bed/pallet of material $x_{2}$ for holding/supporting $x_{3}$ (person/object/event).
$x_{1}$ is perilous/dangerous/potentially harmful to $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: $x_1$ is a danger/peril to $x_2$. See also te {bandu}, te {kajde}, te {marbi}, se {snura}, se {xalni}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ ridicules/mocks/scoffs at $x_{2}$ about $x_{3}$ (property/event) by doing activity $x_{4}$ (event).
$x_{1}$ feels ashamed/mortified/humiliated under conditions $x_{2}$ before community/audience $x_{3}$.
Albania.
$x_{1}$ is a key fitting/releasing/opening/unlocking lock $x_{2}$, and having relevant properties $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also $x_2$ fastener, mechanism; code key (= {termifckiku}, {kiktermifra}); $x_3$ is dependent on the type of key, but are those form properties of the key that enable it to serve the function of opening the lock - in the case of a metal key to a padlock, for example, this would be the shaft and teeth. See also {stela}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (si'o) is a scale of units for measuring/observing/determining $x_{2}$ (state).
$x_{1}$ is related to/associated with/akin to $x_{2}$ by relationship $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is Albanian (Balkan) in aspect $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is grateful/thankful to/appreciative of $x_{2}$ for $x_{3}$ (event/property).
$p_1$ is a diaper (absorbent garment) of material $p_2$.
$k_1$ is a bookshelf attached to $k_2$.
$x_1$ is the $x_3$'rd edition of book/publication $x_2$ about subject/theme/story $x_4$ by author $x_5$ for audience $x_6$ preserved in medium $x_7$ .
$x_{1}$ is school/institute/academy at $x_{2}$ teaching subject(s) $x_{3}$ to audien./commun. $x_{4}$ operated by $x_{5}$.
$x_{1}$ is a conifer/pine/fir of species/strain $x_{2}$ with cones $x_{3}$.
$p_1$ is a chapter of book $c_1=p_2$.
valsi.notes: Indices, appendices and forwards are also ckupau. Cf. {ckupaupau}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a part of $x_2$, which is a part of a book . $x_1$ is a part of chapter $x_2$
valsi.notes: $x_2$ is the name of the chapter, not the book. Cf. {ckupau}.

valsi.definition: $cup_1$ publishes $cup_2=cuk_1$ by process $cup_3$.
$s_1$ is a library of books $c_1=s_2$.
$z_1$ is a bookshop selling books $z_2=c_1$, operated by $z_3$.
$c_1$ is a librarian by standard $c_3$.
$s_1$ is library science with methodology $s_3$.
$k_1=b_1$ runs a marathon/long distance to destination $k_2$ from origin $k_3$ via route $k_4$.
$x_1=d_1=c_1$ is a sword / long knife weapon for use against $x_2=d_2$ by $x_3$ with blade of material $d_3$ long by standard $c_3$.
$x_{1}$ is loud/noisy at observation point $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
$k_1=c_1$ is a limousine for $k_2$, propelled by $k_3$.
$z_1$ is longer/taller than $z_2$ in direction $c_2$ by margin $z_4$.
$m_1$ is shorter than $m_2$ in direction $c_2$ by margin $m_4$.
$d_1=cl_1=cn_2$ is a giraffe of species/variety $d_2$.
$x_{1}$ is long in dimension/direction $x_{2}$ (default longest dimension) by measurement standard $x_{3}$.
$p_1$ is a leaf of $p_2$, long by standard $c_3$.
$p_1$ is a tall person, by measurement standard $c_3$.
$xa_2=c_1$ is tall in stature by measurement standard $c_3$.
valsi.notes: Cf. {clani}, {xadni}, {clapre}, {brabracrida}. Refers specifically to a body.

valsi.definition: $t_1$ is a long time/duration/interval/period/elapsed time from time/event $t_2$ to time/event $t_3$.
$x_{1}$ is without/lacking/free of/lacks $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$-less.
$x_{1}$ is a moss/lichen of species/strain $x_{2}$ growing on $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is mossy.
$n_1=c_4$ is an instructional message about $n_2=c_3$ with contents $c_2$ intended for audience $n_4=c_1$.
$x_{1}$ (event) is early by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is polite/courteous/civil in matter $x_{2}$ according to standard/custom $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ leaves/goes away/departs/parts/separates from $x_{2}$ via route $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ leaves behind/takes leave of $x_2$. See also {litru}, {canci}, {vimcu}, {lebna}, {litru}, {muvdu}.

valsi.definition: $g_1$ (agent) fills $c_1$ with $c_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a loop/circuit of $x_{2}$ [material].
valsi.notes: Also noose (= skoclupa, saljgeclupa; there is no indication of shape, but merely that the ends join/meet); closed curve defined by set of points (= {cuptai}). See also {djine}.

valsi.definition: $b_1=c_1$ decreases in size/becomes small to $b_2$ under conditions $b_3$.
$ca_1=cm_1$ is tiny/miniature/diminutive/very small in property $ca_2=cm_2$ to observer $ca_3=cm_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a mathematics of type/describing $x_{2}$.
$cu_1$ is a booklet/brochure about $cu_2$, written by $cu_3$ for intended audience $cu_4$ in medium $cu_5$=$cm_1$.
$c_1$ is tiny/miniature/diminutive/very small in property $c_2$ with criterion $c_3$.
$t_1$ is a microscope used by $t_2=ca_1$ for looking at small things $t_2=ca_2=cm_1$ which are small in property/dimension(s) $cm_2$ (ka) as compared with standard/norm $cm_3$.
$x_{1}$ is small in property/dimension(s) $x_{2}$ (ka) as compared with standard/norm $x_{3}$.
$cman_1=cman_1$is a hill in terrain $cman_2$, small by standard $cmal_3$.
$s_1=m_1=c_1$ is a woodchip/splinter of wood type $m_2$, small as compared with standard/norm $c_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a mountain/hill/mound/[rise]/[peak]/[summit]/[highlands] projecting from land mass $x_{2}$.
$n_1$ is a roll/bun/biscuit/bun made from grains $n_2$.
$p_1$ is an asteroid revolving around $p_2$ with planetary characteristics $p_3$, orbital parameters $p_4$.
$r_1$ is a creek/stream/rivulet of land mass $r_2$, draining watershed $r_3$ into $r_4$/terminating at $r_4$.
$c_1=r_1$ is a small rock of type $r_2$ from location $r_3$, small by standard $c_3$. $c_1$ is gravel.
$c_1=s_1$ is a/the sprout/shoot of plant/species $s_2$ by standard/norm $c_3$.
$x_1$ is a village in administrative area $x_3$ serving hinterland $x_4$ small by standard $x_5$.
$cman_1=cmal_1$ is a hillock/mound/rise/knoll in terrain $cman_2$, small by standard $cmal_3$.
$r_1=cmal_1$ is a rivulet on surface/terrain $r_2$ draining $r_3$ terminating at $r_4$ small by standard $cmal_3$.
$m_1=c_1$ is tiny/miniscule/diminutive in property/dimension(s) $c_2$ (ka) as compared with standard/norm $c_3$.
$t_1$ is a brush/bushy vegetation of species/type $t_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a structure word of grammatical class $x_{2}$, with meaning/function $x_{3}$ in usage (language) $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: $x_4$ may be a specific usage (with an embedded language place) or a massified language description; $x_3$ and $x_4$ may be merely an example of cmavo usage or refer to an actual expression; cmavo list, if physical object (= (loi) ma'oste); referring to the mental construct (e.g. propose adding a new cmavo to the cmavo list = ma'orpoi, ma'orselcmi, ma'orselste). See also {gismu}, {lujvo}, {gerna}, {smuni}, {valsi}.

valsi.definition: $xi_1=c_1$ is a pony of species/breed $xi_2$.
$z_1$ is a hut of/for $z_1$, small as compared with standard/norm $c_3$.
$z_1=c_1$ shrinks/decreases in property $c_2$ (ka) by amount $z_3$.
$b_1$ is a pseudonym/pronoun, replacing real name $b_2=c_1$ of $x_3=c_2$ in circumstance $x_4=b_3$.
Nameless.
$x_{1}$ (quoted word(s)) is a/the name/title/tag of $x_{2}$ to/used-by namer/name-user $x_{3}$ (person).
valsi.notes: Also: $x_2$ is called $x_1$ by $x_3$ (= selcme for reordered places). See also cmavo list {me'e}, {gismu}, {tcita}, {valsi}, {judri}.

valsi.definition: $s_1$ identifies $s_2=c_2$ by name $c_1$ used-by namer/name-user $c_3$ (person).
$l_1$ is an onomasticon of names $l_2=c_1$ in order $l_3$ in medium $l_4$.
$t_1$ is a name tag/nameplate of $t_2=c_2$ showing text $c_1$.
$x_1$ is a morphologically defined name word meaning $x_2$ in language $x_3$.
valsi.notes: In Lojban, such words are characterized by ending with a consonant. Examples: {lojban}, {jegvon}, {camgusmis}.

valsi.definition: $b_1=c_1$ becomes a member of group $b_2=c_2$ under conditions $b_3$.
$cm_1=cu_1$ votes for $cu_2$ among choices $cu_3$ in voting group $cm_2$.
valsi.notes: Applies to any election, not just public ones. Cf. {turni}.

valsi.definition: $k_1$ is suffrage entitled to $k_2=cu_1$ by standard $k_3$.
valsi.notes: It is a civil right, {selcemkrali}. Cf. {cmicu'a}.

valsi.definition: $g_1$ puts together $c_1$ into group $c_2$.
$x_{1}$ laughs (emotional expression).
$x_{1}$ is a member/element of set $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ belongs to group $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is amid/among/amongst group $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: $x_1$ may be a complete or incomplete list of members; $x_2$ is normally marked by la'i/le'i/lo'i, defining the set in terms of its common property(ies), though it may be a complete enumeration of the membership. See also {ciste}, {porsi}, {jbini}, {girzu}, {gunma}, {klesi}, cmavo list {mei}, {kampu}, {lanzu}, {liste}.

valsi.definition: $z_1=c_1$ participates in employing means/taking action $z_2$ for purpose/goal $z_3$.
$x_{1}$ utters moan/groan/howl/scream [non-linguistic utterance] $x_{2}$ expressing $x_{3}$ (property).
valsi.notes: Also shriek, most animal sounds, e.g. bark, cackle, meow, neigh, moo, honk, baa, crow. See also {krixa}, {bacru}, {cusku}, {cortu}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is an element of kind $x_2$ with purity $x_3$.
$d_1=c_1$ is a chisel for carving $d_2=c_2$ with blade of material $d_3$.
$x_{1}$ [value] is a norm/average in property/amount $x_{2}$ (ka/ni) among $x_{3}$(s) (set) by standard $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also mean, normal, usual; ($x_3$ specifies the complete set). See also {tcaci}, {fadni}, {kampu}, {lakne}, {tarti}, {rirci}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a/the neck [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: a relatively narrow point].
$x_{1}$ (agent) rewards $x_{2}$ [recipient] for atypical $x_{3}$ (event/property) with reward/desserts $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Differs from earned payment because of atypical nature; rewards need not be positive but are in some sense deserved from the point of view of the rewarder: positive reward (= {zanyne'u}), punishment, penalty, demerit (= {malne'u}, {sfane'u}); $x_4$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posne'u}, posyvelne'u for unambiguous {semantics}). See also {dunda}, {friti}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {jivna}, {pleji}, {sfasa}, {venfu}, {prali}, {dapma}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is the derivative of $x_2$ with respect to $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is orderly/neat/ordered in property/quantity $x_{2}$ (ka/ni).
$co_1=ci_1$ hurts emotionally due to $ci_3$.
$d_1=c_1$ is far/distant from $d_2$ in feeling $d_3=c_2$.
$j_1=c_1$ shows emotion $j_2=c_2$ (ka) about $c_3$ to audience $j_3$.
$j_1=c_3$ excites $j_2=c_1$.
$x_1$ empathizes with $x_2$ in feeling $x_3$.
$v_1$ is an attitudinal meaning $v_2=c_1$ in language $v_3$.
$x_{1}$ is new/unfamiliar/novel to observer $x_{2}$ in feature $x_{3}$ (ka) by standard $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ is a novelty.
$x_1=r_1$ (event) moves/touches $x_2=c_1$ (person), causing emotion $x_3=c_2$ about object of emotion $x_4=c_3$ with causation conditions $x_5=r_3$; $x_1=r_1$ (event) is moving/touching.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of lead (Pb); [metaphor: heavy, malleable, soft metal].
$s_1$ is the heart (emotional self) of $s_2=c_1$.
$x_{1}$ is directly/vertically beneath/below/under/underneath/down from $x_{2}$ in frame of reference $x_{3}$.
$t_1=c_2$ is the mood experienced by $t_2=c_1$ about $c_3$.
$v_1$ sighs due to emotion $c_2$ (ka) about $c_3$ breathing/respiring $v_2$.
tanru inversion operator; "... of type ..."; allows modifier trailing sumti without sumti links.
interval event contour: at the starting point of ...; initiative >|< |.
elliptical/unspecified bridi relationship.
interval event contour: at the instantaneous point of ...; achievative; point event >|<.
vocative: partings/good-bye.
interval event contour: at the ending point of ... even if not done; cessative | >< |.
$d_1$ is relieved from stress/discomfort $d_2$
vocative: greetings/hello.
vocative: greetings in passing.
$x_{1}$ soaks up/absorbs/sucks up $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ into $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ is an absorbant.
$x_{1}$ is deep in extent in direction/property $x_{2}$ away from reference point $x_{3}$ by standard $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ hurts/feels pain/hurt at locus $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ gets/procures/acquires/obtains/accepts $x_{2}$ from source $x_{3}$ [previous possessor not implied].
valsi.notes: Also fetch; accept a gift (= {seldu'acpa}). See also {punji}, {lebna}, {vimcu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is upon/atop/resting on/lying on [the upper surface of] $x_{2}$ in frame of reference/gravity $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: ($x_1$ may be object or event); See also se {vasru}, {jbini}, {zvati}, {nenri}, {vreta}, {ckana}, {diklo}, {jibni}, {lamji}, {zutse}, {punji} for lay upon, {sarji}, {zbepi}.

valsi.definition: $g_1=c_1$ rides/mounts/has sexual intercourse on top of $g_2=c_2$, in frame of reference/gravity $c_3$.
$f_1=c_1$ refuses $f_2=c_2$ from $c_3$.
$x_{1}$ climbs/clambers/creeps/crawls on surface $x_{2}$ in direction $x_{3}$ using $x_{4}$ [limbs/tools].
$x_{1}$ requests/asks/petitions/solicits for $x_{2}$ of/from $x_{3}$ in manner/form $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also demand (= {mi'ecpe}); $x_4$ is a means of expression See also ve {cusku}.: a request may be indicated in speech, in writing, or by an action (e.g. petitions are often in writing, while begging/panhandling may be indicated by an action or even demeanor). (cf. pikci, te preti, te frati, se spuda, danfu)

valsi.definition: $x_1$ complies with/accedes to request $x_2$ made by $x_3$.
$x_1$ complies with request $x_2$ from $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is pungent/piquant/peppery/spicy/irritating to sense $x_{2}$.
$t_1=c_1$ is a hot/pungent spice causing flavor/effect $t_2$ (event/property).
$z_1$ is a nest of bird $z_2$=$c_1$ of genus/species/etc. $c_2$.
$l_1=m_1$ is a tractor pulling $l_2$.
$g_1=l_1$ pulls $m_1=l_2$ to destination $m_2$ from origin $m_3$ over path/route $m_4$ at handle/locus $l_3$.
$x_{1}$ broadcasts/transmits [using radio waves] $x_{2}$ via station/frequency $x_{3}$ to [radio] receiver $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also $x_1$ is a broadcaster. See also {tivni}, {benji}, {tcana}.

valsi.definition: $c_1$ is a radio transceiver transmitting/receiving $c_2$ on frequency $c_3$ to/from transceiver $c_4$.
valsi.notes: The $x_3$ place may specify more than one frequency, for instance in cases where different frequencies are used for transmission and receipt. Cf. {veltivni}.

valsi.definition: $k_1$ is an anteroom of/in structure $k_2$ surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor $k_3$ (mass/jo'u).
$l_1$ is an initial letter in alphabet/character-set $l_2$ representing $l_3$.
$x_{1}$ is anterior/ahead/forward/(in/on) the front of $x_{2}$ which faces/in-frame-of-reference $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_3$ is the standard of orientation for $x_2$. See also {sefta}, {flira}, {trixe}, {mlana}, {pritu}, {zunle}.

valsi.definition: $v_1=c_1$ is a front door/gateway/access between $v_2$ and $v_3$ of structure $v_4$.
$c_1=b_1$ becomes expert at $c_2=b_2$ under conditions $b_3$ by standard $c_3$.
valsi.notes: Coined because {cilre} makes it hard to talk about just learning about a subject. Cf. {ckule}, {saske}, {ctuca}.

valsi.definition: $j_1=c_2$ is a profession (job) of person $j_2=c_1$.
valsi.notes: Especially a job requiring a high level of skill or training. Cf. {jibri}, {gunka}, {certu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a shirt/blouse/top [upper-body garment - not necessarily sleeved or buttoned], material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) harvests/reaps/gathers crop/product/objects $x_{2}$ from source/area $x_{3}$.
$j_1=c_1$ skillfully handles $j_2=c_2$ in event $j_3$.
$c_1=xa_1$ is a geek/nerd of field $c_2=xa_2$ (event/activity) by standard $c_3$.
$x_1$ practices/exercises/drills/trains in/for action/event/performance $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a bear/ursoid of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is bearberry of species/variety $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a fairy/elf/gnome/brownie/pixie/goblin/kobold [mythical humanoid] of mythos/religion $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Also orc, giant, demon or devil (when humanoid-form is presumed by the mythos/religion), bugbear, bogeyman. (cf. ranmi, especially for non-humanoid creatures of myth, lijda)

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is green/verdant [color adjective].
$x_{1}$ is a bridge/span over/across $x_{2}$ between $x_{3}$ and $x_{4}$ [unordered, typically destination first].
$x_{1}$ is summer/summertime [hot season] of year $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is autumn/fall [harvest/cooling season] of year $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$g_1$ practices sadomasochism with $g_2=c_1$ with pain at locus $c_2$.
$r_1$ (event/state) hurts/causes pain for $x_2=c_1$ at locus $x_3=c_2$.
$t_1$ is hot spice.
$v_1$ is a hot/spicy taste/flavor of/emitted by $v_2$.
$t_1$ is a situation / condition / state / position that allows / is sufficient for event $c_2=t_2$ under conditions $c_3$.
valsi.notes: As the whole point of this word is to ignore the agentive nature of c1, c1 has been dropped. Cf. {curmi}, {tcini}, {rau}, {banzu}.

valsi.definition: $v_1$ is a permit allowing $c_2$ (event) under conditions $c_3$, preserved in medium $v_4$.
$k_1=c_1$ is the audit committee of $k_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a tide [cyclical/periodic expansion] in $x_{2}$ caused by $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the lip [body-part]/rim of orifice $x_{2}$ of body $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is labial.
$x_1$ is a nightjar/goatsucker/whippoorwill of genus/species $x_2$.
$d_1$ is dew.
$x_{1}$ is a tax/levy/duty on goods/services/event $x_{2}$ levied against $x_{3}$ by authority/collector $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also custom, toll, tariff, tribute. See also {pleji}, {flalu}, {turni}.

valsi.definition: $m_1$ is dark of night of day $n_2$ at location $n_3$.
$m_1$ is the midnight of $n_2$ at location $n_3$.
$x_1$ is a nightingale of species/variety $x_2$.
$s_1$ is a supper composed of dishes including $s_2$.
$cin_1$ is a/are chopstick(s) for eating $cit_2$.
$cp_1$ orders food $ci_2$ for $cp_2$ from $cp_3$ in manner/form $cp_4$.
$d_1$ is a table knife for cutting food $d_2=c_2$, with blade of material $d_3$.
$g_1$ feeds $c_1$ with food $c_2$.
$k_1$ is a dining room in structure $k_2$ surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor $k_3$ (mass/jo'u).
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of petroleum/oil from source $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is an oil lamp using petroleum-based products, illuminating $x_2$ with light $x_1$.
$v_1$ is a fuel tank.
$x_{1}$ is a shadow/the shade of object $x_{2}$, made by light/energy source $x_{3}$.
$p_1$ sets up diet $p_2$ for $c_1$ consisting of food $c_2$.
$p_1$ is the digestion of food $p_2=c_2$ with output $p_3$ passing through stage $p_4$ of person/animal/plant $c_1$.
$g_1$ digests food $p_2=c_2$ with output $p_3$ passing through stage $p_4$ of person/animal/plant $c_1$.
$s_1$ celebrates $s_2$ with a banquet/feast.
$t_1$ is cutlery for eating $c_2$.
$x_1$ is $x_2$ centuries in duration by standard $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ teaches audience $x_{2}$ ideas/methods/lore $x_{3}$ (du'u) about subject(s) $x_{4}$ by method $x_{5}$ (event).
valsi.notes: Also instruct, instructor, educate, educator, teacher, professor, pedagogue; (adjective:) $x_1$/$x_5$ is pedagogical. See also {ckule}, {cilre}, {tadni}.

valsi.definition: $ci_1$ is an education system interrelated by administrative policies $ci_2$ among institutions $ci_3=ct_1$ displaying quality $ci_4$.
$cu_1=ct_1$ is a textbook for teaching ideas/methods $ct_3$ (du'u), by author $cu_3$ for audience $cu_4=ct_2$ about subject(s) $ct_4$ by method $ct_5$, preserved in medium $cu_5$.
$f_1$ is a lesson by $c_1$ for teaching audience $c_2$ ideas/methods/lore $c_3$ (du'u) about subject(s) $c_4$ by method $c_5$ (event).
$n_1$ are instructions by $c_1$ teaching audience $c_2$ ideas/methods/lore $c_3$ (du'u) about subject(s) $c_4$ by method $c_5$ (event).
$n_1=c_5$ is a lecture / an event of verbal teaching by $t_1=c_1$ to audience $t_2 = c_2$ about subject $t_3 = c_4$ in language $t_4$ with facts taught $c_3$.
elidable marker: separates selbri from preceding sumti, allows preceding terminator elision.
unary mathematical operator: absolute value/norm |a|.
$cm_1=cu_1$ is a member of electorate $cm_2$, which votes/selects $cu_2$ [choice] from set/sequence of alternatives $cu_3$.
valsi.notes: Gismu deep structure is "cuxna gi'e cmima"; Cf. {turni}, {cmicu'a}, {gubycu'a}, {jecta}.

valsi.definition: $k_1=c_1$ is a gaming die, with sides $k_3=c_3$, with side $c_2$ facing up and having dimensions $k_2$.
tense/modal question.
attitudinal: neutral scalar attitude modifier.
convert number to probability selbri; event $x_{1}$ has probability (n) of occurring under cond. $x_{2}$.
cusku modal, 1st place (attribution/quotation) as said by source ...; used for quotation.
tagged sumti: can be used for embedded: it-1 said, "...", with editorial unquote and insert.
$p_1$ is a businessman/business woman involved in business $c_1$.
$m_1$ is a skate carrying $m_2$ on surface/medium $m_3$.
$t_1$ is the heel of shoe $t_2=c_1$ for covering/protecting feet $c_2$, and of material $c_3$.
$cl_1$ is barefoot/not wearing shoes.
$x_1=k_5$ is a roller skate to destination $k_2$ from origin $k_3$ via route $k_4$, transporting $x_5=k_1$.
$x_{1}$ is round/circular [2-dimensional shape/form]; $x_{1}$ is a disk/circle/ring.
valsi.notes: Normally used for a filled-in circle/disk, but emphasis on roundness means that the concept may include 'ring'. See also {djine}, {ranji}, {bolci}, {tarmi}.

valsi.definition: $v_4=m_1=c_1$ is a computer disk/hard disk/floppy disk storing $v_2$ (data/facts/du'u) about $v_3$ (object/event) in file(s) $v_1$.
$v_4=m_1=c_1$ is a compact disc/optical disc storing $v_2$ (data/facts/du'u) about $v_3$ (object/event) in file(s) $v_1$.
$m_1=c_1$ (object) is completely round/full.
$x_{1}$ is a book containing work $x_{2}$ by author $x_{3}$ for audience $x_{4}$ preserved in medium $x_{5}$.
valsi.notes: [$x_1$ is a manifestation/container A physical object or its analogue. of a work/content, not necessarily using paper (= {selpapri})]; See also {cfika}, {prina}, {prosa}, {tcidu}, {papri}.

valsi.definition: $t_1=c_1$ is a circle.
$v_4=g_2=c_1$ is a compact disc/optical disc storing $v_2$ (data/facts/du'u) about $v_3$ (object/event) in file(s) $v_1$.
$v_4$ is a gramophone record of $v_2$.
$x_1$ is a compass for drawing circles $x_2$.
$cp_1$ humbly asks for/implores $cp_2$ from $cp_3$ in manner/form $cp_4$.
$x_{1}$ is full/completely filled with $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (event/state/property) is possible under conditions $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ may/might occur; $x_{1}$ is a maybe.
$x_{1}$ is humble/modest about $x_{2}$ (abstraction); $x_{1}$ displays humility about $x_{2}$.
$x_1=p_2=c_1$ (subject/concept) is conceivable under conditions $c_2$.
$cf_1$ is science fiction about possible universe $cu_1=m_1$ by author $cf_3$.
$k_1$ gambles/plays the lottery $k_2$.
$f_1$ is shuffled/randomly distributed/cut among $f_2$ with shares/portions $f_3$.
$g_1$ shuffles/randomly distributes/cuts $x_2=f_1$ among $x_3=f_2$ with shares/portions $x_4=f_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of millet [grain] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$p_1$ bumps into/randomly encounters $p_2$ at/in location $p_3$.
$x_{1}$ is random/fortuitous/unpredictable under conditions $x_{2}$, with probability distribution $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also accidental, chancy, by chance, adventitious, arbitrary (also = cuncu'a, cunselcu'a, cunjdi, cunseljdi; based on "unpredictable"). See also {cnici}, {lakne}, {funca}, {kalsa}, {snuti}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is an affair/organized activity involving person(s) $x_{2}$ (ind./mass); $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$'s business.
valsi.notes: Also matter, concern; $x_2$ is engaged in $x_1$ (which is usually an abstraction) (= selcu'u for reordered places). See also {jikca}, {srana}.

valsi.definition: $n_1=c_1$ (li) is a random number (noun), random under conditions $c_2$, with probability distribution $c_3$.
$l_1$ makes a round trip via route $l_2$ using means/vehicle $l_3$.
$x_{1}$ produces $x_{2}$ [product] by process $x_{3}$.
$p_1=c_1$ is a circularly ordered sequence by rule $p_2$ on unordered set $p_3$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) lets/permits/allows $x_{2}$ (event) under conditions $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ grants privilege $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Sufficient condition (= {crutcini}), agent that permits a situation (= {tcinycru}). See also {rinju}, {banzu}, {ralte}, {jimte}, {jaspu}, {zifre}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a worm/invertebrate animal of species/breed $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Also mollusk, snail (= {cakcurnu}), shellfish (= {xaskemcakcurnu}, {xaskemcakydja}); the generalization to invertebrate is because almost all multicellular invertebrates are indeed wormlike. See also {since}, {silka}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is pure/unadulterated/unmitigated/simple in property $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ (agent) expresses/says $x_{2}$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) for audience $x_{3}$ via expressive medium $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also says. See also {bacru}, {tavla}, {casnu}, {spuda}, cmavo list {cu'u}, {bangu}, {dapma}, {jufra}, {pinka}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ edits/revises/adapts text $x_2$ by $x_3$ for audience $x_4$ in medium $x_5$.
$z_3$ is a condition for free expressive activity $z_2$ by agent $z_1=c_1$.
$x_{1}$ is a shoe/boot/sandal for covering/protecting [feet/hooves] $x_{2}$, and of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the chest/thorax/upper trunk/[rib cage/breast] [body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$b_1$ is a rib of body $b_3=c_2$.
$g_1=c_1$ is the ribcage of $c_2$.
$t_1$ is the upper back [body-part] of $c_2$.
$x_{1}$ chooses/selects $x_{2}$ [choice] from set/sequence of alternatives $x_{3}$ (complete set).
$p_2=c_1$ filters $p_1=c_2$ to destination side $p_3$ from origin side $p_4$.
letteral for c.
logically quantified existential pro-sumti: there exists something 1 (usually restricted).
digit/number: all except n; all but n; default 1.
$c_1=d_2$ is a fighting expert in fighting against $c_2$ over issue $c_3$ (abstract), expert by standard $c_3$.
quantified selbri: converts all-but-(1) to ordinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is penultimate among $x_{2}$ by rule $x_{3}$.
quantified selbri: converts all-but-2 to ordinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is antepenult. among $x_{2}$ by rule $x_{3}$.
$s_1$ fight [each other] over issue $d_3$ (abstract).
$c_1$ (mass normally, but 1 individual/jo'u possible) argues/quarrels about topic/subject $c_2=d_3$ with opponent $x_3=d_2$.
pro-sumti: remote future utterance; "He'll tell you tomorrow. IT will be a doozy.".
discursive: supposing - in fact.
discursive: supposing - in fact.
discursive: cancel pro-sumti/pro-bridi assignments.
attitudinal attribution
valsi.notes: Whereas {dai} simply marks an attitudinal as applying to someone other than the speaker, da'oi explicitly attributes the preceding attitudinal. In particular, dai is equivalent to da'oi na'e bo mi.

valsi.definition: pro-sumti: a remote past utterance; "She couldn't have known that IT would be true.".
$c_1$ is armor around $c_2$ composed of $c_3$ against opponent $x_4=d_2$.
$f_1$ (event) is a wargame, simulating combat by $d_1$ against $d_2$ over issue $d_3$ (abstract).
$t_1$ is a fighting technique / martial art used under conditions $t_3$ by $d_1$.
valsi.notes: t2 subsumed. d2 and d3 not usually relevant to technique. Made from {damba} + {tadji}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a drawer/file in structure $x_{2}$, a [sliding compartment] container for contents $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a material object enduring in space-time; $x_{1}$ is a thing.
$g_1$ hangs/suspends $d_1$ from $d_2$ with/by means $d_3$.
$x_{1}$ pertains to the Taoist culture/ethos/religion in aspect $x_{2}$.
$t_1$ is a necktie for wearing by $t_2=c_2$ serving purpose $t_3$.
$c_1$ hangs/lynches $c_2=d_1$ by hanging them from/on $d_2$ by means of $d_3$.
valsi.notes: x2 is killed by this action. Use {dadgau} if x2 is already dead.

valsi.definition: $c_1=d_1$ is a hammock of material $c_2$ hung from $d_2$.
$s_1=d_1$ is a pendulum oscillating at rate/frequency $s_2$, suspended from $d_2$ by/at/with joint $d_3$.
$c_1$ (agent) answers $x_2=d_1$ to question/problem $x_3=d_2$.
$s_1$ is pavement of road/highway $x_2=d_1$.
$s_1$ is a road sign meaning $s_2$ to observer/driver/pedestrian $s_3$.
attitudinal modifier: marks empathetic use of preceding attitudinal; shows another's feelings.
$x_{1}$ is a knife (tool) for cutting $x_{2}$, with blade of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a sack/bag with contents $x_{2}$, and of material $x_{3}$.
$c_1=d_1$ is a sleeping bag of material $c_2=d_3$ for holding $c_3=d_2$.
$x_1=d_1$ is a dagger / knife weapon for use against $x_2=d_2$ by $x_3$ with blade of material $d_3$.
$c_1$ is a ranch at $c_2$, of rancher $c_3$ raising animals $c_4=d_1$.
$s_1$ is zoology concerned with animals of type $d_2$ based on methodology $s_3$.
$x_{1}$ fights/combats/struggles with $x_{2}$ over issue $x_{3}$ (abstract); $x_{1}$ is a fighter/combatant.
valsi.notes: Use $x_3$ tu'a for fight over an object/objective. See also {bradi}, {gunta}, {talsa}, {darlu}, {fapro}, {jamna}, {sonci}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a drum/cymbal/gong [percussion musical instrument] with beater/actuator $x_{2}$.
$t_1$ is a chimney made of of material $t_2$ for emitting/expelling smoke/gas/steam/magma $t_3=d_1$ from source $d_2$.
$v_1$ smokes/inhales $v_2$. $v_1$ is a smoker.
valsi.notes: not necessarily tobacco. Cf. {danmo}, {vasxu}. See also {tankyva'u}, {sigva'u}, {marnyva'u}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ hangs/dangles/is suspended from $x_{2}$ by/at/with joint $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Pendant (= {dadja'i}); also dependent (original meaning). See also {lasna}, {jorne}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is the answer/response/solution/[reply] to question/problem $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: (cf. ciksi, frati, preti, nabmi, spuda for agentive response/reply, cpedu)

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is an animal/creature of species $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is biologically animate.
$p_1$ is a trajectory of ballistic projectile $d_1$ fired by gun/launcher $d_2$, to destination $p_2$ from $p_3$ via $p_4$.
Denmark.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of smoke/smog/air pollution from source $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$ may be a fire. See also {pulce}, {gapci}, {sigja}, {bumru}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (force) puts pressure on/presses/applies force to $x_{2}$.
$s_1$ is ballistics with methodology $s_2$.
$x_{1}$ (individual, mass) dances to accompaniment/music/rhythm $x_{2}$.
$c_1$ is a dance/ball involving participants $c_2=d_1$, to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a ballistic projectile [e.g. bullet/missile] for firing by [gun/propelling launcher] $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Also cannonball, catapult stone, shot pellet(s). See also {cecla}, {renro}, {jakne}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a quiver/magazine for arrows/bullets $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is an island/atoll/key of [material/properties] $x_{2}$ in surroundings/body $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is insular.
$x_{1}$ curses/damns/condemns $x_{2}$ to fate (event) $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Curse with a specific expression (= {dapsku}). See also {mabla}, {dimna}, {cnemu}, {sfasa}, {dunda}, {cusku}, {cirko}, {jdima}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is an armadillo of species/breed $x_2$.
$t_1=d_2$ is a hell/cursed territory cursed by $t_2=d_1$.
$t_1$ is a telescope for examining $c_2=d_1$ which is far from $d_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a road/highway to $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ with route $x_{4}$ ($x_{2}$/$x_{3}$ may be unordered).
valsi.notes: A regularly used, improved-for-use surface for travelling. See also {naxle}, {tcana}, {pluta}, {klaji}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ argues for stand $x_{2}$ against stand $x_{3}$; [an opponent is not necessary].
$z_1=d_1$ is farther from $z_2=d_2$ in property $z_3=d_3$ by amount $z_4$.
$x_{1}$ is far/distant from $x_{2}$ in property $x_{3}$ (ka).
$p_1$ long jumps to $p_2$ from $p_3$ reaching height $p_4$.
$j_1=p_1$ long jumps with opponent(s) $j_2$ in contest/competition $j_3$ (event) for gain $j_4$.
$x_{1}$ shows audacity/chutzpah in behavior $x_{2}$ (event/activity); $x_{1}$ dares to do/be $x_{2}$ (event/ka).
$x_1$ encourages $x_2$ to do/be $x_3$.
Darussalam.
$t_1$ is a telescope for seeing $v_2=d_1$ which is far from $d_2$.
$x_{1}$ hits/strikes/[beats] $x_{2}$ with instrument [or body-part] $x_{3}$ at locus $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a pocket/pouch of/in garment/item $x_{2}$.
$b_1$ is a handkerchief of type/material $b_2$ in pocket $x_3=d_1$.
valsi.notes: For example worn in suit front pockets. Cf. {zbibu'u}.

valsi.definition: $c1=da1$ is a Pokémon/Pocket Monster of species $da2$
$x_1=c_1$ is a koala (Phascolarctos cinereus) of breed $x_2=c_2$
$m_1$ is a marsupial mammal of species $m_2$.
$x_{1}$ wears/is robed/garbed in $x_{2}$ as a garment of type $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$ need not be intended for use as a garment (unlike taxfu). See also {taxfu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (event) destroys/ruins/wrecks/despoils $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is destructive.
$x_{1}$ is a ribbon/tape/strip/band/stripe of material $x_{2}$.
$x_1=t_2$ is a cross-dresser/transvestite wearing dress/garment/clothing $x_2=t_1$ serving purpose $t_3$.
$c_1=d_1$ is an alias/nickname of $c_2$ used by $c_3$ instead of name $d_2$, differing from it by standard $d_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a duck/[drake] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$p_1$ is eiderdown/feather/plume of duck species/breed $d_2$.
$z_1=d_1$ is a plurality of/more than all other subgroups of $z_2$ as seperated/classified by property $z_3=d_3$ by amount $z_4$.
valsi.notes: Made from {drata} + {zmadu}. Seems like both this and {xabmau} should have {klesi} in them, but it can be argued that the combination imports the idea of classification. See also {xabmau}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (du'u) [fact/measurement] is data/information/statistic(s) about $x_{2}$ gathered by method $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Evidence (= velji'i datni or just {velji'i}, {sidydatni}). See also {fatci}, {saske}, {vreji}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a pipe carrying data $x_2$ to $x_3$ from $x_4$.
$n_1=d_1$ is a report about $n_2=d_2$ from reporter $n_3$ to intended audience $n_4$.
$x_1=das_1$ is a signal recording and playback tape-type medium (cassette/DAT/tape drive) containing data/sound/image $x_2=dat_1$ with data storage mechanism/method $x_3$ (analog/digital)
$v_1$ is a computer variable/register/memory cell with contents $v_2=d_1$.
$g_1$ is computer memory, consisting of parts $x_2=g_2=v_1$.
$v_1$ is a file consisting of information $d_1=v_2$ about $d_2=v_3$ in medium $v_4$.
$l_1=v_1$ is a directory of files $l_2$ in order $l_3$ in medium $l_4=v_4$.
$n_1$ is a socket connecting $n_3$ to $n_2$ along route $n_4$ carrying data $x_5=d_1$.
valsi.notes: $x_1$ is the end opened with listen(); Cf. {datnyfle}.

valsi.definition: $pr_1$ is (a) heterosexual.
$v_1$ is a tourist/foreign visitor, visiting $v_2$ at place/event $v_3$ from country $x_4=g_1$.
digit/number: hex digit A (decimal 10) [ten].
attitudinal: equal intensity attitudinal relativizer
valsi.notes: Specifies an equal intensity - relative to any previously specified intensity of the same UI/cmavo. See also {mau'i}, {me'ai}, {cu'i}

valsi.definition: October.
$x_1=m_1$ is October of year $x_2=m_2$ in calendar $x_3=m_3$.
$c_1$ debate on topic/subject $c_2$.
$f_1=d_1$ fails to hit $d_2$ with instrument $d_3$ at locus $d_4$.
logically quantified existential pro-sumti: there exists something 2 (usually restricted).
event contour for a temporary halt and ensuing pause in a process.
pro-sumti: a near future utterance.
$x_1$ is denim of material $x_2$.
detri modal, 1st place (for letters) dated ... ; attaches date stamp.
binary mathematical operator: logarithm; [log/ln a to base b]; default base 10 or e.
pro-sumti: a recent utterance.
$x_1$ is a jicama of species/variety $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a tenth [1/10; $1*10^{-1}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
valsi.notes: (cf. grake, mitre, snidu, stero, delno, molro, kelvo, xampo, gradu. litce, merli, centi, dekto, femti, gigdo, gocti, gotro, kilto, megdo, mikri, milti, nanvi, petso, picti, terto, xatsi, xecto, xexso, zepti, zetro)

valsi.definition: $j_1$ is a ring on finger $j_2=d_1$.
$j_1=d_3$ points to $j_2$ (property) to audience $j_3$ with finger $x_4=d_1$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the finger/digit/toe [body-part] on limb/body site $x_{2}$ of body $x_{3}$; [metaphor: peninsula].
$g_1=c_1=d_2$ is a mitten of material $g_2$.
$c_1$ is a knuckle on limb $d_2$ of body $c_3=d_3$.
$l_1=d_3$ plucks $l_2$ at locus $l_3$.
$g_1$ is $g_2$ inch/inches (length unit).
pro-sumti: this utterance.
$x_{1}$ owes $x_{2}$ in debt/obligation to creditor $x_{3}$ in return for $x_{4}$ [service, loan]; $x_{1}$ is a debtor.
$s_1=d_1$ wagers $d_2$ to creditor $d_3$ on $s_2$ (du'u).
$z_3$ is the interest on debt $z_1=d_2$ of debtor $d_1$ to creditor $d_3$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ (default 1) local volume unit(s) [non-metric; e.g. bushel], standard $x_{3}$, $x_{4}$ subunits.
valsi.notes: Gallon (= {likydekpu}), quart (= {likseldekpu}), barrel (wet = likybradekpu, dry = sudbradekpu), bushel (= {sudydekpu}), peck (= {sudyseldekpu}), cupful (= {kabrydekpu}), tablespoon (= {mucydekpu}); teaspoon (= {mucyseldekpu}); (all of these lujvo may need gic- to distinguish the English measurement system in contrasting with some local system; the English system is otherwise presumed to be the default non-metric system). (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {canlu}, {litce}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is ten [10; $1*10^1$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_1$ is a dolphin of species/breed $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ candela [metric unit] in luminosity (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a bean/pea/leguminous seed from plant [legume] $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a garbanzo/chickpea of species/variety $x_2$.
$c_1=d_1$ pours to $c_2$ from $c_3$. $c_1=d_1$ is torrential rainfall.
$r_1$ (event/state) compacts/compresses/concentrates/packs/condenses $x_2=d_1$ in property $x_3=d_2$ (ka) at location/locus $x_4=d_3$.
$d_1=s_1$ is a bush of species/strain/cultivar $s_2$.
$z_1$ crouches/cowers/squats on surface $z_2$.
$b_1$ is a toothbrush with bristles $b_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the tooth [body-part] of $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is dental.
$c_1=d_2$ has a toothache in tooth $d_1=c_2$.
$g_1$ (agent) brushes/cleans the teeth of $d_2$.
$x_{1}$ is dense/concentrated/packed/intense in property $x_{2}$ (ka) at location/locus $x_{3}$.
$m_1$ is a dentist treating patient $m_2$ with dentistry $m_4$.
$x_{1}$ awaits/waits/pauses for/until $x_{2}$ at state $x_{3}$ before starting/continuing $x_{4}$ (activity/process).
valsi.notes: ($x_2$ is an event, usually a point event); also: resuming $x_4$. See also {dicra}, {fanmo}, {sisti}, {fliba}, {pandi}.

valsi.definition: letteral: Lojban "." character.
$p_1$ is a quantity of tooth-paste, of composition $p_2$.
$x_1$ is the gum/cementum of animal $x_2$.
$m_1$ is a periodontist treating patient(s) $m_2$ for ailment $m_3$ involving cure $m_4$.
$s_1=d_2$ is a zip fastener for sealing $s_2$ by mechanism $d_1$.
$c_1$ feels patience about $c_3$.
$k_1$ is a waiting room/break room in structure $x_2$ surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor $x_3$ (mass/jo'u).
$x_1$ causes $x_2$ to wait for $x_3$ at $x_4$ before continuing $x_5$.
$s_1$ is a hesitation sound produced by $s_2=d_1$ while for/until $d_2$ at state $d_3$ before starting/continuing $d_4$ (activity/process).
$s_1$ is a waiting room/place where $d_1$ waits for $d_2$.
$j_1=d_1$ is patient, unyielding to force $j_2=d_2$ under condition $j_3=d_3$.
$p_1$ is a waiting queue ordered by rules $p_2$ on unordered set $p_3$ waiting for $x_4=d_2$.
$b_1$ initially grows $b_2$ beyond the soil; $b_1$ sprouts $b_2$ from the ground.
$x_1$ is a peanut of variety $x_2$.
$j_1$ sprouts from $x_2=d_1$.
$x_1$ is geosmin.
$s_1$ buries/sinks/embeds $s_2$ in ground $s_3=d_1$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of dirt/soil/earth/ground from source $x_{2}$ of composition $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ is earthen; $x_3$: composition including $x_3$, which need not be exhaustive of composition. See also {kliti}, {terdi}, {loldi}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a heap/pile/stack/mound/hill of materials $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ shakes/quakes/trembles/quivers/shudders/wobbles/vibrates from force $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Also (expressible either with desku or slilu): side to side, to and fro, back and forth, reciprocal motion. See also {slilu}, {janbe}.

valsi.definition: $m_1$ is a vibrator/vibrating device for use/function $m_2$.
valsi.notes: not necessarily sex toy; could for example also be a "Jumping Jack" compactor; Cf. {runpinji}, {gletci}. See {xremi'i} for shaking machines with the purpose of mixing.

valsi.definition: $g_1$ (person/agent) shakes $x_2=d_1$.
$x_1$ is a calendar showing dates $x_2$ and events $x_3$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$ is normally a time interval; see {detci'e}

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a calendar with rules $x_2$, days/weeks/months/years $x_3$, and properties $x_4$.
valsi.notes: e.g. Gregorian calendar, Hebrew calendar; see {detcartu}

valsi.definition: $x_1$ allows copying/has copyright of $x_2$ under conditions $x_3$ dated $x_4$.
$k_1$ (event) is the anniversary of $k_2$, recurring for the $k_3$'rd time on date $x_4=d_2$ at location $x_5=d_3$ by calendar $x_6=d_4$.
$x_{1}$ is the date [day,{week},{month},year] of event/state $x_{2}$, at location $x_{3}$, by the Gregorian calendar.
$x_{1}$ is the date [day,{week},{month},year] of event/state $x_{2}$, at location $x_{3}$, by calendar $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: (time units in $x_1$ are specified as numbers separated by pi'e or are unit values massified with joi); See also cmavo list {de'i}, {djedi}, {jeftu}, {masti}, {nanca}, {tcika}.

valsi.definition: $g_1$ schedules time $t_1$[hours, {minutes}, {seconds}] and date $d_1$[day,{week},{month},year] for event $t_2=d_2$ at location $d_3$.
logically quantified existential pro-sumti: there exists something 3 (usually restricted).
event contour for resumption of a paused process.
vocative: well-wish - curse
valsi.notes: Used to express well-wishes/curses. See also {dimna}, {dapma}, {ki'e}, {doi}

valsi.definition: pro-sumti: the next utterance.
tense interval modifier: regularly; subjective tense/modal; defaults as time tense.
tense interval modifier: irregularly/aperiodically; tense/modal; defaults as time tense.
diklo modal, 1st place at the locus of ...
pro-sumti: the last utterance.
$t_1=d_1$ is dearest/most precious to $d_2$ among set/range $x_3=t_4$.
$f_1=d_1$ is an electrical current / flow in / on / through $f_2 = d_2$ flowing in direction to / towards $f_3$ from direction/source $f_4$.

$c_1$ is a transistor / electrical regulator which allows electric current $c_2 = df_1$ to flow under conditions $c_3$ in / on / through $df_2$ flowing in direction to / towards $df_3$ from direction/source $df_4$.
$x_{1}$ is an electron.
$x_{1}$ (event) interrupts/stops/halts/[disrupts] $x_{2}$ (object/event/process) due to quality $x_{3}$.
$g_3=d_2$ is an electric lamp illuminating $g_2$ with light $g_1$.
$d_1=c_1$ is electrically uncharged.
$s_2$ is a loudspeaker emitting sound $_1$.
$s_1$ is a battery in containment $s_3$.
$k_1$ is a dropstone/stalagmite/stalactite/icicle/rusticle of material $k_2=s_2=d_2$.
$b_1$ is outdoors.
$p_1$ is a plaza managed by community/polity/company $p_2$ for purpose $p_3$.
$s_1$ is a story/level/floor of building $x_2=s_3=d_1$.
$x_{1}$ is electricity [electric charge or current] in/on $x_{2}$ of polarity/quantity $x_{3}$ (def. negative).
valsi.notes: ($x_3$, a quantifier, can be expressed as a simple polarity using the numerals for positive and negative ma'u and ni'u); (explicitly) negative (= {dutydikca}), positive (= {mardikca}); current (= (sel)muvdikca; again default negative/electron current), charge (= {klodikca}, {stadikca}). See also {lindi}, {xampo}, {flecu}, {maksi}, {tcana}.

valsi.definition: $c_1$ consumes $c_2$ as part of their staple diet.
$p_1$ regularly pays salary $p_2$ to $p_3$ for goods/services $p_4$.
$x_{1}$ is local to $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is confined to locus $x_{2}$ within range $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is regional
valsi.notes: Indicates a specific location/value within a range; e.g. a hits b. What is the locality on b that a hits? Thus $x_1$ is associated with a specific narrow region/interval $x_2$ of wider space/range $x_3$. See also cmavo list {di'o}, {jibni}, {zvati}, {cpana}, {nenri}, {lamji}, {stuzi}, {tcila}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is regular/cyclical/periodic in property (ka)/activity $x_{2}$ with period/interval $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quotient of '$x_{2}$/$x_{3}$' [dividend $x_{2}$ divided by divisor $x_{3}$], leaving remainder $x_{4}$.
Dilli.
$x_{1}$ is a cloud/mass of clouds of material $x_{2}$ in air mass $x_{3}$ at floor/base elevation $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a fate/destiny of $x_{2}$; [doom, curse are mabla-forms]; $x_{2}$ is fated/predestined/doomed to $x_{1}$.
$c_1$ is a monetary affair involving $c_2$
$jb_1$ borrows money $jb_2=jd_1$ from $jb_3$ for interval $jb_4$.
$x_{1}$ is a building/edifice for purpose $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a nail/tack [pointed driven/frictional fastener] of type/size $x_{2}$ (ka), made of material $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: ($x_2$ also can be ni abstraction); See also {pijne}, {lasna}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a rivet of type $x_2$ made of $x_3$
$x_1$ is a dinosaur of type $x_2$ living in era $x_3$.
$g_1$ is a/the industry sector in which $s_1$ provides financial services $g_2=s_3$ to $s_2$ by process $g_3$
$s_1$ is a treasury of money $d_1=s_2$.
$c_1$ is a/the financial management function/activities involving persons $c_2=ji_1$, of money/currency issued by $jd_2$; $c_1$ is finance.
$c_1$ is an/the accounting function/activities involving persons $c_2$, using currency issued by $j_2$, recording $v_2$ (data/facts/du'u) about $v_3$ (object/event); $c_1$ is accounting.
$x_{1}$ is dear/precious/darling to $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is emotionally valued by $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: $x_1$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= posydirba for unambiguous {semantics}). See also {tcika}, {kargu}, {vamji}, {vajni}, {pleji}, {jadni}, {jemna}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ radiates/emits $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is radium.
$x_{1}$ is a drop [small, cohesive shape] of material [liquid/vapor] $x_{2}$ in surrounding material $x_{3}$.
$t_1$ is an interrupt causing $d_1$ to happen, interrupting $d_2$ due to quality $d_3$, hooked onto conditions $t_3$.
$x_1$ is the time-duration/interval/period/[elapsed time] of event $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is low/down/downward in frame of reference $x_{2}$ as compared with baseline/standard height $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also lower; $x_3$ is generally some defined distance above a zero point/baseline, or is that baseline itself. See also {cnita}, {galtu}, {gapru}, {farna}, {loldi}.

valsi.definition: Algeria.
$b_1$ is a waiter, carrying food $c_1=b_2$ to $b_3$ from $b_4$ over path $b_5$.
$p_1=b_1$ is a waitress/waiter serving food $b_2=c_1$ to $x_3=c_2=b_3$.
$cip_1=cid_1$ is an edible bird of species $cip_2$.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity/expanse of water; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is aqueous/[aquatic].
$g_1=c_1$ is grain from plant/species $g_2$, edible/giving nutrition to $x_3=c_2$.
Jakarta
$r_1=c_1$ (food) is digested in solvent $r_2$.
$g_1=c_2$ digests food $x_2=r_1=c_1$ in solvent $x_3=r_2$.
$ra_1$ is a stomach/digestive organ of body/species $ra_2=c_2$ for digesting food/feed/nutriment $x_3=ru_1=c_1$.
$x_1=cr_2$ is a crop/harvest, harvested by $x_2=cr_1$, for use as food $x_3=ci_1$, to be eaten by $x_4=ci_2$.
$s_1$ is a morsel/piece of food $s_1=c_1$ for $x_3=c_2$.
$g_1$ is $g_2$ joule(s) of energy (default is 1) by standard $g_3$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ full days in duration (default is 1 day) by standard $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is diurnal.
$k_1$ is a daily newspaper with content $k_2$ published by $k_3$ for audience $k_4$.
$x_{1}$ desires/wants/wishes $x_{2}$ (event/state) for purpose $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: If desire is for an object, this is sumti-raising; use tu'a in $x_2$ (or use lujvo = po'edji). See also {taske}, {xagji}, {mukti}, {nitcu}, {nelci}, {pacna}, {prami}, {rigni}, {trina}, {xebni}, {xlura}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a ring/annulus/torus/circle [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$, inside diam. $x_{3}$, outside diam. $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also ellipse, oval (= {jincla}); (usage has been for near-circles, such as tight spirals, even if not closed loops). Also band, belt, encircle (= {jinsru}). See also {clupa}, {cukla}, {dasri}, {karli}, {sovda}, {sruri}, {konju}.

valsi.definition: Jyoti.
$x_1=d_1=c_1$ wants to say/express $x_2=c_2$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) for audience $x_3=c_3$ via expressive medium $x_4=c_4$, and this is desired for purpose $x_5=d_3$.
valsi.notes: Generally used to correct another's perceived mistake, i.e. "mi klami" followed by ".i pe'i du djisku zo klama". See also {djica}, {cusku}.

valsi.definition: $m_1=b_1$ is the Saudi Arabic language used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$x_1$ is a quantity of yogurt made from $x_2$ milk by process $x_3$.
China.
$x_{1}$ knows fact(s) $x_{2}$ (du'u) about subject $x_{3}$ by epistemology $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place; know how to - implying knowledge of method but not necessarily having the ability to practice (= {tadjyju'o}). (cf. know/familiar with: se slabu, na'e cnino, na'e fange; cmavo list du'o, cilre, certu, facki, jijnu, jimpe, senpi, smadi, kakne, birti, mipri, morji, saske, viska)

valsi.definition: $n_1$ is an instruction/advice from $x_2=n_3$ to help/assist/aid $x_3=s_2=n_4$ do/achieve/maintain event/activity $x_4=s_3$.
pro-sumti: you listener(s); identified by vocative.
discursive: generously - parsimoniously.
discursive: generously - parsimoniously.
elliptical/unspecified modal.
pro-sumti: elliptical/unspecified utterance variable.
pro-sumti: you the listener & others unspecified.
elidable terminator: end vocative (often elidable).
generic vocative marker; identifies intended listener; elidable after COI.
generic vocative address to intended listener;.
$c_1$ is a second person pronoun in language $c_4$.
$x_{1}$ is the daytime of day $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is diurnal (vs. nocturnal).
$x_1$ is a gazelle of species $x_2$.
$m_1$ is the noon (midday) of day $d_2$ at location $d_3$.
$b_1$ is later than noon of day $d_2$ at location $d_3$.
$s_1$ (mass) is a lunch composed of dishes including $s_2$.
$x_{1}$ reflects German/Germanic culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$d_1=b_1$ is the German used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$g_1$ is Germany.
$x_{1}$ is a drama/play about $x_{2}$ [plot/theme/subject] by dramatist $x_{3}$ for audience $x_{4}$ with actors $x_{5}$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$ may also be a convention. See also {finti}, {cukta}, {lisri}, {cfika}.

valsi.definition: $di_1$ is a theater for performing plays with theme $di_2=dr_2$ for audience $x_3=dr_4$ with actors $x_4=dr_5$.
$x_1=d_1=k_1$ is a role-player / player of role playing game / RPG / LARP or dramatic / acting game $x_2=d_5=k_2$ about $x_3=d_2$ created by author/ company $x_4=d_3$ for audience $x_5=d_4$.
valsi.notes: Audience defaults to the players themselves. See also {draci}, {kelci}, {dracyselkei}.

valsi.definition: $x_1=d_1=sk_1$ is a role-playing game/ RPG/ LARP or dramatic/ acting game played by performer(s)/ player(s) $x_2=d_5=sk_2$ about $x_3=d_2$ created by author/ company $x_4=d_3$ for audience $x_5=d_4$ .
valsi.notes: Audience defaults to the players themselves. See also {draci}, {kelci}, {dracykei}.

valsi.definition: $g_1$ (event) corrects $g_2$ into $g_3=d_1$, correct in property/aspect $x_4=d_2$ (ka) in situation $x_5=d_3$ by standard $x_6=d_4$.
$g_1$ (person/agent) corrects $d_1$.
$x_{1}$ is correct/proper/right/perfect in property/aspect $x_{2}$ (ka) in situation $x_{3}$ by standard $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ isn't the-same-thing-as/is different-from/other-than $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is something else.
Dresden.
$g_1$ comforts $j_1=b_1$ about $b_2$
$x_1$ is an albatross [member of the family Diomedeidae] of species/breed $x_2$
$x_{1}$ is a roof/top/ceiling/lid of $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: (cf. bitmu, stedu, galtu, gapru, loldi, marbi, gacri, mapku; a drudi is (designed to be) over/above something and shelters it from other things above the drudi, mapku)

valsi.definition: identity selbri; = sign; $x_{1}$ identically equals $x_{2}$, $x_{3}$, etc.; attached sumti refer to same thing.
location tense relation/direction; east of.
digit/number: too many; subjective.
quantifier selbri: convert too many to cardinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is a set with too many members $x_{2}$.
tense interval modifier: too many times objective tense, defaults as time tense.
dunli modal, 1st place (equalled by) equally; as much as ...
djuno modal, 1st place (info source) authoritatively; according to ...; known by ...
abstractor: predication/bridi abstractor; $x_{1}$ is predication [bridi] expressed in sentence $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is the logarithm of $x_{2}$ with base $x_{3}$.
$m_1$ is a freezer/freezing machine for freezing $x_2=d_1$ at temperature $x_3$.
$x_1=d_1=c_1$ is a quantity of amber (fossilized resin) of plants $x_2=c_2=t_1$
valsi.notes: Good quality amber is used for the manufacture of ornamental objects and jewelry. Although not mineralized, it is often classified as a gemstone. See also {ricyblu}.

valsi.definition: $x_1=d_1=r_1$ is a fossil of type/composition/traces $x_2=r_2$ from location $x_3=r_3$
valsi.notes: Preserved remains or traces of animals, plants, and other organisms may be expressed as x2.

valsi.definition: $k_1$ is a cooling room for cooling $x_2=d_1$ at temperature $x_3=d_2$.
$r_1$ (event/state) anguishes/causes distress to $x_2=d_1$.
$x_{1}$ is an excess of/too much of $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is polar opposite from/contrary to $x_{2}$ in property/on scale $x_{3}$ (property/si'o).
Danube.
$x_{1}$ [donor] gives/donates gift/present $x_{2}$ to recipient/beneficiary $x_{3}$ [without payment/exchange].
valsi.notes: Also grants; $x_3$ is a receiver (= terdu'a for reordered places); the Lojban doesn't distinguish between or imply possession transfer or sharing; $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posydu'a}, posyseldu'a for unambiguous {semantics}). See also {benji}, {muvdu}, {canja}, {pleji}, {vecnu}, {friti}, {sfasa}, {dapma}, {cnemu}, {prali}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ freezes/jells/solidifies at temperature $x_{2}$ and pressure $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is anguished/distressed/emotionally wrought/stressed by $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is an equivalence class within $x_2$ defined by equivalence relation $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is equal/congruent to/as much as $x_{2}$ in property/dimension/quantity $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Same in quantity/quality (not necessarily in identity); 'analogy' may be expressed as the equivalence of two properties of similarity (ka $x_1$ simsa $x_2$) and (ka $x_3$ simsa $x_4$). See also cmavo list {du'i}, {satci}, {frica}, {simsa}, {mintu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is winter/wintertime [cold season] of year $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is a douroucouli of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is satiated/overwhelmed by $x_2$ with property $x_3$ by standard $x_4$; $x_2$ is too much for $x_1$ in property $x_3$ by standard $x_4$.
$p_1$ is prejudiced about matter $p_2$ (abstract).
$t_1$ is exhausted by effort/situation $t_2$ (event).
$c_1$ is heterosexual/bisexual in situation $c_2$ by standard $c_4$.
$x_{1}$ is the trigonometric cosine of angle/arccosine $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is October/tenth month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
valsi.notes: Note: Based on experimental rafsi for {dau} (duv). Use with caution. Alternative: {pavnonma'i}

valsi.definition: letteral for d.
$s_1=d_2=l_2$ is a conservative in beliefs $l_3$ against opposition $s_3$ by means $s_4$
$si_1$ is a conservative political ideology as applied by $t_1=sa_1=d_2=l_2$ among/in people/territory/domain $t_2$ based on the works of thinker $si_3$
$s_1=d_1$ is Celtic in aspect $s_2$.
$x_{1}$ is an elder/ancestor of $x_{2}$ by bond/tie/degree $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$'s generation precedes $x_{2}$'s parents.
Antarctic Ocean.
$x_{1}$ reflects Antarctican culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a bass instrument (bass guitar, contrabass, bass horn, keyboard bass, washtub bass) of type $x_2$
$t_1=d_1$ is a shrub/bush of species $t_2$.
$x_1$ is tares of species/variety $x_2$.
$g_1$ is a walking stick of material $g_2$.
$k_1=c_2$ is a footpath at $k_2$ accessing $k_3$.
logical connective: sumti afterthought and.
attitudinal: granting permission - prohibiting.
attitudinal: permission - prohibition.
attitudinal: competence - incompetence/inability.
attitudinal: competence - incompetence/inability.
attitudinal: feeling constraint - independence - challenge/resistance against constraint.
attitudinal: feeling constraint - independence - challenge/resistance against constraint.
attitudinal: feeling constraint - independence - challenge/resistance against constraint.
