attitudinal: request - negative request.
attitudinal: suggestion - abandon suggest - warning.
attitudinal: suggestion - abandon suggest - warning.
attitudinal: suggestion - abandon suggest - warning.
letteral for e.
attitudinal: obligation - freedom.
attitudinal: obligation - freedom.
logical connective: sumti afterthought x but not y.
$g_1$ is $g_2$ henry/henries of inductance (default is 1) by standard $g_3$.
$x_1$ in an enzyme that catalyzes chemical reactions $x_2$.
Eris
$x_1$ is a hedgehog of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a pike of species/breed $x_2$
$g_1$ is $g_2$ hertz of frequency (default is 1) by standard $g_3$.
Esperanto
$x_1$ is an ester derived from acid $x_2$ and alcohol $x_3$
sumti place tag: tag 1st sumti place.
location tense relation/direction; arriving at/directly towards ...
fatne modal, 1st place backwards; reverse of ...
unary mathematical operator: reciprocal; multiplicative inverse; [1/a].
$g_1$ reveals to $f_1$ $f_2$ (du'u) about subject/object $f_3$
unconditional end of text; outside regular grammar; used for computer input.
$x_1$ is the terminator of structure originated by selma'o $x_2$ in language $x_3$.
non-logical connective: respectively; unmixed ordered distributed association.
$x_{1}$ discovers/finds out $x_{2}$ (du'u) about subject/object $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ finds (fi) $x_{3}$ (object).
$x_{1}$ [member] is ordinary/common/typical/usual in property $x_{2}$ (ka) among members of $x_{3}$ (set).
valsi.notes: Also: $x_2$ is a normal/common/ordinary/typical property among set $x_3$ (= selterfadni for reordered places); also regular, (mabla forms:) banal, trite, vulgar; ($x_3$ is complete set). See also {cafne}, {rirci}, {kampu}, {lakne}, {tcaci}, {cnano}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is Tuesday of week $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$.
$x_1$ is firethorn of species/variety $x_2$.
$f_1$=$c_1$ is a volcano projecting from land mass $c_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a fire/flame in fuel $x_{2}$ burning-in/reacting-with oxidizer $x_{3}$ (default air/oxygen).
$x_1$ is a tool for starting fire $x_2$. $x_1$ is a lighter such as for cigarettes.
$x_1=fe_1$ is the ashes of $x_3=fa_2$, combusted by fire $x_2=fa_1$.
$s_1$ is/appears to be of ash color/hue as perceived/seen by $x_2=s_3$ under conditions $x_3=s_4$.
$k_1$ is a spark of fire $x_2=f_1$.
$g_1$ extinguishes/puts out fire $x_2=s_1=f_1$.
$x_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of charcoal from source $x_2$
$x_1=g_3$ is a torch illuminating $g_2$ with fuel $x_3=f_2$ reacting with oxydizer $x_4=f_3$ (default air/oxygen).
sumti place tag: tag a sumti moved out of numbered place structure; used in modal conversions.
Fido.
$b_1$ distributes $b_2$ to $b_3$ from $b_4$ over path $b_5$. $b_1$ is a distributor.
$c_1$ is/are a/the function/activities involving persons $c_2 $ distributing $f_1$ among/to $f_2$; $c_1$ is distribution
valsi.notes: C.f. {fatri}, {cuntu}, {selvensro}, {terzbasro}, {vencu'u}, {zbacu'u}, {dintrocu'u}, {dinveicu'u}. In a company, this may be referred to as logistics or channel management.

valsi.definition: $s_1$ is a socialist ideology as applied by $t_1$ in/among people/territory/domain $t_2=f_2$ based on the works of thinker $s_3$
$p_1=f1$ is/are the profit/dividends shared/distributed from the earnings of company/corporation/firm $p_2$ among $f_2$ with shares/portions $f_3$.
$b_1$ is a parachute of type/material $b_2$.
$c_1$ (agent) drops $f_1$ to $f_2$ from $f_3$.
$g_1$ makes $f_1$ fall.
$x_1$ is a falcon (genus 'falco').
$x_{1}$ is a sail for gathering propelling material $x_{2}$ on vehicle/motor $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is the factorial of $x_2$.
$c_1$ (agent) concludes by expressing/saying $c_2=f_1$ for/to audience $c_3$ via expressive medium $c_4$ concluding $f_2$.
$x_{1}$ is an aunt/uncle of $x_{2}$ by bond/tie $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is an associated member of $x_{2}$'s parent's generation.
$c_1$ is a terminator of class/part-of-speech $c_2$ in language $c_3$.
$b_1$ is canvas of material $b_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a function/single-valued mapping from domain $x_{2}$ to range $x_{3}$ defined by expression/rule $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is alien/foreign/[exotic]/unfamiliar to $x_{2}$ in property $x_{3}$ (ka).
$k_1$ sails to destination $k_2$ from origin $k_3$ via route $k_4$ on sailing vehicle $k_5=f_3$.
$x_{1}$ is an end/finish/termination of thing/process $x_{2}$; [not necessarily implying completeness].
valsi.notes: $x_1$ is final/last/at the last; $x_1$ is a terminal/terminus of $x_2$; $x_1$ is the final/terminated state of terminated process $x_2$; $x_2$ terminates/ceases/stops/halts at $x_1$ (= selfa'o for reordered places). See also {krasi}, {cfari}, {mulno}, {sisti}, {denpa}, {jipno}, {kojna}, {traji}, {krasi}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a factory/foundry/industrial plant/mill producing $x_{2}$ from materials $x_{3}$.
$g_1$ is a/the manufacturing industry/sector, manufacturing/processing $g_2=f_2$ at factories/plants $f_1$ from materials $f_3$ using process $g_3$
$x_{1}$ prevents/keeps/stops/restrains/constrains event $x_{2}$ from occurring.
$x_{1}$ translates text/utterance $x_{2}$ to language $x_{3}$ from language $x_{4}$ with translation result $x_{5}$.
$x_{1}$ (event) annoys/irritates/bothers/distracts $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Also: is disruptive to. See also {fengu}, {raktu}, {dicra}, {tunta}, {zunti}, {jicla}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ opposes/balances/contends against opponent(s) $x_{2}$ (person/force ind./mass) about $x_{3}$ (abstract).
$c_1$ gets lost on the way to $f_2$ (object/event) in/near $f_3=c_3$
$x_1$=$d_1$ is the opposite direction from $x_3$=$f_3$ that $x_2$=$f_2$ is.
$g_1=f_3$ aims at $f_1$ with $f_2$ (object/event).
valsi.notes: $x_3$ can be $x_1$ itself or an extra object/event such as "weapon", "effort", etc. Cf. {farna}.

valsi.definition: $j_1$ shows the direction of $f_2$ (object/event) to audience $j_3$ from origin/in frame of reference $f_3$
$x_{1}$ falls/drops to $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ in gravity well/frame of reference $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Note: things can fall in spin, thrust, or tide as well as gravity; (agentive "drop" = one of two lujvo: falcru and falri'a). See also {lafti}, {cpare}, {klama}, {sfubu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is the direction of $x_{2}$ (object/event) from origin/in frame of reference $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$ is towards $x_1$ from $x_3$ (= selfa'a for reordered places). See also {zunle}, {pritu}, {galtu}, {gapru}, {cnita}, {dizlo}, {berti}, {snanu}, {stuna}, {stici}, {purci}, {balvi}, {lidne}.

valsi.definition: $s_1=f_3$ non-agentively/inanimately points at/directionally indicates $s_2=f_2$ to observer $s_3$ as being in the direction $f_1$.
valsi.notes: Direction (i.e. $x_4$) is relative to the $x_1$ place. Cf. {farja'o}, {degja'o}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ develops/evolves towards/into $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ through stages $x_{4}$.
$s_1=f_1$ reflects Breton culture/language in aspect $s_2=f_2$.
$x_{1}$ (event) is an event that happens/occurs/takes place; $x_{1}$ is an incident/happening/occurrence.
valsi.notes: (cf. cmavo list fau, krefu, lifri, fatci, rapli; gasnu, zukte, if specifically agentive, banli)

valsi.definition: $v_1$ is a verb meaning $v_2$ in language $v_3$.
$f_1=b_1$ is the French language used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$g_1=f_1$ is the country of France.
$x_{1}$ (du'u) is a fact/reality/truth/actuality, in the absolute.
$f_1 = k_1$ [sequence] is able to be / capable of being reversed from / into sequence $f_2$ by event $k_2$ under conditions $k_3$ (event / state).
$x_{1}$ [sequence] is in reverse order from $x_{2}$ [sequence]; $x_{1}$ (object) is inverted from $x_{2}$ (object).
valsi.notes: Also opposite (one sense). See also cmavo list {fa'e}, {dukti}.

valsi.definition: $s_1$ implodes into pieces/energy/fragments $s_2$.
$x_{1}$ is distributed/allotted/allocated/shared among $x_{2}$ with shares/portions $x_{3}$; ($x_{2}$/$x_{3}$ fa'u).
valsi.notes: Also spread, shared out, apportioned; agentive distribution (= {fairgau}, {fairzu'e}). See also cmavo list {fa'u}, {fendi}, {preja}, {katna}, {tcana}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ (me'o) is the p-adic representation of number $x_2$ in base $x_3$.
valsi.notes: can be infinitely long to the left but not the right; for repeating p-adics ({krefu} fatysaclu) use {ra'e} before {pi}

valsi.definition: fasnu modal, 1st place (non-causal) in the event of ...
$f_1$ is an event that has time/temporal duration $t_1$ ranging from starting time/event $t_2$ to ending time/event $t_3$.
$g_1$ develops $f_1$ into $f_2$ from $f_3$ through stages $f_4$.
$t_1$ is a developmental / evolutionary stage / state of $t_2 = f_1$ in its development towards / into $f_2$ from $f_3$ through stages $f_4$.
valsi.notes: First place is intended for things like software version numbers. See also {favytcinymupli} (which is how you talk about actual things that have a version associated with them). Made from {farvi} + {tcini}.

valsi.definition: $m_1$ is an example/instance of developmental/evolutionary stage/state $m_2=t_1$ of developing thing $t_2=f_1$ in its development towards/into $f_2$ from $f_3$ through stages $f_4=m_3$.
valsi.notes: Someone causing the development is neither implied nor denied; hence this word can be used both for Darwinian evolution and software development. Made from {favytcini} + {mupli}.

valsi.definition: $t_1$ chatters/gossips to $t_2=f_2$ about subject $t_3$ in language $t_4$.
sumti place tag: tag 2nd sumti place.
binary mathematical operator: nth root of; inverse power [a to the 1/b power].
mark space interval distributive aspects; labels interval tense modifiers as location-oriented.
location event contour tense: perfective in space; beyond the place of ...
location event contour tense: continuative in space; throughout the place of ...
location event contour tense: initiative in space; on this edge of ...
location event contour tense: achievative in space; at the point of ...
location event contour tense: completive in space; at the far end of ...
location tense interval modifier: never in space; objectively quantified tense.
location event contour tense: anticipative in space; up to the edge of ...
location tense interval modifier: always in space; objectively quantified tense.
location event contour tense: superfective in space; continuing too far beyond ...
n-ary mathematical operator: divided by; division operator; [(((a / b) / c) / ...)].
vocative: over and out (end discussion).
elidable terminator: end nonce conversion of selbri to modal; usually elidable.
$g_1$ (person/agent) boils $x_2=f_1$ at temperature $x_3=f_2$ and pressure $x_4=f_3$.
$x_{1}$ boils/evaporates at temperature $x_{2}$ and pressure $x_{3}$.
$b_1=f_1$ roars/snarls/growls angrily sound $b_2$ at $f_2$ because of $f_3$ (action/state/property).
$m_1=f_1=b_1$ grumbles with sound $b_2$ at $f_2$ because of $f_3$ (action/state/property).
valsi.notes: jvajvo definition; Gismu deep structure is "milxe le ka fengu kei gi'e bacru"

valsi.definition: $r_1$ (event) angers $f_1$.
$f_1=c_1$ is without anger/mild/meek regarding $f_2$ for $f_3$ (action/state/property).
digit/number: hex digit B (decimal 11) [eleven].
November.
$x_1=m_1$ is November of year $x_2=m_2$ in calendar $x_3=m_3$.
$x_1$ is November/eleventh month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
valsi.notes: Note: Based on experimental rafsi for {fei} (fel). Use with caution. Alternative: {pavypavma'i}

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is $10^{-15}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ (agent) divides/partitions/separates $x_{2}$ into sections/parts/ind. $x_{3}$ by method/partition $x_{4}$.
$m_1$ is a sewing pattern of forms $m_2$ according to structure $m_3$.
$x_{1}$ is angry/mad at $x_{2}$ for $x_{3}$ (action/state/property).
$x_{1}$ (action/event) is crazy/insane/mad/frantic/in a frenzy (one sense) by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a crack/fissure/pass/cleft/ravine/chasm/[defect/flaw] [shape/form] in $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ sews/stitches/sutures materials $x_{2}$ (ind./set) together with tool(s) $x_{3}$, using filament $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: ($x_2$ if a set must be a complete specification); See also {cilta}, {jivbu}, {jorne}, {nivji}, {pijne}, {lasna}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is measured in kopeck/cent money-subunits as $x_{2}$ [quantity], in monetary system $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also pfennig, paisa, sen, fen, dinar, etc.; $x_1$ is generally a price/cost/value. (additional secondary, tertiary, etc. subunit places may be added as $x_4$, $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {sicni}, {jdini}, {jdima}, {vecnu}, {rupnu}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a/the lung [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: breathing/respiratory apparatus/bellows].
$s_1$ is a cent coin issued by $s_2$ in monetary system $f_3$.
$x_{1}$ is fertile/conducive for supporting the growth/development of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is fruitful/prolific.
valsi.notes: Also fecund (note that the Lojban covers both potential and actual/realized fertility). See also {vanbi}, {sidju}, {rorci}, {farvi}, {banro}, {cange}.

valsi.definition: $x_1=f_2=c_1=$ abandons / forsakes / leaves behind $x_2=f_1=c_2$
$x_{1}$(s) is/are waste product(s) [left to waste] by $x_{2}$ (event/activity).
valsi.notes: Also shit, crap; agentive wasting (= {fesygau}, {fesyzu'e}). See also {xaksu}, {kalci}, {pinca}.

valsi.definition: $c_1$ is a goddess of people(s)/religion $c_2$ with dominion over $c_3$ [sphere].
$c_1$ is gynophilous/bisexual/straight male/lesbian in situation $c_2$ by standard $c_4$.
valsi.notes: This word is only about sexual interest in females; other sexual interests are irrelevant. Cf. {nakcinse}, {fetfetcinse}, {mitcinse}, {dutcinse}.

valsi.definition: $c_1=f_1$ is female and gynophilous/gay/bisexual in situation $c_2$ by standard $c_4$
valsi.notes: This word is about female homosexuality and bisexuality. See also {fetcinse}, {naknakcinse}, {mitcinse}, {relcinse}.

valsi.definition: $f_1=n_1$ is an unmarried woman under law/custom/tradition $s_3$.
$p_1$ is the clitoris of $p_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a female/doe of species $x_{2}$ evidencing feminine trait(s) $x_{3}$ (ka); $x_{1}$ is feminine.
$x_1$ is a wife of $x_2$ (husband) according to marriage tradition/custom/law $x_3$.
$t_1$ is a matriarch of people/territory/domain/subjects $t_2$.
$x_1$ is an ovary of $x_2$.
sumti place tag: tag 3rd sumti place.
sumti place tag: place structure number/tag question.
finti modal, 1st place (creator) created by ...
vocative: hospitality - inhospitality; you are welcome/ make yourself at home.
vocative: hospitality - inhospitality.
convert selbri to nonce modal/sumti tag.
$xr_1$ is a guineafowl of species/breed $xr_2$
digit/number: fraction slash; default "/n" => 1/n, "n/" => n/1, or "/" alone => golden ratio.
half.
$g_1$ [person/agent] confuses $c_1$ (event/state) for $c_2$ [observer] due to [confusing] property $c_3$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ is a fig [fruit/tree] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$cu_1=cf_1$ is a fictional book about plot/theme/subject $cf_1$ by author $cu_3=cf_3$ for audience $cu_4$ preserved in medium $cu_5$.
$x_1$ is a fern of family/genus/species $x_2$.
$g_1$ [person/agent] causes $f_1$ to be easy for $f_2$ under condition(s) $f_3$.
$z_1=f_1$ (action) is easier than $z_2$ (action) for $x_3=f_2$ (agent) by amount $z_4$ under conditions $x_5=f_3$.
$r_1$ [event/state] causes $f_1$ to be easy for $f_2$ under condition(s) $f_3$.

valsi.notes: From {frili}+{smuni}. The $x_1$ of {frili} is subsumed into the overall sense of the word. See also: {filseljmi}, {klina}.

valsi.notes: $x_2$ is the noun phrase/sumti without the article/descriptor; description (($x_1$ with $x_2$) = gadysu'i); note: 'determiner' has become the accepted general linguistics term, displacing 'article'; however, 'determiner' includes all words that can introduce a noun phrase/sumti, whether a description or not, such as pronoun possessives like lemi, quantifiers (especially in indefinites) like ci and su'o, and demonstratives like ti, ta, and tu; the term 'descriptor' in Lojban, is limited to words that introduce descriptions (excluding indefinites), such as those of selma'o LA and LE, their common compounds such as lemi, and possibly lenu. 'article' typically refers only to a single word; Lojban assumes the broader meaning] See also {valsi}, {cmavo}.

See also {pencu}, {sanji}, {viska}, {sumne}, {tirna}, {zgana}, {canci}, {simlu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is narrow in dimension $x_{2}$ [2nd most significant dimension] by standard $x_{3}$.
$p_1=j_1$ is cardboard from source $p_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a passport issued to $x_{2}$ (person) by authority $x_{3}$ allowing $x_{4}$ (activity).
$b_1$ is an embassy/consulate of $j_2$ at $b_3$.
$x_{1}$ is captain/commander/leader/in-charge/boss of vehicle/domain $x_{2}$.
digit/number: hex digit D (decimal 13) [thirteen].
$x_1$ is February of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$x_1$ is Wednesday of week $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$.
$v_1$ is a pipe carrying $v_2=f_2$ to $f_3$ from $f_4$
valsi.notes: fluid may be liquid or gas; see {datnyfle} for the computer metaphor

valsi.definition: $s_1$ irrigates/waters $s_3$
$p_1$ is a watering can used by $s_1$ to water/irrigate $s_3$ made of $p_3$
$m_1$ drowns in body of water $d_1$.
$x_{1}$ is a rule prescribing/mandating/requiring $x_{2}$ (event/state) within system/community $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Regulation, prescription (also $x_2$), principle, requirement (also $x_2$), prescribe, require (conditions are usually contained within $x_2$); $x_1$ is regulatory; $x_2$, $x_3$ are regulated. See also {flalu}, {ritli}, cmavo list {ja'i}, {marde}, {tcaci}, {tinbe}, {zekri}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a bomb/explosive device with explosive material/principle $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a berry (fruit/plant) of plant/species $x_{2}$.
$s_1$ is the birthday celebration of $x_2=j_1$ born at time $j_3$.
$x_{1}$ is born to $x_{2}$ at time $x_{3}$ [birthday] and place $x_{4}$ [birthplace]; $x_{1}$ is native to (fo) $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$ bears/gives birth to $x_1$; also $x_3$: natal day. See also {fange}, {gutra}, {rorci}, {mamta}, {salci}, {citsi}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (agent) borrows/temporarily takes/assumes $x_{2}$ (object) from source $x_{3}$ for interval $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Credit (= {jernu'e}); borrow/assume a property or quality as a chameleon does (= {zaskai}, {zasysmitra}, {zasysmitai}). See also {dejni}, {janta}, {zivle}.

valsi.definition: $b_1=j_1$ approaches/nears/draws nearer/closes in on $j_2$.
$k_1$ approaches $j_2$ from $k_3$ via route $k_4$ by means of transportation $k_5$.
$j_1=z_1$ is nearer/closer to $j_2$ than $x_3=z_2$ by amount $z_4$.
$x_{1}$ is between/among set of points/bounds/limits $x_{2}$ (set)/amidst mass $x_{2}$ in property $x_{3}$ (ka).
valsi.notes: $x_2$ (a complete set, generally ordered) defines the bounds/limits/range for $x_1$. See also se {vasru}, {nenri}, {zvati}, {cpana}, {snuji}, {senta}, {bitmu}, {jimte}, {kuspe}, {jibni}, {lamji}, {sruri}, {vanbi}, {midju}, {cmima}, {setca}.

valsi.definition: $t_1=j_1$ is nearest/closest to $j_2$ in property/quantity $j_3$ (ka/ni).
$x_1$ is a neighbo(u)r of / living close/near to $x_2$.
$c_1=b_1$ converses orally in Lojban about subject $c_2$ using sound/expression $l_1=b_2$.
$l_1=b_1$ is Lojban used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$c_1$ is a Lojbanic community.
$l_1$ is Jbofihe.
valsi.notes: A computer program that parses Lojban text. Cf. {lojbo}, {finpe}, {genturfa'i}.

valsi.definition: $g_1$ is Lojban grammar for structure/text $g_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a Lojbanic group/organization with role/purpose/function $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is Lojbanistan / Lojbanic country of people $x_2$
$x_1$ is a boa of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a bonobo of species/breed $x_2$.
$n_1$ is Logfest.
$l_1=p_1$ uses Lojban for purpose $p_3$; $l_1=p_1$ is a Lojbanist.
$l_1=p_1$ is a Lojbanist in aspect $l_2$.
$c_1$ (mass normally, but 1 individual/jo'u possible) discuss(es)/talk(s) about topic/subject $c_2$ in Lojban.
$l_1=v_1$ is a child who is a native speaker of Lojban.
$lo_1=li_1$ is Jbovlaste.
valsi.notes: A web-based Lojban dictionary editing system, and the contents of its dictionary. Cf. {lojbo}, {valsi}, {liste}, {vlaste}, {vlacku}

valsi.definition: $b_1$ is a congregation of believers of religion $j_1$.
$x_1=c_1$ is a scripture/religious book of religion $x_4=c_4=l_2$ containing text $x_2=c_2$ written by $x_3=c_3$.
$s1$ pertains to religion of $s2=l2$
valsi.notes: Cultural gismu replacement lujvo for religions: From gismu {lijda} and {srana}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is firm/hard/resistant/unyielding to force $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
$c_2$ is a prayer of believer $c_1=l_2$ for deity $c_3$ in medium $c_4$ according to religion $l_3$.
$s_1$ is a paladin/holy warrior of army $s_2$, and with religion $l_1$.
$z_1$ is a sin/blasphemy according to religion $z_2=j_1$.
$x_1$ is a warning message to intended audience $x_2$ about danger $x_3$ from author $x_4$.
$x_{1}$ (person) decides/makes decision $x_{2}$ (du'u) about matter $x_{3}$ (event/state).
$x_{1}$ (experiencer) decreases/contracts/is reduced/diminished in property/quantity $x_{2}$ by amount $x_{3}$.
$g_1$ reduces $j_1$ in property/quantity $j_2$ by amount $j_3$.
$j_1$ is a dwarf planet revolving around $j_2$ with characteristics $j_3$, orbital parameters $j_4$.
valsi.notes: Cf. {jdika}, {plini}, {pluton}, {eris}, {cmaplini}, {plinycma}. In 2006, the International Astronomical Union (IAU)reduced the status of Pluto and Eris from 'planets' to a new category: 'dwarf planets'.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ [amount] is the price of $x_{2}$ to purchaser/consumer $x_{3}$ set by vendor $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posydi'a}, {posyseldi'a} for unambiguous semantics); price is something decided/set by the seller, and is closely akin to offer ({friti}), which is what a buyer may decide; (note that price is not he same as cost/expense, which is the actual amount exchanged in a transaction; the latter is {vecnu} or {canja}; neither is the same as "value" or {vamji}; in colloquial English, these are sometimes interchanged, at least partially because of the rarity of barter and bargaining in the marketplace). See also {canja}, {friti}, {janta}, {jdini}, {kargu}, {pleji}, {dapma}, {vamji} for 'value', ve {vecnu} for 'cost', {canja}, {fepni}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {pleji}, {prali}, {rupnu}, {sfasa}, {vamji}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is money/currency issued by $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is financial/monetary/pecuniary/fiscal.
valsi.notes: 'currency' sometimes is restricted to paper money (= {pledi'i}). See also {fepni}, {jdima}, {rupnu}, {sicni}, {canja}, {rupnu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of jelly/semisolid [texture] of material/composition including $x_{2}$.
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought and.
scalar affirmer; denies scalar negation: Indeed!.
vocative: roger (ack) - negative acknowledge; used to acknowledge offers and thanks.
vocative: roger (ack) - negative acknowledge; I didn't hear you.
$ji_1=je_3$ is a fountain expelling fluid $ji_2=je_2$ at location $ji_3$.
$c_1=j_3$ is a volcano projecting from land mass $c_2$.
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought conn question.
shift letterals to Hebrew alphabet.
discursive: truth - falsity.
discursive: truth - falsity.
$ja_1$ (agent) proves that $je_1$ (du'u) is true by standard/epistemology/metaphysics $je_2$ to audience $ja_3$
$x_1$ is political/pertains to the politics of territory/domain $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a polity/state governing territory/domain $x_{2}$; [government/territory relationship].
$x_1$ is the $x_3$ pole of $x_2$
$l_1$ is a meridian on celestial body/sphere $j_2$ (default Earth)
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ weeks in duration (default is 1 week) by standard $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Re. $x_3$, a week may be more or less than seven days, classically being tied to the time between trips to the marketplace; this week (= {cabjeftu}); next week (= {bavlamjeftu}); last week (= {prulamjeftu}). See also {detri}, {djedi}, {masti}, {nanca}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ pertains to the common Judeo-Christian-Moslem culture/religion/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
The Judeo-Christian-Muslim God.
abstractor: truth-value abstractor; $x_{1}$ is truth value of [bridi] under epistemology $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ burns/[ignites/is flammable/inflammable] at temperature $x_{2}$ in atmosphere $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Default $x_2$/$x_3$ to normal temperatures in air; ignite (= {jelcfa}), flammable/inflammable (usually = jelka'e or jelfrili). See also {fagri}, {kijno}, {sigja}, {livla}, {sacki}.

valsi.definition: $g_1$ burns $j_1$.
$n_1=j_1$ is toasted bread made from grain(s) $n_2$.
$d_1$ (event) burns down $x_2=j_1=d_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a gem/polished stone/pearl of type $x_{2}$ from gemstone/material/source $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also jewel (= {jmeja'i}); gemstone (= $x_2$, $x_3$, or jmero'i, jmekunra); pearl (= selcakyjme - a gem found inside a shell, tercakyjme - a gem made of shell material, boijme - any ball-shaped gem), mother-of-pearl (= {cakyjme}). See also {kunra}, {rokci}, {jadni}, {dirba}, {kargu}, {krili}, {pulji}.

valsi.definition: $z_1$ is a military base for armed forces $j_1$ serving group/community $j_2$ in function $j_3$.
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought x but not y.
$x_{1}$ (event) shocks/stuns $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an axle/spindle [tool] on which $x_{2}$ rotates, of material/properties $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (mass) is an army serving group/community $x_{2}$ (mass) in function $x_{3}$ (activity).
$x_1$ is sesame of species/variety $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ (agent/person) earns/[deserves/merits] wages/salary/pay $x_{2}$ for work/service $x_{3}$ (activity).
valsi.notes: Also $x_2$ earnings, reward (= zanseljerna or {nemjerna}), punishment/comeuppance (= {sfaseljerna}, {malseljerna}); $x_3$ behavior; job (= {terjerna}); $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posyjerna}, posyseljerna for unambiguous {semantics}). See also {jibri}, {pleji}, {vecnu}, {cnemu}, {canja}, {jdima}, {jinga}, {prali}, {sfasa}, {janta}, {kargu}, {vamji}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ chases/pursues/(physically) follows after $x_{2}$; volition is not implied for $x_{1}$ or $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Algerian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a needle [pointed shape/form, not tool] of material $x_{2}$.
$c_1$ is barbed wire.
$x_1$ is a hedgehog/spiny anteater of species $x_2$.
valsi.notes: general term for spiny mammals; see also {ernace}, {zalgosu}, {jesyratcu}

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a porcupine of species $x_2$.
$s_1$ is a cactus of species $s_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a jet [expelled stream] of material $x_{2}$ expelled from $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantum.
$x_1$ has truth-value $x_2$ under metaphysics $x_3$ on scale $x_4$.
$x_{1}$ (du'u) is true/truth by standard/epistemology/metaphysics $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place. See also {stace}, {jitfa}, {fatci}, {birti}, {cfika}.

valsi.definition: $p_1$ judges the veracity of $p_2=j_1$ by standard/epistemology/metaphysics $x_3=j_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the claw/nail/talon [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: pointed, penetrating, physical weapon].
$x_{1}$ is an angle [2-dimensional shape/form] from vertex $x_{2}$ subtended by lateral [segment] $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is angular; $x_2$ corner; (segment $x_3$ can be defined by interval). See also {kojna}, {linji}, {konju}, {mokca}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ grasps/holds/clutches/seizes/grips/[hugs] $x_{2}$ with $x_{3}$ (part of $x_{1}$) at locus $x_{4}$ (part of $x_{2}$).
valsi.notes: Hug (= {birjai}, {pamjai}); embrace (= {xadjai}); handshake (= {xanjai}, {jikyxanjai}), handle (= {veljai}, {veljaitci}). See also {ralte}, {pencu}, {darxi}, {batke}, {rinju}.

valsi.definition: $g_1$ ties $j_1$ in a knot.
$x_{1}$ is a knot/tangle in/between $x_{2}$ (object/jo'u-objects).
valsi.notes: Knot (verb = jgegau, jgezu'e, jgeri'a, jgela'a), knot: fastening between two or more cords (= {jgeterjo'e}). See also {pluja}, {julne}, {lasna}, {skori}.

valsi.definition: $j_1=j_2=n_1$ is a pretzel made from grains $n_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a gene of creature [or locus on creature] $x_{2}$ determining trait/process $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (person) feels/has pride in/about $x_{2}$ (abstraction).
valsi.notes: An emotional combination of satisfaction and respect/esteem towards property(ies) or action(s) of person/entity that has a specific tie to emoter; self-pride (= {se'ijgi}, {tolcumla}); use $x_2$ tu'a for pride in non-specific actions/properties of someone. See also {cinmo}, {cumla}, {sevzi}, {sinma}, {snada}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is guitar/violin/fiddle/harp [stringed musical instrument] with actuator/plectrum/bow $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Also lute, viola, cello. See also {zgike}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a walnut of species $x_2$.
logical connective: sumti afterthought connective question.
discursive: additionally.
$f_1=j_1$ defeats $f_2=j_3$ in competition $f_3=j_4$.
jimte modal, 1st place limitedly; up to limit ...
$l_1=j_1$ lives/experiences life.
$x_1$ resurrects/brings back to life $x_2=j_1$ by standard $j_2$.
digit/number: approximately (default the typical value in this context) (number).
rounded up (appended after string of digits indicating a rounded value).
rounded down (appended after string of digits indicating a rounded value).
$j_1=c_1$ expresses/says opinion $c_2$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) about subject/issue $j_3$ to audience $c_3$ via expressive medium $c_4$ on grounds $j_4$.
jitro modal, 1st place (control) controlledly; under direction of ...
jicmu modal, 1st place (assumptions); given that ...; based on ...
$j_2=m_1$ quits/retires from job $j_1$
valsi.notes: Elided SE from se jibri mulno.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is near/close to/approximates $x_{2}$ in property/quantity $x_{3}$ (ka/ni).
$x_{1}$ is a job/occupation/employment/vocation (a type of work regularly done for pay) of person $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Working for another (= {selplijibri}). See also {briju}, {gunka}, {te} {jerna} which is employment specifically for pay and not specifically for another, {te} {pilno} which is employment not necessarily for pay and not necessarily regular or lasting but for another, {se} {gasnu} and {se} {zukte} for incidental activities.

valsi.definition: $c_1$ is a trade/vocational school at $c_2$ teaching job skills $c_3=j_1$ to audience/community $c_4=j_2$ operated by $c_5$
$p_1=j_2$ strikes (stops working), complaining about $p_2=j_1$ to audience $p_3$ with action $p_4$.
$x_{1}$ (object, or event: force) stirs/mixes/[roils/agitates] fluid (gas/liquid) $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a basis/foundation/underlying or fundamental principle of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is at the bottom of $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$ is founded on basis $x_1$ (= selcmu for reordered places); (adjective:) $x_1$ is basic/basal/fundamental); (generally events and properties will be bases for events and states, while objects may be bases/bottoms for objects). See also cmavo list {ji'u}, {jamfu}, {zbepi}, {genja}, {krasi}.

valsi.definition: $c_1$ is a twig/sprig of $j_2$
$x_1$ is cladistics about organisms $x_2$ according to $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a pseudocoelomate with pseudocoelom $x_2$.
$xu_1$ is wrong, falsely claiming $xu_2=j_1$, by truth standard $xu_3$.
$x_{1}$ (person) intuits $x_{2}$ (du'u) about subject $x_{3}$; [epistemology].
valsi.notes: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place. See also {djuno}, {facki}, {jimpe}, {jinvi}, {nabmi}, {pensi}, {sidbo}, {smadi}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ interacts/behaves socially with $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ socializes with/is sociable towards $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ consists of the economic system (production and distribution and consumption) of sector components $x_2$; $x_1$ is economic.
valsi.notes: x2 may be a country or other area, the labor, capital and land resources, and the economic agents that socially participate in the production, exchange, distribution, and consumption of goods and services of that area; they may be joined with JOI. {pavmomseljikni} for "primary sector", {relmomseljikni} for "secondary sector", {cibmomseljikni} for "tertiary sector", and {vonmomseljikni} for "quaternary sector"; {gubyseljikni} for "public/state sector", {sivyseljikni} for "private sector", and {jikseljikni} for "social/voluntary sector". Cf. {venci'e}, {selpraci'e}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of liquor/spirits distilled from $x_{2}$.
$s_1=j_1$ is aloof/alone/solitary/a hermit, separated from $s_2=j_1$.
$s_1$ commits faux pas (social error) $s_2$, which is wrong under conditions $s_3$ according to standard $s_4$.
$t_1$ is an institution governing social/cooperative human behaviour $t_2$.
valsi.notes: Use x2 tu'a for e.g. education. Cf. {turni}

valsi.definition: $jd_1=ji_1$ is tactful in making decision $jd_2$ in matter $jd_3$ (event/state) in social interaction with $ji_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of alkali/base of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (person) is jealous of/envies $x_{2}$ (person) about/for $x_{3}$ (property - ka).
$j_1$=$b_1$ is a prosthetic bone made of metal, performing function $b_2$ in body $b_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a branch/bough/limb of $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ forks into branches $x_{1}$; [preferred over metaphorical birka].
$z_1$ is an anvil for striking metal $d_2=j_2$ with instrument $d_3$.
$s_1$ is a zing/clang produced by metal $j_1=d_2=s_2$ being hit.
$x_1$ is Friday of week $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ understands/comprehends fact/truth $x_{2}$ (du'u) about subject $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ understands (fi) $x_{3}$.
$j_1=s_1$ is a wire/cable of metal $j_2=s_2$
valsi.notes: This may be a single or multiple strand, but must be metallic.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a limit/extreme/bound/border/[confinement] of $x_{2}$ in property/domain $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Restrain/constrain within limits (= {jitri'u}, {jitygau}, {jityzu'e}). See also cmavo list {ji'e}, {traji}, {korbi}, {kuspe}, {rinju}, {bapli}, {curmi}, {fanta}, {jbini}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a pair of shears/scissors for cutting $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (person/team) wins/gains prize $x_{2}$ from/over $x_{3}$ [competitors/losers] in competition $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ is a victor; $x_2$ reward; $x_3$ competitors here are opponents and in many situations, defeated/losers, vs. the set of those competing for a goal; $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posyji'a}, posyselji'a for unambiguous {semantics}). See also {cirko}, {jivna}, {talsa}, {cnemu}, {prali}, {pleji}, {sfasa}, {jdima}, {jerna}, {bradi}, {kargu}, {kelci}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a vaccine/immune-system stimulant protecting $x_{2}$ against disease $x_{3}$ introduced by method $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also serum; inoculation (= jestu'u {veljinku}). See also {jurme}, {mikce}, {jesni}, {bilma}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of made of metal of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is beryllium.
$x_1$ is niobium.
$x_1$ is platinum.
$x_1$ is titanium (metal).
$x_1$ is thulium.
$x_1$ is hafnium.
$x_{1}$ (object/person) is immersed/submerged/bathes in liquid $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (object) is clean/pure of material/contaminant/dirt $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
$d_1=s_1$ is a ring/belt/band/girdle around/circling/ringing $s_2$ near total containment in some dimension(s).
$n_1$ is a quantity of doughnut.
$x_{1}$ is a well/spring of fluid $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$k_1=j_1$ is a well in $k_2$ containing fluid $j_2$ at location $j_3$.
$x_{1}$ thinks/opines $x_{2}$ [opinion] (du'u) is true about subject/issue $x_{3}$ on grounds $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place. See also cmavo list {pe'i}, {ciksi}, {jijnu}, {nabmi}, {pensi}, {senpi}, {sidbo}, {birti}, {pinka}.

valsi.definition: $n_1$ is a bagel.
$x_{1}$ (property - ka) is an innate/inherent/intrinsic/natural property/quality/aspect of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a chicken/[hen/cock/rooster]/small fowl [a type of bird] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a vertex of polytope $x_2$ at locus $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a tip/point/vertex/extremity/end [0-dimension shape/form] on object $x_{2}$ at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_1$=$g_1$ immerses $x_2$=$j_1$ in liquid $x_3$=$j_2$
$l_1$ (agent) bathes $l_2=j_1$ in liquid $j_2=l_4$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the horn [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: pointed extremity].
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of juice/nectar from-source/of-type $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Water-based extract from a (generally) biological source. See also {pinxe}, {djacu}, {grute}, {stagi}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (du'u) is false/is an untruth by standard/epistemology/metaphysics $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place. See also {fatci}, {stace}, {jetnu}, {cfika}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ has control over/harnesses/manages/directs/conducts $x_{2}$ in $x_{3}$ (activity/event/performance).
valsi.notes: $x_2$ are aspects/individuals controlled within activity/event $x_3$; manage (= {selzuktro}, {selzukfu'e}, {gu'etro}, {gunfu'e}, {xaktro}, {xakfu'e}) (as distinct from manager/boss = gunterbe'e, gunja'a, gunmi'e, gunca'i). (cf. cmavo list ji'o, bapli, te bende, gidva - which does not necessarily control or command, jatna, macnu, minde, ponse, ralju, rinka, sazri, turni, vlipa, xance, xlura)

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ weaves $x_{2}$ from material/[yarn] $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ competes/vies with opponent $x_{2}$ in contest/competition $x_{3}$ (event) for gain $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ rivals $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Also $x_2$ opponent(s), competitor(s), rival(s); $x_3$ competition, race; $x_4$ prize, reward, recognition (gain may be internal or external). See also {cnemu}, {jinga}, {talsa}, {bradi}, {fapro}, {kelci}.

valsi.definition: $p_2=j_1$ is the temperament (innate personality) of $p_1=j_2$.
$c_1$ is an ankle of $j_2=c_3$
$c_1$ is a toenail of toe $c_2=d_1$ of body $d_3$.
$g_1$ is $g_2$ foot/feet (length unit).
$x_{1}$ (mass/jo'u) gathers/collects at location $x_{2}$ from locations $x_{3}$ (mass/jo'u).
$j_1$ is a sole (part of foot) of $j_2$.
$c_1$ is the big toe nail of body $t_3=j_2$.
$t_1$ is the big toe of $t_3=j_2$.
$t_1$ is a heel of $j_2$.
$v_1$ is a pedal with function $v_2$, fulcrum $x_3$, and lever arm $x_4$.
$x_{1}$ is a shoal [shallow hazard]/reef of material $x_{2}$ in body of water $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ adds/combines $x_{2}$ to/with $x_{3}$, with result $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ augments $x_{2}$ by amount $x_{3}$.
$s_1=j_1$ misunderstands fact/truth $j_2$ (du'u) about subject $j_3$, an error under conditions $s_3$ by standard $s_4$.
$x_{1}$ lives/is alive by standard $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is an organism/living thing.
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought biconditional/iff/if-and-only-if.
discursive: metalinguistic affirmer.
non-logical connective: union of sets.
join mathematical expression (mex) operands into an array.
shift letterals to Arabic alphabet.
non-logical connective: in common with; along with (unmixed).
non-logical connective: mixed conjunction; "and" meaning "mixed together", forming a mass.
letteral: ampersand character; especially used in standing for a mixed connective.
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought exclusive or; Latin 'aut'.
$g_1$ causes $j_1$ to be joined to/connected to/united with $j_2$ at common locus $j_3$.
$x_1$ are joined at/by $x_2$.
$x_1$ is the union of sets $x_2$ and $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Jordanian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is joined to/connects to/is united with $x_{2}$ at common locus $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ and $x_{2}$ are a union.
valsi.notes: Also joined/fastened/attached by joint $x_3$/by means of $x_3$/with fastener $x_3$; fastener (= {jo'etci}, {jonvelyla'a}); train, sequence of joined objects (= jonpoi; porjo'e for a single object joined into a sequence). See also {lasna}, {fenso}, {kansa}, {pencu}, {penmi}.

valsi.definition: logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought whether-or-not.
evidential: I state - (default) elliptical/non-specific basis.
evidential: although, even though, while, whilst
vague non-logical connective: analogous to plain ".i".
vocative: attention - at ease - ignore me.
vocative: attention - at ease - ignore me.
vocative: attention - at ease - ignore me.
attitudinal modifier: certainty - uncertainty - impossibility.
attitudinal modifier: intense certainty.
attitudinal modifier: certainty - uncertainty - impossibility.
attitudinal modifier: certainty - uncertainty - impossibility.
attitudinal: certainty question.
binary mathematical operator: number base; [a interpreted in the base b].
$x_{1}$ is a table/flat solid upper surface of material $x_{2}$, supported by legs/base/pedestal $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ makes $x_2$ pay attention to $x_3$; $x_1$ directs $x_2$'s attention to $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is an address of/are coordinates of $x_{2}$ in system $x_{3}$.
$j_1=s_1$ is a hyperlink/URL of resource/web page $j_2=s_2$ for browser $s_3$.
$x_1$ is a paragraph about $x_2$ including sentence(s) $x_3$.
$p_1$ is a phrase of sentence $p_2=j_1$ about $j_2$ in language $j_3$.
$x_{1}$ (text) is a sentence/statement about $x_{2}$ [topic/subject/predicate/focus] in language $x_{3}$.
$s_1$ is a fragment of sentence $s_2=j_1$ about $j_2$ in language $j_3$.
$t_1=m_1$ is the intonation of sentence $j_1=m_2$ with characteristics $t_2=m_3$.
$j_1=b_1$ is the Chinese-Mandarin language, used by $b_2$ to communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote)
$x_1$ is a Chinese character in writing system $x_2$ (traditional/simplified/bopomofo/etc.) meaning $x_3$.
$j_1=g_1$ is China.
$x_{1}$ is a spider/arachnid/[crustacean/crab/lobster/non-insect arthropod] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ cooks/prepares food-for-eating $x_{2}$ by recipe/method $x_{3}$ (process).
valsi.notes: Cook with heat (= {glajukpa}, {glaterjukpa}), bake (= {tokyjukpa}); fry (= {rasyjukpa}). See also {cupra}, {bredi}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a net/filter allowing passage of $x_{2}$, prohibiting passage of $x_{3}$, netting properties $x_{4}$.
$x_1$ is $x_2$ degrees in angular measure (default is 1)
valsi.notes: Cf. {junla}, {radno}, {cacryra'o}, {plinyxabykoi}, {jedjipli'i}. {pi'e} used in x2 indicates a base of 60.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is attentive towards/attends/tends/pays attention to object/affair $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ tells/makes known to $x_2$ fact(s) $x_3$ (du'u) about subject $x_4$ by epistemology $x_5$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Chinese [Mandarin, Cantonese, Wu, etc.] culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a rush of species $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is clock/watch/timer measuring time units $x_{2}$ to precision $x_{3}$ with timing mechanism/method $x_{4}$.
$x_1$ is a juniper/cedar of species/variety $x_2$.
valsi.notes: some trees called "cedar" are actually juniper; see {ricrcedro}, {ckunu}

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (person) is serious/earnest/has gravity about $x_{2}$ (event/state/activity).
$x_{1}$ is the weight of object $x_{2}$ in [gravitational or other force] field $x_{3}$.
$m_1$ (agent) weighs object $j_2$ as $m_3$ units on scale $m_4$ (si'o) in field $j_3$.
$x_1=k_1$ is a kitchen, in which $x_2=j_1$ cooks $x_3=j_2$, in home/building/structure $x_4=k_2$ surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor $x_5=k_3$ (mass/jo'u).
$t_1$ is a frying pan/wok used by cook $j_1$ for cooking/frying/sautéing $j_2=t_1$, made of material $t_3$
$x_1$ is a plantain (banana) of species $x_2$.
$p_1$ is a pot used by $j_1$ for cooking/boiling/steaming $j_2=p_2$ with recipe $j_3$; pot made of material $p_3$
$p_1=j_2$ is a baked good/cake/mochi/doughnut/pizza dough/pie/macaroon/[cooked paste] made from $p_2$ prepared by $j_1$ according to method/recipe $j_3$
valsi.notes: Cf. {jukpa}, {pesxu}, {titnanba}. Originally coined by .lis.nunyn. on IRC.

valsi.definition: $b_1$ is a dumpling made from material $x_2$ filled with material $x_3$
$x_{1}$ is a bacteria/germ/microbe/protozoan/amoeba [1-celled life] of species/defining property $x_{2}$.
$j_1=p_1$ considers / reflects on $j_2=p_2$.
$x_{1}$ (event/action/state) is severe/harsh to $x_{2}$ [victim/experiencer].
$x_{1}$ is a species of genus $x_{2}$, family $x_{3}$, etc.; [open-ended tree-structure categorization].
valsi.notes: Also subspecies, order, phylum; (places do not correspond to specific levels in the hierarchy; rather, $x_1$ is at a "lower" or "bushier" part of the tree than $x_2$, $x_2$ is "lower" than $x_3$, etc.; skipping a place thus means that there is one or more known-and-unspecified levels of hierarchy between the two); not limited to Linnean animal/plant taxonomy. See also {klesi}, {lanzu}.

valsi.definition: $s_1$ is (biological) taxonomy based on methodology $s_2$.
$x_{1}$ (action) is clumsy/awkward by standard $x_{2}$.
$l_1$ is a regular/predictable lujvo (compound predicate word) with meaning $l_2$ and arguments $l_3$ built from phrase $l_4$ and having an argument structure according to rule $j_1$.
valsi.notes: A Lojban-specific term. The approach of jvajvo is intended to at least constrain what the $x_2$, $x_3$, $x_4$... etc. of a lujvo may be, and also to draw the semantic values of those places from the semantic values of the places of the component brivla. The rationale is that the place structure of an unknown {lujvo} should not require memorization. This was previously known as ``{dikyjvo}''; a mistranslation of ``regular lujvo'', as it used the wrong sense of ``regular'' (see {dikni}).

valsi.definition: $c_1=j_1$ wages a contest $c_2=j_3$ on $c_3=j_2$ for gain $j_4$.
$x_{1}$ is the view/scene/panorama/sight/prospect of $x_{2}$ (object/location) from point-of-view $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also $x_1$ is on display to $x_2$/$x_3$. See also {catlu}, {kanla}, {viska}, {canko}, {jarco}.

valsi.definition: $xi_1$ is a racehorse of breed $xi_2$ competing in race $j_3$.
$k_1$ separates affix compound $k_2$ into its constituent affixes $k_3$; $k_1$ does morphological analysis.
letteral for j.
James Cooke Brown.
abstractor: property/quality abstractor (-ness); $x_{1}$ is quality/property exhibited by [bridi].
klama modal, 1st place gone to by ...
$m_1$ is an axe for cutting $k_2$ with blade $m_3=k_1$ propelled by $m_4$.
$d_1$ is an incisor of $d_2$.
modal aspect: innate capability; possibly unrealized.
krati modal, 1st place represented by ...
$s_1$ is the concept of representative democracy (default: political representative democracy) as it applies to the governance of $t_2$ based on the works of thinker(s) $s_3$
digit/number: imaginary i; square root of -1.
$s_1=k_1$ is sickly/appears healthy to observer $s_3$ by standard $k_2$.
evidential: I know by cultural means (myth or custom).
$x_1$ scores/gains a point against $x_2$ in competition/game/contest $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a cup/glass/tumbler/mug/vessel/[bowl] containing contents $x_{2}$, and of material $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: A kabri is normally eaten from by lifting it; a palta is not. See also {palta}, {citka}, {blaci}, {tansi}.

valsi.definition: $d_1$ is $d_2$ cupful(s).
$x_{1}$ is a camera/photographic equipment recording illumination type $x_{2}$ images to medium $x_{3}$.
$p_1$ is a photograph of $p_2$ taken by photographer $p_3$ in medium $p_4$=$k_3$.
$p_1$ is a sequence of numbers in ascending order.
$x_{1}$ reflects Canadian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$k_1=f_1=b_1$ is the Canadian French language used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$k_1=g_1=b_1$ is the Canadian English language used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$k_1=g_1$ is Canada
$x_{1}$ coughs/farts/burps up/out $x_{2}$ [predominantly gaseous] from orifice $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is caffeine with chemical purity $x_2$
$x_{1}$ is a company/corporation/firm/partnership chartered by authority $x_{2}$ for purpose $x_{3}$.
$j_1$ is the president of company/corporation/firm $j_2=k_1$
$r_1$ is CEO (Chief Executive Officer) of company/corporation/firm $t_2=k_1$.
$t_2 $ is a/the private computer network that includes nodes/computers $t_1=s_1$ whose function/purpose is $s_2$, installed across organization $k_1$.
valsi.notes: Cf. {kagni}, {skami}, {tcana}, {mujysamseltcana}, {internet}, {intranet}. May or may not be an intranet.

valsi.definition: $d_2 $ is/are the indebtedness/liabilities of company/corporation/firm $d_1=k_1$ to creditor(s) $d_3$ for the provision of goods /services/loans $d_4$.
$p_2$ is/are an/the asset(s) of company/corporation/firm/partnership $p_1=k_1$ according to law $p_3$.
ckaji modal, 1st place characterizing ...
$x_{1}$ (event/experience) warns/cautions $x_{2}$ (person) of/about danger $x_{3}$ (event/state/property).
valsi.notes: Agentive warning (= {jdegau}, {jdezu'e}); an attempt to warn which may not succeed (= {jdetoi}, {jdegautoi}, {jdezuktoi}). See also {ckape}, {nupre}, {snura}, {tcica}, {xlura}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a shelf/counter/bar in/on/attached to supporting object $x_{2}$, for purpose $x_{3}$.
$t_1=k_2$ is a cupboard for storing $t_2$, made of $t_3$, with shelves $k_1$.
$x_{1}$ is able to do/be/capable of doing/being $x_{2}$ (event/state) under conditions $x_{3}$ (event/state).
valsi.notes: Also: has talent; know how to; know how to use (= {plika'e}). (cf. stati, certu, gasnu (in the time-free potential sense), cmavo list ka'e, cmavo list nu'o, cmavo list pu'i, djuno, zifre)

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (agent) digs $x_{2}$ [material] up/out of $x_{3}$ [source/hole] with limbs/tool(s) $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also $x_1$ cuts into $x_3$ (with material removal). See also {katna}, {plixa}, {sraku}, {canpa}, {sraku}.

valsi.definition: $c_1=k_4$ is an excavator/power shovel for digging in $k_3$, operated by $k_1=c_3$.
$x_1$ is a teardrop wept by $x_2$ for reason $x_3$.
$b_1=k_1$ is an eyeball (body part) of $k_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the feces/excrement/dung/shit of $x_{2}$ (animal/person); (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is fecal (matter).
$v_1=k_2$ defecates/shits/poos.
$g_1$ is an eyelid of eye $k_1=g_2$.
$ke_1$ is an eyelash (body part) of $ke_2=ka_2$.
$x_1$ is a squid/cuttlefish of species $x_2$.
$ke_1$ is an eyebrow (supraorbital ridge) of $ke_2=ka_2=m_2$.
$x_{1}$ (portal/passage/entrance-way) is open/ajar/not shut permitting passage/access to $x_{2}$ by $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is chaotic/disordered in property/aspect $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_1=v_2$ is a tear/tear fluid of $x_2=v_1$.
$x_{1}$ hunts/stalks prey/quarry/game $x_{2}$ for purpose $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also verb: to fish (= {fipkalte}). See also {jersi}, {kavbu}, {sisku}, {rivbi}.

valsi.definition: $v_1=k_2$ weeps/lacrimates tear(s) $v_2$ from $v_3$ via means/route $v_4$.
$k_1$ is the greatness/majesty/splendour/magnificence/grandeur of $b_1$ according to standard $b_3$.
$k_1$ is a security condition of $b_1$ protecting $b_2$ from threat $b_3$.
valsi.notes: When used as "security", x3 is a planned threat. "security" is comparable to "safety" ({kamnu'a}), "reliability" ({kamylacri}), and "continuity" ({kamra'i}).

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of camphor (chemical compound)
$x_1$ is a society; $x_1$ is social
$x_{1}$ is a column/pillar of material $x_{2}$.
$m_1$ tests/evaluates/measures $j_1$'s knowledge of facts (du'u) $j_2$ in subject area $j_3$ as $m_3$ units on scale $m_4$ with accuracy $m_5$
valsi.notes: The x2 through x4 places are = m2

valsi.definition: $k_1=b_1$ is a vertebra of $b_3$ ; $b_3$ is a vertebrate.
$x_1$ is a leek of variety $x_2$.
$kam_1$ is the health of $kan_1$ by standard $kan_2$.
$x_{1}$ (mass) is a committee with task/purpose $x_{2}$ of body $x_{3}$.
$k_1$ is the majesty of $t_1=n_1$ being a regent/monarch of $t_2$ by standard $n_2$.
$x_{1}$ (property - ka) is common/general/universal among members of set $x_{2}$ (complete set).
valsi.notes: Only fully universal sense applies; $x_1$ must be found in all members of $x_2$. For the non-universal sense see {fadni} and {zilfadni}. See also {cafne}, {rirci}, {fadni}, {cnano}, {tcaci}, {lakne}, {cmima}, {simxu}.

valsi.definition: $k_1$ is the relation of $s_1$ to $s_2$.
$x_1$ reflects Welsh language/culture in aspect $x_2$.
$k_1$ is the fatigue of $t_1$ in being/doing $t_2$ (event).
$x_1$ is the quality of whom/what is free to do/be $x_2=z_2$; $x_1$ is freedom/liberty of $x_2=z_2$
$x_{1}$ is a goat/angora/[billy-goat/kid] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is January of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) counts the number in set $x_{2}$ to be $x_{3}$ [number/count] counting [off] by units $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is dim/dull/pale/non-intense in property $x_{2}$ (ka) as received/measured by observer $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: In colors, indicates unsaturated, pastel, pale (though blabi can also indicate a kind of paleness). See also {blabi}, {carmi}, {klina}, {linto}, {manku}, {murse}, {ruble}, {skari}, {milxe}, {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {crino}, {grusi}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xekri}, {xunre}, {zirpu}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a candirú of species/variety $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a kangaroo of species/breed $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ calculates/reckons/computes $x_{2}$ [value (ni)/state] from data $x_{3}$ by process $x_{4}$.
$j_1=k_1$ is a watch (portable timepiece) measuring time units $j_2$ to precision $j_3$ with timing mechanism $j_4$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the eye [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: sensory apparatus]; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is ocular.
$x_1$ expects/looks for the occurence of $x_2$ (event), expected likelihood $x_3$ (0-1, default li so'a (i.e. near 1)); $x_1$ subjectively evaluates the likelihood of $x_2$ (event) to be $x_3$.
valsi.notes: The value of $x_3$ is a subjective estimate of likeliness according to $x_1$, and is the basic determinant of whether kanpe means something like "hope" or "wish" or "expect", although kanpe never carries the connotation of desire; for that connotation see {pacna}. kanpe with $x_3$ not very close to 1 has no simple equivalent in English, but for objects/states with negligible expectation it is something like "wishing"; if the state is plausibly likely, it is something like "hoping". In both cases, though, the English implication of emotional desire is not present. The value will usually be expressed using inexact numbers ("{li} {piso'u}" to "{li} {piro}"); non-desirous wish (= ??), non-desirous hope (= ??); (cf. {djica}, {pacna})

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is healthy/fit/well/in good health by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is with/accompanies/is a companion of $x_{2}$, in state/condition/enterprise $x_{3}$ (event/state).
valsi.notes: $x_1$ is together with/along with $x_2$. See also {kagni}, {jorne}, {gunma}, {girzu}, {lasna}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ do $x_2$ together.
$x_{1}$ is a quantum/ray/elementary particle/smallest measurable increment of property/activity $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Quantum ray (= {bonka'u}). (cf. selci for masses and most objects; ratni, gradu, gusni, nejni, linji)

valsi.definition: $xa_1=k_1$ is a roommate of/lives with $k_2$ at location/habitat/nest/home/abode $x_3=xa_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a conjunction, stating that $x_{2}$ (du'u) and $x_{3}$ (du'u) are both true.
$k_1$ is a skin pore of pelt/skin/hide/leather $k_2=s_1$ from $x_3=s_2$.
$x_1$ is a chili/bell pepper (Capsicum) of species/variety $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ [observer] compares $x_{2}$ with $x_{3}$ in property $x_{4}$ (ka), determining comparison $x_{5}$ (state).
$x_{1}$ is a car/automobile/truck/van [a wheeled motor vehicle] for carrying $x_{2}$, propelled by $x_{3}$.
$c_1$ is a sandal for protecting feet $c_2$, and of material $c_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a card [small nearly-2-dimensional shape/form] of material $x_{2}$, shape $x_{3}$.
$g_1$ opens portal/passage/entranceway $k_1$, permitting access to $k_2$ by $k_3$.
$x_{1}$ (object/commodity/property/event) is costly/expensive/dear to $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: $x_1$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= poskargu for unambiguous {semantics}). See also {vamji}, {dirba}, {vajni}, {jdima}, {pleji}, {canja}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {jemna}, {sfasa}, {vecnu}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is hibiscus of species/variety $x_2$.
$k_1$ is a wolverine of variety $k_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a collar/ring/belt/band around/surrounding $x_{2}$ made of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a journal/periodical/magazine/[newspaper] with content $x_{2}$ published by $x_{3}$ for audience $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$ may be a subject, but not all journals have a single subject; all have some sort of principle defining what is included, so this need not be a list. See also {papri}, {pelji}, {tcidu}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is the $x_3$'rd issue/number of journal/periodical/magazine/publication $x_2$ with content $x_4$ published by $x_5$ for audience $x_6$ .
$x_{1}$ is an open-break with broken piece $x_{2}$.
$j_1=k_3$ hatches from eggshell $j_2=p_1=k_1$
valsi.notes: {kalri}+{porpi}+{jbena} This is based on the lujvo {karpo'i}, glossed as "something breaks open". It is not obvious to me whether any of $k_2$ (portal destination), $p_2$ (pieces of broken thing), $j_3$ (birthdate), or $j_4$ (birthplace) are appropriate to include in this lujvo.

valsi.definition: $s_1$ is a vowel sound.
$x_1$ is safflower of species/variety $x_2$.
$x_1$ is Georgian (Caucasus) in aspect $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a caravan consisting of $x_2$ traveling across/through $x_3$
$x_1$ is a katakana (Japanese syllabary) of sound $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ (tool/blade/force) cuts [through]/splits/divides $x_{2}$ (object) into pieces $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: For $x_1$ force, it is a force acting as a blade, not acting upon a blade; agentive cutting (= {ka'argau}, {ka'arzu'e}). (cf. kakpa, sraku for cutting into without division; plixa, dakfu, jinci, porpi, spofu, tunta, xrani, fatri, fendi, balre, dilcu)

valsi.definition: discursive: marks word serving as focus of indirect question: "I know WHO went to the store".
$x_1$ is a salamander of family/genus/species $x_2$.
$d_2=k_1$ is common sense to knowers $d_1=k_2$ about subject $d_3$ by epistemology $d_4$.
$x_{1}$ captures/catches/apprehends/seizes/nabs $x_{2}$ with trap/restraint $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Catch something thrown (= {rerkavbu}). See also {jersi}, {kalte}, {pinfu}, {sisku}, se {rinju}.

valsi.definition: start grouping of tanru, etc; ... type of ... ; overrides normal tanru left grouping.
pro-sumti: relativized sumti (object of relative clause).
elidable terminator: end of tanru left grouping override (usually elidable).
open interval bracket marker; modifies intervals in non-logical connectives; exclude boundaries.
vocative: please repeat.
discursive: repeating - continuing.
discursive: repeating - continuing.
$x_1$ repeats $x_2$ (sedu'u/text) to audience $x_3$ via expressive medium $x_4$ for the $x_5$th time.
$x_{1}$ (person) pities/feels sorry for $x_{2}$ (person) about $x_{3}$ (abstraction).
elidable terminator: end abstraction bridi (often elidable).

non-question: understanding of something said.

digit/number: number comma; thousands.

valsi.notes: se la'ornai means the Roman people. The term refers to the ancient Romans, not to modern-day residents of the Italian capital, or small Wisconsin town.

$x_1$ is an eyewear used/worn by $x_2$ serving purpose $x_3$.
valsi.notes: It is a frame worn in front of the eyes and bears or does not bear transparent/semi-transparent/non-transparent shields for visual correction, eye protection, fashion, or entertainment. The shields are not necessarily lenses. Cf. {le'otci} or {le'orlacni} for a corrective type, which may include {tidlacni} for reading glasses and {xrelacni} for bifocal and trifocal glasses; {badlacni} for a protective type, which may include {srulacni} for goggles and {solylacni} for sunglasses; {jadlacni} for fashion glasses, which may include {rekmeclacni} for rimless glasses and solylacni; {mincimdylacni} for 3D glasses.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ pulls/tugs/draws/drags $x_{2}$ by handle/at locus $x_{3}$.

valsi.notes: Examples are British Virgin Islands, Netherlands Antilles, and American Samoa. Cf. {gugde}, {zifyje'a}.

valsi.notes: ($x_1$ may be an abstract); verb lift/raise/elevate (= {lafmuvgau}). See also {farlu}, {plipe}.

$x_{1}$ is a lake/lagoon/pool at site/within land mass $x_{2}$.

valsi.notes: Also touching, contiguous, against. See also {zvati}, {cpana}, {jibni}, {diklo}, {stuzi}, {bartu}, {jbini}.

valsi.notes: Also clan, tribe; $x_2$ is in $x_1$, a member of $x_1$ (selylanzu for reordered places); relative (= lazmi'u - xy mintu y'y leka cmima da poi lanzu). See also {natmi}, {cmima}, {girzu}, {jutsi}, {klesi}.

$l_1$ is a widow spider of species $l_2$.
$c_1$ sculpts/carves $c_2=l_1$ from $s_2$ using tool $s_1$
valsi.notes: implied c3 is "lo nu jai gau {sraku} s2 fai s1" implied l2 would likewise be "lo si'o nu jai gau {sraku} s2 fai s1"

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (agent) fastens/connects/attaches/binds/lashes $x_{2}$ to $x_{3}$ with fastener $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: No implication that result is considered a single object; although $x_2$ and $x_3$ may be reversible, $x_3$ may be used for the substrate, the fixed/larger object to which $x_2$ becomes attached. See also {jorne}, {fenso}, {jgena}, {batke}, {dinko}, {kansa}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of brass [copper/zinc alloy] of composition including $x_{2}$.

Laotze (aka. Laozi)
Laos.
valsi.notes: Under some interpretations of the morphology rules, not a valid word.

valsi.definition: $cu_1=cl_1$ shouts $cu_2$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) for audience $cu_3$ via expressive medium $cu_4$, loudly by standard $x_5=cl_3$.

valsi.definition: non-veridical descriptor: the one(s) described as ...
description pro-sumti: reuses the value of the $x_{1}$ of the previous bridi.
description: marks description extracting the time tense place of the description bridi.

description pro-sumti: reuses the value of the $x_{2}$ of the previous bridi.

description pro-sumti: reuses the value of the $x_{5}$ of the previous bridi.
klesi modal, 1st place (scalar set) in/of category ...
replace recent mistakenly uttered text
valsi.notes:
The {lo'ai} ... {sa'ai} ... {le'ai} replacement construct asks the listener to replace the text after {lo'ai} with the text after {sa'ai}. The order {sa'ai} ... {lo'ai} ... {le'ai} is also allowed, and either or both parts can be omitted and thus left up to context. When both parts are omitted, the word {le'ai} on its own indicates that a mistake was made while leaving all the details up to context.
It is also possible to attach SAI to a le'ai construct: le'ai {dai} (or le'ai {da'oi} ko'a) indicates that someone else made a mistake; le'ai {pei} asks whether someone else made a mistake; and {sai}, {ru'e} and {cu'i} can be used to indicate the importance of the substitution. Furthermore, le'ai {nai} can be used to explicitly deny mistakes instead of acknowledging them (compare "sic").

valsi.definition: $v_1$ is a loanword meaning $v_2$ in language $v_3$ based on foreign-language word $l_2$.
valsi.notes: Old, deprecated synonym for {fu'ivla}. Could be considered an {u'ivla}.

(cf. punji, cpacu where volition or previous possession is not necessarily implied, vimcu for alienation where $x_1$ need not gain possession, canci, cliva)

valsi.definition: Lithuania.

valsi.notes: Also has/have (of events/experiences); (adjective:) $x_1$ is empirical; suggests passive undergoing but does not exclude active (per zukte) intent; a deserved experience: reward or punishment (= {jernyfri}, {zanjernyfri}, {maljernyfri}). See also cmavo list {ri'i}, {jmive}, {fasnu}, {renvi}.

valsi.definition: $x_1=f_1=s_2$ sublimates/evaporates from the solid state at temperature $x_2=f_2=s_3$ with vapor pressure $x_3=f_3$.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a religion of believers including $x_{2}$ sharing common beliefs/practices/tenets including $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also mythos, creed, traditional beliefs, $x_2$ people(s), adherents; (adjective:) $x_1$, $x_2$, $x_3$ are religious/ecclesiastic in nature; $x_2$ is a believer in/of $x_1$, an adherent/follower of $x_1$ (= seljda for reordered places); $x_2$ is a practitioner of $x_3$ (= selterjda for reordered places); $x_3$ is a tenet/belief/ritual/creed of $x_1$/$x_2$ (= terjda for reordered places); priest/clerical (= {jdaca'i}, {jdaka'i}, {jdaja'a}); organized church/religion (= {be'ejda}); congregation (= {jdabe'e}, {jdagri}). See also {budjo}, {censa}, {cevni}, {crida}, {dadjo}, {jegvo}, {krici}, {latna}, {malsi}, {marde}, {muslo}, {pruxi}, {ranmi}, {ritli}, {xriso}, {zekri}.

$x_1$ is Monday of week $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$.
$f_1$ is a dead end of route $f_2=p_1$ from origin $p_3$.

$c_1=k_1$ is a blouse of material $c_2$.

London

marji modal, 1st place material in object/substance ...

manri modal, 1st place (by standard 2) in reference frame ...

digit/number: plus sign; positive number; default any positive.

valsi.notes: An institution for adult education at a basic or intermediate level (teaching those of any age). Cf. {ckule}, {balcu'e}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a derogative connotation/sense of $x_{2}$ used by $x_{3}$; $x_{3}$ derogates/'curses at' $x_{2}$ in form $x_{1}$.
valsi.notes: Bloody (British sense), fucking, shit, goddamn. See also {palci}, {dapma}, {xlali}, {zabna}, {funca}, {ganti}, {ganxo}, {gletu}, {gutra}, {kalci}, {pinca}, {pinji}, {plibu}, {vibna}, {vlagi}, {zargu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a mammal/'animal'/beast of species $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (event/action/process) is manual [not automatic] in function $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
Madrid
Medina
$s_1$ (mass of facts) is the study of conduct-governing standards $s_2=m_1$ based on methodology $s_3$.
valsi.notes: Major branches of ethics include "meta-ethics" ({ckaji zei madyske}), "normative ethics" ({bilga zei madyske}), "applied ethics" ({pilno zei madyske}), "moral psychology" ({menli zei madyske}), and "descriptive ethics" ({skicu zei madyske}). Cf. {saske}.

valsi.definition: $c_1=m_2$ moralizes expressing $c_2$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) to audience $c_3$ via expressive medium $c_4$ using/based on ethics/morals/moral standards/ethical standards $m_1$
$c_1=m_3$ is a wizard/sorcerer of $m_1=c_1$, which is magical to $m_2$, with standard of sorcery $c_3$.
$x_1$ is $x_2$ millimeters of mercury by standard $x_3$.
$x_1$ is an amalgam of composition including $x_2$.
utterance ordinal suffix; converts a number to an ordinal, such as an item or paragraph number.

$x_1=s_1=m_1$ is the material environment/surrounding material (i.e. gaseous/liquid atmosphere, vacuum, etc.) enclosing $x_2=s_2$ in direction(s)/dimensions(s)/plane $x_3=s_3=m_3$, of type/composition including $x_4=m_2$.
valsi.notes: A vacuum is arguably not 'material', but the word is much more convenient if that is included. Also, vacuum is never completely empty. See also {marji}, {sruri}, {gapci}, {litki}, {kunti}, {sakci}, {kensa}.

valsi.definition: Mecca
$x_{1}$ is mature/ripe/fully-grown/adult in development-quality $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ is magic/supernatural/sorcery/witchcraft/wizardry to $x_{2}$, performed by person/force/deity $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is a compass with magnet $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a poppy of species $x_2$
$x_{1}$ is magnetic [adjective] producing magnetic field $x_{2}$.
$v_4=m_1$ is a magnetic storage medium storing $v_2$ (data/facts/du'u) about $v_3$ (object/event) in file(s) $v_1$.
$c_1$ is junk food for $c_2$.
$x_1$ is Malagasy in aspect $x_2$.
$g_1=m_1$ is an anglicism (in Lojban), inappropriate according to $m_3$.
valsi.notes: Refers to any kind of reliance upon English in a Lojban expression, but is most common for calques. Is sometimes even extended to cover reliance upon cultural assumptions. ``malglico'' is a much more common form.

valsi.definition: $mak_1$ is black magic to $mak_2$, performed by person/force/deity $mak_3$.
$m_1$ is a black widow spider of variety $m_2$.
$ma_1=mi_1=g_2$ is ill-lit with light $g_1$ from light source $g_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a temple/church/sanctuary/synagogue/shrine of religion $x_{2}$ at location/serving area $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$ may be event of form (... worships/pays/respect to ...), hence (metaphorically extending to) monument (= {mojmalsi}, {si'armalsi}). See also {cevni}, {krici}, {lijda}, {ritli}.

valsi.definition: $mas_1$ is sluggish at doing/being/bringing about $mas_2$ (event/state) according to $mab_3$.
$x_1$ is unwelcome by $x_2$ to place/event $x_3$.
$g_1$ has sex/copulates with the mother of $g_2=m_2$.
$m_1=j_1$ is a hen of species/breed $j_2$ with offspring $x_3=m_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a mother of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ bears/mothers/acts maternally toward $x_{2}$; [not necessarily biological].
$b_1=m_1$ darkens under conditions $x_2=b_3$.
$x_{1}$ feels wonder/awe/marvels about $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is manioc of species/variety $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ (object/event) is uniform/homogeneous in property $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_1$ is a mango of species $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is dark/lacking in illumination.
valsi.notes: (cf. blabi, gusni, ctino; use kandi or xekri with colors, ctino)

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a frame of reference/standard for observing/measuring/determining $x_{2}$, with/by rules $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: ($x_1$ may be object or si'o idea); See also cmavo list {ma'i}, {ckilu}, {merli}, {pajni}, {cimde}, {jdice}, {marde}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ satisfies evaluator $x_{2}$ in property (ka)/state $x_{3}$.
$n_1$ needs $n_2$ to be satisfied for reason $x_3$.
valsi.notes: $n_2$ must be a physical object, not an event; for that, use {djica}. See also: {mansa}, {nitcu}

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is an ant of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is carbon monoxide.
$j_1$ is a termite of species $j_2$.
$mam_1$ is an ant queen of ants $mam_2=man_1$ of species/breed $man_2$.
$x_1$ is formic acid.
$z_1$ is an anthill of ants $z_2=m_1$.
$z_1$ becomes darker/darkens by amount $z_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a cap/hat/crown/helmet/piece of headgear [head-top garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of cotton [type of fabric/material].
$x_1$ is eucalyptus of species/variety $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ fits/matches/suits/is compatible/appropriate/corresponds to/with $x_{2}$ in property/aspect $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is dodder of species/variety $x_2$ parasitic on $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a shelter/haven/refuge/retreat/harbor for/protecting $x_{2}$ from danger/threat $x_{3}$.

valsi.notes: $x_1$ will (typically) be an abstract, a rule or rules of behavior; also principles; also conscience (= {sezmarde}). See also {palci}, {vrude}, {lijda}, {manri}, {javni}, {tarti}, {zekri}.

valsi.definition: $d_1$ is positive electric charge in $d_2$.
$x_1$ is neem/margosa/azedarac of species/variety $x_2$.
valsi.notes: See also {zdiraxa}, {andiroba}. "Azedarach" and variants have referred to both this tree and the {zdiraxa}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/made of mercury/quicksilver; [metaphor: fluid metal; temperature].
$x_{1}$ is material/stuff/matter of type/composition including $x_{2}$ in shape/form $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is physical (one sense)/material. See also {morna}, {mucti}, {nejni}, {tarmi}, {dacti}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a passionfruit/passionflower of species/variety $x_2$.

valsi.notes: This month (= {cabma'i}); next month (= {bavla'ima'i}); last month (= {prula'ima'i}). See also {detri}, {djedi}, {jeftu}, {nanca}.

valsi.definition: $c_1$ is a parish of parishioners $c_2$.

valsi.notes: (adjective:) $x_1$ is buttery; an edible fat, solid but spreadable at normal temperatures; dairy butter (= {ladmatne}). See also {grasu}, {kruji}.

valsi.definition: $p_1$ approves $m_1$ for $m_2$ in property aspect $m_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a motor/engine, driving/propelling/providing power to $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is June of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$b_1$ becomes fitting with $m_2$ in property/aspect $m_3$.

zmadu modal, 1st place (a greater) exceeded by ... ; usually a sumti modifier.
attitudinal: stronger intensity attitudinal relativizer
valsi.notes: Specifies a stronger intensity - relative to any previously specified intensity of the same UI/cmavo. CAI2 after CAI specifies an absolute intensity - but the CAI2 specifies the relative shift from the regular value. CAI after CAI2 specifies an relative value - and the CAI denotes the relative amount interval size. See also {me'ai}, {dau'i}, {sai}

valsi.definition: $d_1$ prefers $d_1=m_1$ (event/state) to $m_2$ for purpose $d_3$ by amount/excess $z_4$.

$x_{1}$ is a quantity of wheat [grain] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
