convert sumti to selbri/tanru element; $x_{1}$ is specific to [sumti] in aspect $x_{2}$.
mleca modal, 1st place (a lesser) undercut by ... ; usually a sumti modifier.
attitudinal: weaker intensity attitudinal relativizer
valsi.notes: Specifies a stronger intensity - relative to any previously specified intensity of the same UI/cmavo. See also {mau'i}, {dau'i}, {ru'e}

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is henna of species/variety $x_2$.
cmene modal, 1st place (requires quote) with name ...; so-called ...
sumti question asking for a name; who?; requires quoted name as an answer.
digit/number: less than.
$s_1$ is a brother-in-law (sister's spouse) of $m_2$ under law/custom/tradition/system/convention $sp_3$.
the mathematical expression (unevaluated); convert unevaluated mathematical expression to sumti.
non-Lojban brivla
valsi.notes: Used as a convenient way to borrow foreign predicates into Lojban. For unary predicates, equivalent to {me} {la'e} {zo'oi}.

valsi.definition: elidable terminator: end sumti that was converted to selbri; usually elidable.
$ml_1$ is a temple belonging to $me_2$
$x_{1}$ is a/the brow/forehead [projecting flat/smooth head/body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$m_1=n_1$ is a negative number relative to origo $m_2$.
$m_1=t_1$ is the least of $m_2=t_4$ in property $m_3$ (ka/ni) by amount $m_4$.
$x_1$ is less than or equal to $x_2$ in property/quantity $x_3$ by amount $x_4$.
$x_1$ is yours among $x_2$ by rule/relationship $x_3$; $x_1$ is your $x_2$ by rule/relationship $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a million [$10^6$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ tonne(s) [metric unit] in mass (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
convert number to cardinality selbri; $x_{1}$ is the mass formed from set $x_{2}$ whose n member(s) are $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: [$x_1$ is a mass with N components $x_3$ composing set $x_2$; $x_2$ is an n-tuple ($x_2$ is completely specified) (= {selmei} for reordered places); $x_1$ forms an n-some; $x_3$ (not necessarily a complete enumeration) are among the members of $x_2$]; See also {cmima}, {gunma}, cmavo list {moi}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is an operator/mathematical function/single-valued mapping from domain $x_2$ to range $x_3$ defined by mathematical expression/rule $x_4$.
$x_1$ is the value of expression $x_2$ in base/convention $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ [quantifier/expression] is a mathematical expression interpreted under rules/convention $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is an operand of operator $x_2$ filling place $x_3$ under rules/convention $x_4$.
$x_{1}$ is beautiful/pleasant to $x_{2}$ in aspect $x_{3}$ (ka) by aesthetic standard $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also handsome, pretty, gorgeous, cute, comely, graceful. See also {pluka}, {xamgu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ reflects Malaysian/Malay culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a budgerigar (Melopsittacus undulatus) of breed $x_2$.
$x_1$ is mine among $x_2$ by rule/relationship $x_3$; $x_1$ is my $x_2$ by rule/relationship $x_3$.
$c_1=m_2$ (person) is intelligent/smart by standard $c_3$.
$c_1$ reads/watches/listens to/mentally consumes $c_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a mind/intellect/psyche/mentality/[consciousness] of body $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: (adjective:) $x_1$ is mental/psychological/a mental phenomenon; multiple personalities (= so'i {menli}). See also {besna}, {morji}, {mucti}, {pensi}, {sanji}, {xanri}, {sevzi}, {xadni}.

valsi.definition: $m_1$ is a psychologist/psychiatrist/counsellor/mental health practitioner of client $m_2$ treating ailment $m_3$ with treatment $m_4$.
$g_1$=$me_1$ telekinetically / with its mind moves $mu_1$ to destination/receiver $mu_2$ [away] from origin $mu_3$ over path/route $mu_4$
valsi.notes: Made from {menli}+{muvgau}. {menli}2 dropped on account of irrelevancy. See also {gasnu}, {klama}, {litru}, {makfa}, {menli}, {muvdu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a sister of/sororal to $x_{2}$ by bond/tie/standard/parent(s) $x_{3}$; [not necessarily biological].
$s_1$ (mass of facts) is mental science/psychology about subject matter $s_2$ based on methodology $s_3$.
$x_1$ is a quantity of peppermint of species/strain $x_2$
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ minutes in duration (default is 1 minute) by standard $x_{3}$.
$n_1$ is psychological warfare on the part of $d_1$.
$t_1$ is the psychological disposition of $t_2=m_2$.
$m_1=b_1$ is the American English used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$f_1$ is worth $f_2=m_1$ US cents.
$x_1$ is a skunk of genus/species $x_2$.
$m_1=g_1$ is the United States of America.
$m_1=j_1$ is a president of the United States of America.
$j_1=m_1$ is the United State of America as a state.
valsi.notes: A U.S. state, or any part of a federation is referred to as {gugypau}. Cf. {merko}, {jecta}, {bemro}.

valsi.definition: $m_1=k_1$ reflects angloamerican culture/nationality/geography/language in aspect $m_1=k_1$.
valsi.notes: Pertaining to the United States and Canada. Cf. {merko}, {kadno}, {bemro}, {bemjoitco}

valsi.definition: $k_1=m_1$ is US culture.
$x_{1}$ pertains to USA/American culture/nationality/dialect in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a whiting of species $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) measures/evaluates $x_{2}$ [quantity] as $x_{3}$ units on scale $x_{4}$ (si'o), with accuracy $x_{5}$.
$t_1$ is a government of the United States of America.
$r_1=m_1$ is $r_2$ US dollars.
$x_{1}$ reflects Mexican culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$m_1=b_1$ is the Mexican Spanish language used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$m_1=g_1$ is Mexico
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s); identified by self-vocative.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s) & others unspecified, but not you, the listener.
$f_1$ laughs at $f_3$ under conditions $f_4$.
$p_1$ (agent) tickles $p_2$ with $p_3$ (a locus on $p_1$ or an instrument) at $p_4$ (a locus on $p_2$).
$s_1$ is laughter emitted by $s_2=c_1$
self vocative: self-introduction - denial of identity; identifies speaker.
$m_1=c_1$ demands/exacts $c_2=m_3$ of $c_3=m_2$, with manner/form of demand $c_4$.
self vocative: self-introduction - denial of identity; denies identity of speaker.
$x_1=m_1=c_1$ expresses/states command $x_2=c_2$ to recipient(s) $x_3=m_2=c_3$ via expressive medium $x_4=c_4$.
valsi.notes: $m_3$ of {minde} (the desired result) is presumably cointained in he expression of the command. $x_1$ commands $x_3$ with expression $x_2$.

valsi.definition: non-logical interval connective: ordered components: ... center, ... range surrounding center.
$c_1$ repairs/mends/fixes/maintains $c_2$ for use $m_2=c_3$
$c_1$ is technology-oriented science fiction about plot/theme/subject $c_2$ by author $c_3$, based on technology $l_1$.
$s_1$ is a piece of machine $m_1=s_2$.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s) & you the listener(s).
discursive: ditto.
$x_1$ is Burmese in aspect $x_2$.
$c_1$ is a first person pronoun in language $c_4$.
$m_1=p_1$ is me.
valsi.notes: Used instead of {mi} when a brivla is needed.

valsi.definition: $m_1=g_1$ uses surgical implement $k_1$ to operate on organ(s) $k_2$ of patient $m_2$, as a treatment for ailment $m_3$.
$k_1$ is an operating theatre in which to perform surgery $m_4$.
$d_1$ is a clinic/surgery/practice with doctor(s) $m_1$.
$x_1$ is medicine/medical science/medical treatment to $x_2$ for ailment$x_3$ by treatment/cure $x_4$.
$x_{1}$ is in/at the middle/center/midpoint/[is a focus] of $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is central.
$n_1$ is an instruction for $n_2=m_3$ (event/state) to occur, issued by $n_3=m_1$ for intended recipient $n_4=m_2$.
$v_1$ is a command word/keyword ordering $v_2=m_3$ (event/state) in language $v_3$.
$x_{1}$ is encoded/cipher text of plain-text $x_{2}$ by code/coding system $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is in code; $x_{3}$ is a code.
$x_{1}$ is a meal with meal dish $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a diameter between $x_2$ and $x_3$ of $x_4$.
$x_{1}$ doctors/treats/nurses/[cures]/is physician/midwife to $x_{2}$ for ailment $x_{3}$ by treatment/cure $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also medic; (adjective:) $x_1$, $x_4$ is medical; $x_2$ is a patient of $x_1$ (= selmikce for reordered places) ; $x_2$ is treated by $x_1$ person/$x_4$ treatment/method; successfully cure transitive (= {sadmikce}, {sadvelmikce}), intransitive (= sadyselmikce, ka'orbi'o to not imply an external agent/process, though the $x_1$ and $x_4$ of mikce may be self/internal); treatment (= {velmikce}). See also {bilma}, {kanro}, {spita}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a millionth [$10^{-6}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$m_1$ is a hagfish of species $m_2$.
$x_1$ is $x_2$ microseconds in duration.
$g_1$ is $g_2$ micrograms in mass (default is 1) by standard $g_3$.
$g1$ is $g2$ milligrams in mass by standard $g3$
$x_1$ is $x_2$ milliseconds in duration.
$x_{1}$ is a thousandth [1/1000; $10^{-3}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$mit_1=mil_1$ is $mit_2=mil_1$ (one by default) millimeter(s) in length measured in direction $mit_3$ by standard $mit_4$.
$x_{1}$ is mild/non-extreme/gentle/middling/somewhat in property $x_{2}$ (ka); $x_{1}$ is not very $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a sequence of members $x_2$, $x_3$, $x_4$, ... in that order.
valsi.notes: The ordering rule is simply the order of the arguments, the unordered set is the set with members x2, x3, x4, ...

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ issues commands/orders to $x_{2}$ for result $x_{3}$ (event/state) to happen; $x_{3}$ is commanded to occur.
valsi.notes: [also: $x_1$ orders/sets/Triggers. $x_2$ to do/bring about $x_3$; $x_1$ is a commander; commanded (= {termi'e})]; See also {lacri}, te {bende}, {jatna}, {ralju}, {jitro}, {turni}, {tinbe}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a machine for use/function $x_{2}$; [automated apparatus, without direct function control].
valsi.notes: Also machinery/mechanism; a machine is initiated/triggered by an agent/force, but thereafter performs its function automatically; if self-directed, (a minji is an) entity (= {zukte}). See also {cabra}, {matra}, {tutci}, {zukte}, {pilno}, {skami}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ (default 1) long local distance unit(s) [non-metric], $x_{3}$ subunits, standard $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {mitre}, {kilto}, {clani}, {ganra}, {condi}, {rotsu}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ reflects/mirrors/echoes $x_{2}$ [object/radiation] to observer/point $x_{3}$ as $x_{4}$; $x_{2}$ bounces on $x_{1}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ is a mirror/reflector. $x_2$ may be light, lu'e of an imaged object; $x_4$ may be image or echo or the same as $x_2$ if physical object; $x_3$ may be a path for a bounced object; ka is reflection. See also {catlu}, {viska}, {lenjo}, {pensi}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is the same/identical thing as $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$; ($x_{1}$ and $x_{2}$ interchangeable).
valsi.notes: (cf. panra, satci, mapti, simsa, drata, dunli, cmavo list du - which has no standard place, simxu)

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ keeps $x_{2}$ secret/hidden from $x_{3}$ by method $x_{4}$; $x_{2}$ is a secret; $x_{1}$ hides/conceals $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Intransitive hidden/secret, without an agent (= {selcri} or {nalterju'o}); secret (= {selmipri}). See also {stace}, {mifra}, {sivni}, {djuno}, {cirko}, {jarco}.

valsi.definition: $s_1$ (place) hides $m_2=s_2$ from $m_3$ by method $m_4$; $s_1$ is a hiding place.
$x_1$ is a bug of species $x_2$.
$tu_1=m_2$ is a bug used by $ti_1=m_1$ to listen to $ti_2$ without $mi_3$ being aware.
$f_1=m_1$ secretly opposes $f_2=m_3$ regarding $f_3$ (abstract) with secrecy method $m_4$.
$x_1=p_1=m_1$ hides/conceals $x_2=p_2$ from $x_4=m_3$ on/at surface/locus $x_3=p_3=m_1$, the location being kept secret by method $x_5=m_4$.
$z_1$ spies/snoops on $z_2$ using senses/means $z_3$ under conditions $z_4$.
$x_1$ glitters/sparkles/glares, reflecting $x_2$ to observer $x_3$.
$l_1$ is symmetrical about axis $m_1$.
$x_{1}$ is a deer/elk/moose/[hart/stag/doe] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$s_1$ is symmetrical about axis $m_1$.
$s_1=m_4$ is a notion of $s_2=m_2$ to cognizer $s_3=m_3$.
valsi.notes: A mental reflection of real objects and phenomena in their essential features and relations. Cf. {sidbo}, {selpei}, {selga'e}, {tarmi}.

valsi.definition: $s_1=m_4$ is an echo of sound $m_2=s_2$, reflected by $m_1$ and heard by $m_3$.
$x_{1}$ (person/object/event) is famous/renowned/is a celebrity among community of persons $x_{2}$ (mass).
valsi.notes: Also celebrated/well-known; (derogative meanings:) notorious/infamous (= malmi'o; these could also be expressed using the referenced words). See also se {sinma}, {banli}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ reflects Egyptian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$m_1=b_1$ is the Egyptian Arabic language used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$x_1$ is an Egyptian fraction with denominators $x_2$, $x_3$, ...
$x_1$ is Egypt.
$x_1$ is an Egyptian character in writing system $x_2$ (hieroglyphic/hieratic/demotic) meaning $x_3$.
$x_1$ is papyrus from source $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a papyrus plant of variety $x_2$.
$m_1=s_2$ is glorified by $s_1$.
$x_1$ is homosexual/gay/lesbian;.
$c_1$ is homosexual/bisexual in situation $c_2$ by standard $c_4$.
$m_1=f_1$ is palindromic by standard $m_3$.
$s_1=m_1$ seems to be the same as $m_2$ by standard $m_3$ to observer $s_3$ under conditions $s_4$.
$mo_1=mi_1$ follows the same pattern as $mi_2$ with respect to forms/events $mo_2$ arranged according to structure $mo_3$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ meter(s) [metric unit] in length (default 1) measured in direction $x_{3}$ by standard $x_{4}$.
$v_1=m_1$ is a synonym of $m_2$ by standard $m_3$ in language $v_3$.
$m_1=j_1=c_1$ cannibalizes $c_2$. $m_1=j_1=c_1$ is a cannibal.
$x_1=m_1$ is a zoo at $x_3=m_3$ with animals $x_2=m_2=j_1=d_1$.
$g_1$ reincarnates/resurrects $j_1$ by standard $j_2$.
$m_1$ is nature/the world of living things $m_2=j_1$, defined by rules $m_3$.
$x_1=m_1$ is a life-goal of $x_3=m_3=j_1$ motivating $x_2=m_2$ .
$p_1$ is the life of $j_1$ through stages $p_4$.
valsi.notes: This focuses on the process of x2's life as a succession of stages (childhood, chrysalis, etc.), while {nunji'e} more generally denotes the event of x2 being alive without a default terbri to specify the stages x2 goes through during that event.

valsi.definition: $l_1$ is adenosine triphosphate (ATP) transporting energy within organism $l_2=j_1$.
$x_1$ is organic, originating in living organism $x_2$.
$n_2$ (number) is the age (in years) of living thing $j_1$, alive by standard $j_2$, with year standard $n_3$.
$s_1$ is biology/Life Science based on methodology $s_2$.
$xu_1$ is an instance of chemical substance $xu_2$ derived from biological source $j_1$.
$x_{1}$ (mass) is a mixture/blend/colloid/commingling with ingredients including $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$ mingles/mixes/blends into $x_1$; $x_2$ is in $x_1$, an ingredient/part/component/element of $x_1$ (= selxre for reordered places). See also {salta}, te {runta}, {stasu}, {jicla}, {sanso}.

valsi.definition: $f_1$ is a flatfish of family/genus/species $f_2$, swimming with side $m_1$ upward.
$x_1$ is July of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$x_1=k_1=m_4$ dodges/sidesteps/skirts $x_2=m_2$ from $x_3=k_3$ by route $x_4=k_4$ by means of transportation $x_5=k_5$.
valsi.notes: The lateral frame of reference is that of the one who sidesteps. Cf. {mlana}, {klama}, {koizva}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a paperbark/tea tree of species/variety $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is to the side of/lateral to $x_{2}$ and facing $x_{3}$ from point of view/in-frame-of-reference $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: (cf. crane, trixe, pritu, zunle which differ in that the direction of facing is the front and not the lateral side. The $x_4$ of mlana may be either the front, or back side of $x_2$, korbi)

valsi.definition: $m_1=p_1$ is the side of / is a part and on the side of $m_2=p_2$ and is facing $m_3$ from point of view/in-frame-of-reference $m_4$.
$f_2$ is sideways from $f_3=m_2$ .
valsi.notes: $x_3=f_1$, the exact direction, is unspecified. Cf. {mlana}, {farna}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a cat/[puss/pussy/kitten] [feline animal] of species/breed $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is feline.
$m_1$ is a sideband of signal $b_1=m_2$.
$m_1=b_1$ is splendid/glorious/magnificent to $m_2$ in aspect $m_3$ (ka) by aesthetic standard $m_4$, and by greatness standard $b_4$.
$x_{1}$ is less than $x_{2}$ in property/quantity $x_{3}$ (ka/ni) by amount $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also negative (= {nonme'a}). See also cmavo list {me'a}, cmavo list {su'o}, {jdika}, {zmadu}, {traji}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a mold/fungus/mushrooms/truffles of species/strain $x_{2}$ parasitic/growing on $x_{3}$.
$ma_1=g_1$ is a cosmetic/makeup for beautifying $me_1$ in aspect $me_3$, made up of material $ma_2$ in form $ma_3$
valsi.notes: me2, me4 dropped g2 is lo nu me1 melbi zi'o me3

valsi.definition: $j_1$ is vain.
$g_1$ grooms/spruces up $c_1=m_1$ in property/aspect $c_2=m_3$.
$m_1=t_1$ is most beautiful among set/range $t_3$ to $m_2$ in aspect $m_3$ (ka) by aesthetic standard $m_4$.
$ta_1=tr_1=m_1$ is coquettish/flirtatious with $tr_2=m_2$ in aspect $m_3$
$x_1=m_1=b_1$ whispers/mumbles/murmurs/coos utterance $x_2=b_2$; $x_1=m_1=b_1$ speaks softly.
$x_1$ is molybdenum.
$b_1=m_1$ is breeze/zephyr from direction $b_2$ with speed $b_3$.
$b_1=m_1$ is somewhat big in dimension $b_2$ by standard $b_3$.
$b_1$ is mildly embarrassed/disconcerted about/under conditions $b_2$ (abstraction).
$f_1$ (event) slightly annoys/irritates/bothers/distracts $f_2$.
$m_1=f_1=b_1$ grumbles with sound $b_2$ at $f_2$ because of $f_3$ (action/state/property).
valsi.notes: jvajvo definition; Gismu deep structure is "milxe gi'e fengu gi'e bacru"

valsi.definition: $g_1=m_1$ is warm by standard $g_2$.
$l_1=m_1$ is cool (mildly cold) by standard $l_2$.
$c_1$ chuckles.
$r_1$ (event/state) mildens/allays/alleviates effect $r_2$ (event/state) under conditions $r_3$.
$s_1$ (agent) pets/gently strokes $s_2$ with $s_3$.
$x_1$ is eggplant of variety $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a satellite/moon orbiting $x_{2}$ with characteristics $x_{3}$, orbital parameters $x_{4}$.
pro-bridi: bridi/selbri/brivla question.
digit/number: too few; subjective.
tense interval modifier: too few times; objective tense; defaults as time tense.
convert sumti to mex operand; sample use in story arithmetic: [3 apples] + [3 apples] = what.
mark motions in space-time.
space motion tense: northwardly; to the north directional space motion.
space motion tense: moving to coincide directional space motion.
space motion tense: forward directional space motion.
space motion tense: eastwardly; to the east directional space motion.
space motion tense: arriving at; arriving at a point directional space motion.
space motion tense: upwardly; upwards directional space motion.
space motion tense: approximating; moving around the neighborhood of ... space motion.
space motion tense: moving into directional space motion.
space motion tense: southwardly; to the south directional space motion.
space motion tense: downwardly; downwards directional space motion.
space motion tense: passing through directional space motion.
space motion tense: along; along a path directional space motion.
space motion tense: rightwardly; to the right directional space motion.
space motion tense: orbiting; surrounding/annular directional space motion.
$s_1$ is a memory/storage/anamnesis containing facts/data/recollection $s_2=m_2$ within medium/substrate/containment $s_3$, said facts related to subject $m_3$.
$s_1=m_1$ forgets fact/memory $m_2$ about subject $m_3$.
space motion tense: moving along the border directional space motion.
space motion tense: rearwardsly; rearwards directional space motion.
space motion tense: moving away from a point directional space motion.
space motion tense: westwardly; to the west directional space motion.
space motion tense: outwardsly; outward directional space motion.
space motion tense: passing by a site directional space motion.
space motion tense: approaching directional space motion.
space motion tense: leftwardsly; to the left directional space motion.
higher-order utterance ordinal suffix; converts a number to ordinal, usually a section/chapter.
interval event contour: at the natural ending point of ...; completive | >|<.
convert number to ordinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is (n)th member of set $x_{2}$ ordered by rule $x_{3}$.
$g_1$ reminds $m_1$ of facts $m_2$ about $m_3$.
$x_1=n_1$ is a message reminding facts $x_2=m_2$ about $x_3=m_3=n_2$ from author $x_4=n_3=g_1$ to intended audience $x_5=n_4=m_1$.
$z_1$ has a better memory than $z_2$ with regards to facts $m_2$ about subject $m_3$ by amount/excess $z_4$.
$r_1$ (event) reminds $m_1$ of facts $m_2$ about subject $m_3$ under conditions $r_3$.
$p_1=m_1$ remembers/thinks back/reminisces about $p_2=m_3$, recalling facts $m_2$.
$s_1$ is a structure of parts $s_2$ as a monument/memorial to $m_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a point/instant/moment [0-dimensional shape/form] in/on/at time/place $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the mouth/oral cavity [body-part] of $x_{2}$; (metaphor: entrance/intake for consumption).
$g_1$ is a muzzle on $m_2$
$g_1$ is the palate of $m_2$.
$g_1=m_2$ performs oral sex on $g_2$.
valsi.notes: Cf. {gletu}, {vibgle}, {gaxygle}. le gletu is taken as the 'active' partner.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a mill/foundry/industrial plant/[assembly line] performing process $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: (unlike fanri,) need not produce a product; grain mill (= {grumlo}), grinding mill (= {zalmlo}, {zalmlotci}, {zalmloca'a}). See also {gasta}, {gurni}, {tirse}, {fanri}, {zalvi}.

valsi.definition: $m_1=s_1$ is a philtrum (infranasal depression) of $m_2=s_2$.
$x_1$ is the cheek of $x_2$ (person/animal)
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ mole(s) [metric unit] in substance (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_1=s_2$ is saliva/sput/sputum/spittle of $x_2=s_1$.
$t_1$ is a mouthpiece/embouchure of material $t_2$ conveying fluid $t_3$.
$x_1$ is the $x_2$nd member of set $x_3$ ordered by rule $x_4$ .
$f_1$ is an emulation/imitation of $f_2$ in medium $f_3$, emulated by method $f_4$ and exhibiting pattern $m_1$.
$x_1=g_1$ (agent) emulates $x_3=f_2$ resulting in emulation/imitation $x_2=f_1$ in medium $x_4=f_3$ by method $x_5=f_4$ exhibiting pattern $x_6=m_1$.
$x_{1}$ remembers/recalls/recollects fact(s)/memory $x_{2}$ (du'u) about subject $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Moroccan culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is/reflects/represents a pattern of forms/events $x_{2}$ arranged according to structure $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: [$x_3$ is a model for $x_1$ (= {termontai}, or the more abstract = {termonsi'o}); image (= {gusmo'a}, {nenmo'a}, {dairmo'a}, {selylenmo'a}, {selmirmo'a}, {velmirmo'a}, but also all of these -tai instead of -mo'a for the ideal)]; See also {ciste}, {ganzu}, {marji}, {slilu}, {stura}, {tarmi}, {boxna}, {cimde}, {gidva}, {jimpe}, {rilti}.

valsi.definition: Morse; Morse code, telegraphy.
$x_{1}$ is dead/has ceased to be alive.
$x_{1}$ is friction [force opposing motion] due to contact/rubbing between $x_{2}$ and $x_{3}$; (fe) $x_{2}$ rubs $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also $x_2$ scrubs/wipes/brushes (against) $x_3$ (= {seltermosra}); non-agentive rub (= {termosra}). See also {sakli}, {sraku}, {jabre}, {satre}, {guska}, {pencu}, {spali}.

valsi.definition: $l_1$ drags/hauls $l_2=m_2$ by handle/at locus $l_3$ along surface $m_3$.
$v_1=m_2$ rubs off $v_2$ from $v_3=m_3$ leaving remainder $v_4$.
$m_1$ is Welsh in aspect $m_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of rye [grain] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$ml_1$ is ergot of species $ml_2$.
valsi.notes: A fungus that grows on rye and other cereals; it contains the alkaloid ergotamine, which has hallucinogenic effects on humans and animals, and from which {LSD!en} is synthesized.

valsi.definition: $n_1$ is a real number.
$s_1$ is metrology based on methodology $s_2$.
$x_{1}$ mails/posts [transfer via intermediary service] $x_{2}$ to recipient address $x_{3}$ from mailbox/post office/sender address $x_{4}$ by carrier/network/system $x_{5}$.
valsi.notes: Also $x_4$ post office, mailbox. (cf. benji In which the medium need not be a 3rd party service/system, and $x_2$ need not consist of discrete units. notci, xatra, tcana)

valsi.definition: $l_1$ is a mailing list with subscribers/recipients $l_2=m_3$.
$b_1$ dies under conditions $b_3$.
$mu_1$ is a natural history museum for preserving [and possibly exhibiting] animals of kind $mu_2=d_2=mo_1$ at location $mu_3$.
$x_1$ is mortal/subject to death.
$b_1$ mourns/grieves over the death of $m_1=b_2$
$f_1$ is a cemetery/graveyard/burial ground for dead person(s)/animal(s) $m_1$.
$m_1=k_1$ is mortal/capable of dying under conditions $k_3$.
valsi.notes: Used in Theodore Reed's translation of "A Princess of Mars".

valsi.definition: $k_1$ is a grave in ground $k_2$ for $m_1$.
$x_1$ is the cause of $x_2$'s death under conditions $x_3$; $x_1$ kills $x_2$.
$x1$=$s1$ is widowed from $x2$=$m1$=$s2$ by law/convention $x3$=$s3$
$s_1$ is the grave/tomb of $m_1=s_2$.
$k_1$ buries/inters corpse/[entomb] $k_2=m_1$ at grave/cemetery/[mausoleum/crypt] $k_3$
valsi.notes: k4 dropped because of little use in this application.

valsi.definition: $v_1$ is a coffin containing $v_2=m_1$.
$x_1$ is the hammer/malleus in ear $x_2$ in body $x_3$
$x_{1}$ [tool] is a hammer for/hammers $x_{2}$ [target] consisting of weight/head $x_{3}$ propelled by $x_{4}$.
digit/number: 5 (digit) [five].
discursive: for example - omitting - end examples.
discursive: for example - omitting - end examples.
discursive: for example - omitting - end examples.
abstractor: achievement (event) abstractor; $x_{1}$ is the event-as-a-point/achievement of [bridi].
Converts PA into tense; in [number (usually nonspecific)] possible worlds/alternate histories where [sumti (du'u)] is true
valsi.notes: Includes what "may have happened" if the past were different from the actual past. See {ba'oi}

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is cosmology (in astronomy) based on methodology $x_2$
$s_1$ is cosmology based on methodology $s_3$.
$t_1$ is a lord of universe $t_2=m_1$.
mukti modal, 1st place because of motive ...
sumti question asking for a motive; why?.
mukti modal, 1st place despite motive ...
vocative: over (response OK) - more to come.
vocative: over (response OK) - more to come.
mupli modal, 1st place exemplified by ...
$x_{1}$ is immaterial/not physical/without material form.
$x_1$ is a block of wood $x_2$ with surfaces $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains wood/lumber from tree(s) of type/species $x_{2}$.
$j_1$ is a termite of species $j_2$.
$x_1$ is Thursday of week $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$.
$f_1$ is a wood fire burning in/reacting with oxidizer $f_3$.
$p_1$ is a woodcutter/lumberjack using tool $k_1$ to cut trees of species $m_2$.
$p_1=m_1$ is sawdust of wood type $p_2=m_2$.
$t_1$ is an adze
$m_1$ is the marriage of $s_1$ and $s_2$ under convention $s_3$.
$k_1$ is universal in domain $m_2$ defined by rules $m_3$
$t_2$ is the internet/cyberspace that includes nodes/computers $t_1=s_1$ whose function/purpose is $s_2$.
number/quantity: 5,000 expressed with comma.
$x_{1}$ (action/event/state) motivates/is a motive/incentive for action/event $x_{2}$, per volition of $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also; $x_3$ is motivated to bring about result/goal/objective $x_2$ by $x_1$ (= termu'i for reordered places); (note that 'under conditions' BAI may apply and be appropriately added to the main predicate level or within the $x_2$ action level). (cf. cmavo list {mu'i}, {nibli}, te {zukte} - generally better for 'goal', se {jalge}, {krinu}, {rinka}, {ciksi}, {djica}, {xlura})

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is completed in property $x_2$ according to standard $x_3$
$x_1$ (event) is after $x_2$ (event) concludes. $x_1$ is in the future when $x_2$ finishes
$f_1$ is the end/finish/completion of completed thing/process $f_2=m_1$.
$g_1$ makes $m_1$ complete in property $m_2$ by standard $m_4$.
$g_1=m_1$ is a complete set showing common property (ka) $g_2$, complete by standard $m_3$.
$g_1=m_1$ is a mass/team/aggregate/whole, together composed solely/completely/wholly of components x2, considered jointly, by standard $m_3$.
valsi.notes: From {mulno} + {gunma}. Just {gunma} with a complete specification of members. $m_2$ dropped since the property is always "membership in the mass in question". $m_3$ left in since it seems to do no harm, although its meaning seems a bit unclear here.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is almost/nearly done/complete/finished/whole in property $x_2$ by standard $x_3$.
$k_1=m_1$ arrives at $k_2$ from $k_3$ via route $k_4$ by means $k_5$.
$n_1$ is an integer.
$s_1=mn_1$ is an indivisible / prime number in integer domain $s_2$.
$x_{1}$ (event) is complete/done/finished; $x_{1}$ (object) has become whole in property $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also perfected, entirety; (adverb/adjective:) entire, total, integral, fully, totally, wholly, completely, entirely. See also {fanmo}, {culno}, {pagbu}, {xadba}, {prane}, {jalge}, {sumji}, {munje}, {sisti}, {xadni}.

valsi.definition: $p_1$ is the integer result of multiplying integer $p_2$ by integer $p_3$.
$m_1=t_3$ (du'u) is unanimous / based on complete agreement among $t_1=t_2$.
Mumbai.
$x_1$ is a Friday of week $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
quantifier selbri: convert 5 to cardinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is a set with the quintet of members $x_{2}$.
quantified selbri: convert 5 to ordinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is fifth among $x_{2}$ ordered by rule $x_{3}$.
Jupiter.
$p_1$ is the fifth closest planet (default is Jupiter if p2 is the Sun) revolving around $p_2$ (default is the Sun), with planetary characteristics $p_3$, orbital parameters $p_4$.
May.
$x_1$ is May/the fifth month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$m_1=d_1$ is the little finger of $d_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a universe/cosmos [complete and ordered entirety] of domain/sphere $x_{2}$ defined by rules $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also world; a universe is a kind of system, one which comprehensively encompasses its domain; e.g. 'universe of discourse', or 'world of birds'; $x_3$ are the rules/defining principles which distinguish the universe from other universes, or from non-universe. See also {ciste}, {plini}, {kensa}, {mulno}.

valsi.definition: number/quantity: 50 [fifty].
number/quantity: 500 [five hundred].
$c_1$ takes a sample of $c_2=m_2$ from source/set $c_3=m_3$.
$x_{1}$ is an example/sample/specimen/instance/case/illustration of common property(s) $x_{2}$ of set $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is the [astronomical] twilight/dawn/dusk/half-light/glimmering of day $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Morning twilight, dawn (= {cermurse}); evening twilight, dusk (= {vacmurse}). See also {cerni}, {kandi}, {vanci}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a curtain/blinds/drapes for covering/obscuring aperture $x_{2}$, and made of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ pertains to the Islamic/Moslem/Koranic [Quranic] culture/religion/nation in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a weasel of species/variety $x_2$
$x_{1}$ is much/extreme in property $x_{2}$ (ka), towards $x_{3}$ extreme/direction; $x_{1}$ is, in $x_{2}$, very $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also very, pretty, a lot, immoderate/immoderately, intense, quite, extremely. See also {milxe}, {traji}, {banli}, {carmi}, {nutli}, {traji}.

valsi.definition: $mi_1=mu_1$ is an algorithm for use/function $mu_2$.
$p_1=m_1$ is a web page containing hyperlinks in website / collection of hyperlinking documents $p_2$.
valsi.notes: Cf. {mucti}, {papri}, {samci'ejudri}. Not tied specifically to the HTTP or other communications protocol.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (object) moves to destination/receiver $x_{2}$ [away] from origin $x_{3}$ over path/route $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also mobile (= comymu'u, for the non-specific opposite of immobile); after a muvdu, object is alienated from/no longer at origin (unless physically returned there, per litru or slilu); agentive move (= {muvgau}, {muvzu'e}), non-agentive transitive move (= {muvri'a}), self-propelled (= {sezmuvgau}), motion of a part of the object (= {pagmu'u}), having a moving part (= {muvypau}, {muvyselpau}); apparent motion (= {mlumu'u}). (cf. rinci, klama (which differs in that the means of motion is explicit), litru, cliva, fatri; dunda, benji for agentive movement that does not necessarily imply alienation from origin, preja for similar movement with no agent implied, bevri, vimcu)

valsi.definition: $g_1$ moves $m_1$ to destination $m_2$ from origin $m_3$ over path/route $m_4$.

$x_1$ is $x_2$ centuries in duration by standard $x_3$.

$x_{1}$ hopes/wishes for/desires $x_{2}$ (event), expected likelihood $x_{3}$ (0-1); $x_{1}$ hopes that $x_{2}$ happens.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ is hopeful of $x_2$; $x_2$ will hopefully occur, as hoped for by $x_1$; the value of $x_3$ is a subjective estimate of likeliness according to $x_1$, and is the basic determinant of whether pacna means 'hope' or 'wish' or 'expect': hoping for objects/states with negligible expectation is "wishing"; if the state is plausibly likely, it is "hoping"; when the probability is subjectively near 1, the attitude is described as "expecting"; the value will usually be expressed using inexact numbers ("{li} {piso'u}" to "{li} {piro}"); wish (= {sotpa'a}), hope (= {sorpa'a}), expect (= {sojypa'a}). See also {djica}.

valsi.definition: $t_1$ is the Hell of evil spirit(s) $t_2=pa_1=pr_1$, evil by standard $pa_2$.
$x_1=z_2=p_1$ is a sin/evil action by $x_2=z_1$ for purpose/goal $z_3$, evil/depraved/wicked (morally bad) by standerd $x_4=p_2$.
$xl_1$ (agent) tempts $xl_2$ into evil $xl_3=p_1$ by influence/threat/lure $xl_4$, said act being evil by standard $p_2$.

valsi.notes: Passing through in both directions (= rolfargre, pagre ... .i so'ivo'ivo'u (and vice versa)). See also {bitmu}, {denci}, {ganlo}, {kalri}, {vorme}, {pluta}, {canko}, {ragve}.

valsi.definition: $p_1=c_1$ is a tab (navigational widget) in $p_2=c_2$.
valsi.notes: x2 is usually a web browser or a text editor. Cf. {pagbu}, {canko}.

$x_1$ is fair/just/equitable/impartial/unprejudiced/unbiased in judging/refereeing/arbitrating/determining/deciding matter $x_2$.

$x_{1}$ judges/referees/arbitrates/is a judge determining/deciding matter $x_{2}$ (abstract).
valsi.notes: $x_2$ includes jei = rule (jetpai), ni = estimate (lairpai), ka = evaluate (kairpai or vampai), or nu = referee/arbitrate (faurpai); single events of judging including specific decisions/judgements (= {paijdi}, {jetpaijdi}, {lairpaijdi}, {kairpaijdi}, {vampaijdi}, {faurpaijdi}); jury (= {pairkamni}), serve on a jury (= kamnypai, as part of mass $x_1$). See also {cuxna}, {jdice}, {vajni}, {cipra}, {zekri}, {manri}, {mansa}.

valsi.definition: number/quantity: 1,000 expressed with comma.

valsi.notes: Also pallet, when used for carrying rather than support on the ground; a tray is flat-bottomed and shallow or without a rim, and is generally portable. See also {tansi}, {patxu}, {palta}, {ckana}.

valsi.notes: $x_2$ fluid may be liquid or gas; $x_5$ may be a force; a pump generally causes a pressure gradient, such that $x_3$ is a place of lower pressure, $x_4$ a place of higher pressure. (cf. {gapci}, {litki}, {rinci}; metaphorical use of {fepri} for gas, {risna} for liquid, {rinci}, {tutci})

valsi.definition: quantified selbri: convert 1 to cardinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is a set with single/sole/only member $x_{2}$.

valsi.notes: An undetected emitter is odorless to the observer. See also {nazbi}, {sumne}, {cpina}.

$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of sponge/porous material.
valsi.notes: Also metaphorically used for coral, Swiss cheese. See also cokcu for a generalized {absorbant}.

valsi.definition: $j_1=p_2$ is incense emitting odor $p_1$.

$x_{1}$ is a slice [thin flat portion] of $x_{2}$ (mass).
number/quantity: 10 [ten].
number/quantity: 10,000,000 [ten millions](Western numbering system/1,00,00,000 [100 lakhs](Indian numbering system).

number/quantity: 100 [one hundred].
number/quantity: 100,000 [hundred thousand](Western numbering system)/[one lakh](Indian numbering system)..
quantifier selbri: convert 100 to cardinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is a set with the century of members $x_{2}$.

valsi.notes: (cf. jamna; use sarxe, smaji, tugni for most metaphorical extensions, cilce, jamna)

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ parallels $x_{2}$ differing only in property $x_{3}$ (ka; jo'u/fa'u term) by standard/geometry $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ is parallel to $x_2$, $x_3$ is the only difference between $x_1$ and $x_2$ (= {terpanra} for reordered places); $x_1$ and $x_2$ are alike/similar/congruent. A parallel involves extreme close similarity/correspondence across the entirety of the things being compared, generally involving multiple properties, with focus placed on one or a small number of differences. See also {pa'a}, {mintu}, {simsa}, {girzu}, {vrici}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ protests/objects to/complains about $x_{2}$ (event/state) to audience $x_{3}$ with action $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: ($x_4$ is an event or tu'a quotation) See also {xarnu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a [biological] offspring/child/kid/hybrid of parent(s) $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is filial.
number/quantity: 11 [eleven].

valsi.definition: $x_1$ make up/peace with each other under condition $x_2$.

Peking
yellow fever.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a pear [fruit] of species/strain $x_{2}$.

valsi.notes: Also utilize; $x_2$ is useful/used productively by $x_1$ to do $x_3$ (= selpli for reordered places); hire/employ (= {le'ipli}, {lejyplicu'a}). (cf. {tutci}, {cabra}, {minji}, {gasnu}, {zukte} for $x_2$, cmavo list {pi'o}, {sazri}, {jibri})

half.

valsi.notes: Cf. {pinji}, {skapi}, {vimcu}. See also {pinjyskapi}. Also: $v_1$ is a mohel.

valsi.definition: $s_1$ is the foreskin of $p_2=s_2$.
$x_{1}$ (text) is a comment/remark/observation about subject $x_{2}$ expressed by $x_{3}$ to audience $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_3$ comments/remarks/says $x_1$ about $x_2$ (= terselpinka for reordered places). See also {jinvi}, {cusku}, {zgana}, {lanli}, {bacru}, {ciska}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a row/rank of table/chart $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a seal/sea lion/otary/walrus of genus/species $x_2$.
valsi.notes: seal: {kermipri} pinpedi; sea lion: {kerja'o} pinpedi; see also {mabru}, {odbenu}

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a pencil/crayon/stylus applying lead/marking material $x_{2}$, frame/support [of material] $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also writing brush; $x_1$ stimulates substrate medium $x_2$ to display marks; explicitly denoting a standard lead pencil (= {tabypinsi}). (cf. ciska, penbi (unlike the English equivalents, pinsi is the more general term over penbi), burcu, bakri)

valsi.definition: $s_1=p_1$ prostrates him/herself/itself before $s_2$.
$x_{1}$ is flat/level/horizontal in gravity/frame of reference $x_{2}$.
$v_1$ lies on $v_2=p_1$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) drinks/imbibes beverage/drink/liquid refreshment $x_{2}$ from/out-of container/source $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is a row vector of dimension $x_2$ with coordinates $x_3$, $x_4$, ...
$k_1=p_1$ skips/hops to $k_2=p_2$ from $k_3=p_3$ via route $k_4$.
$x_{1}$ is a piano/harpsichord/synthesizer/organ; a keyboard musical instrument.
$p_1=b_1$ is a frog/toad of species $b_2$.
$x_1$ is a grasshopper of order/species/breed $x_2$.
quantified selbri: convert .2 = 1/5 to portion selbri; $x_{1}$ is 1/5 of mass/totality $x_{2}$.
$f_1=p_3$ paints picture $f_2=p_1$ in style/art form $l_1$ representing/showing $p_2=f_4$ on medium $p_4$
number: all of.
quantified selbri: converts all-of to portion selbri; $x_{1}$ is the whole portion of mass $x_{2}$.
number: almost all of.
number: much of.
tense interval modifier: often; objectively quantified tense; defaults as time tense.
number: a little of.
tense interval modifier: rarely; objectively quantified tense; defaults as time tense.
number: at least some of.
$m_1$ is $m_2$ square kilometers on side / facing $m_3$ by standard $m_4$.
$n_1$ is a pizza with topping/ingredients $n_2$.
Python.
$x_{1}$ is a picture/illustration representing/showing $x_{2}$, made by artist $x_{3}$ in medium $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is pictorial/illustrative; drawing (= {xraselci'a}), $x_1$ draws $x_2$ (= xraci'a/xraci'a), image (= {xratai}), photo (= {kacmyxra}), take a photo (= {kacmyterxra}, {kacmyxragau}, {kacmyxrazu'e}); sculpture, relief (= {blixra}). See also {ciska}, {cinta}, {prina}, {mupli}, {barna}, {skina}.

valsi.definition: $j_1=p_2$ is a policy by $p_1$ policy maker regarding $j_3$ subject of policy, $j_1$ is political
valsi.notes: Made out of {platu}, {javni}. Politics as an activity may be "nu plajva" and political science may be "plajva saske"

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is plump/fat/obese [excessively thick/bulbous/swollen] by standard $x_{2}$.
Planck.
$x_1$ is a plantain (small plant with flower spike) of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a geranium of species/variety $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a sycamore (Platanus) of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a plaice of species $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) plans/designs/plots plan/arrangement/plot/[schematic] $x_{2}$ for state/process $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also invents/organizes; $x_2$ design, scheme; the structure or layout of an object would be represented as a state in $x_3$. See also {cartu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ pays/compensates/remunerates/[rewards] payment $x_{2}$ to recipient/payee $x_{3}$ for goods/services $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also $x_4$ commodities; $x_4$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posle'i}, posyvelyle'i for unambiguous {semantics}); rent (= {jerle'i}, {lejyjbera}). (cf. canja, cnemu, friti, kargu, vecnu, jdima, prali, jerna, sfasa, dunda, jinga, dapma; see note at jdima on cost/price/value distinction, cirko, dirba)

valsi.definition: $k_1$ is a journal/periodical/magazine/[newspaper] printed on paper with content $k_2$ published by $k_3$ for audience $k_4$.
$s_1$ is a cigarette made of $s_2$ by $s_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the pubic area/external genitalia [body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$c_1$ (agent) allows the use of $p_2$ for use $x_3=p_3$ under conditions $x_4=c_3$.
$x_1$ is able to use $x_2$ for purpose $x_3$ under conditions $x_4$.
$x_{1}$ is a planet revolving around $x_{2}$ with planetary characteristics $x_{3}$, orbital parameters $x_{4}$.
$c_1=p_1$ is an asteroid/planetoid revolving around $p_2$ with characteristics $p_3$ and orbital parameters $p_4$.
$k_1$ is the equator of planet $x_2=p_1$ (default Earth) revolving around $p_2$
$x_1$ is a hemisphere of planet $x_2$ (default Earth) revolving around $p_2$
$x_{1}$ (agent/object) leaps/jumps/springs/bounds to $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ reaching height $x_{4}$ propelled by $x_{5}$.
valsi.notes: Place structure parallels klama; hence $x_4$ may be a route-like expression. See also {bajra}, {stapa}, {cpare}, {lafti}.

valsi.definition: $r_1=p_1$ applies $r_2=p_2$ to $r_3=p_3$.
$x_{1}$ is an apple [fruit] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a plane [2-dimensional shape/form] defined by points $x_{2}$ (set); $x_{1}$ is flat/[smooth].
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ is even/planar/level. ($x_2$ is a set of points at least sufficient to define the plane); See also {xutla}, {sefta}, {tapla}, {karda}, {boxfo}, {pinta}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (agent) plows/furrows/tills [cuts into and turns up] $x_{2}$ with tool $x_{3}$ propelled by $x_{4}$.
$x_1$=$p_2$ is useful/good for $x_2=p_1$ by the standard of being usable for purpose $p_3$.
valsi.notes: x3 is "usable". See alse {selplika'e}. Made from {pilno} + {xamgu}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a frill-necked lizard (Chlamydosaurus) of species $x_2$.
$pi_1=po_2$ is a staple for holding together $pi_2$, made of $pi_3$
valsi.notes: cleaned up from auto noralujv migration Conceivably this might include a paper fastener as well. See {plopijnytci} for stapler.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is complex/complicated/involved in aspect/property $x_{2}$ (ka) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (event/state) seems pleasant to/pleases $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a route/path/way/course/track to $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ via/defined by points including $x_{4}$ (set).
valsi.notes: A route merely connects origin/destination, but need not be improved in any way; ($x_4$ is a set of points at least sufficient to constrain the route relevantly). (cf. litru, naxle, tcana, dargu, klaji, ve klama; tadji, zukte for means to a goal, klama, pagre)

valsi.definition: Pluto
restrictive relative phrase marker: which is specific to ...; normal possessive physical/legal.
restrictive relative phrase marker: which belongs to ... ; inalienable possession.
$x_1=p_1=d_1$ wants to own/possess/have $x_2=p_2$ for purpose $x_3=d_3$, wanting to own/possess/have it by right/custom/law $x_4=p_3$.
porsi modal, 1st place (in order) sequentially; in the sequence ...
discursive: uniquely, only, solely: the only relevant case.
$x_1$ reflects Polish culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_2$.
restrictive appositive phrase marker: which is the same thing as.
restrictive relative clause; attaches subordinate bridi with identifying information to a sumti.
$x_1$ is a Pokémon/Pocket Monster of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a halibut of species $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ (force) folds/creases $x_{2}$ at locus/loci/forming crease(s)/bend(s) $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: For agentive folding (= {plogau}, {plozu'e}); use cardinal-value sumti in $x_3$, or rapli, to indicate multiple folds. See also {korcu}, {cinje}, {boxfo}, {boxna}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ reflects Polynesian/Oceanian (geographic region) culture/nationality/languages in aspect $x_{2}$.
Poland
$p_1=b_1$ is the Japanese language used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$p_1=g_1$ is Japan.
$l_1$ is the Shinto religion with beliefs/practices/tenets including $l_3$
$x_{1}$ reflects Japanese culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ possesses/owns/has $x_{2}$ under law/custom $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is owner/proprietor of $x_{2}$ under $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: ($x_3$ is generally more important to the concept than commonly accepted for the English equivalent, since the concept is broader when unconstrained, and the nature/interpretation of possession/ownership is very culturally dependent); See also {ckini}, {ralte}, {jitro}, {steci}, {srana}, {tutra}, {turni}, {zivle}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ breaks/fractures/shatters/[splits/splinters/cracks] into pieces $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [ordered set] is sequenced/ordered/listed by comparison/rules $x_{2}$ on unordered set $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is serial. (sets are completely specified); See also cmavo list {po'i}, {lidne}, {liste}, {cmima}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ reflects Portuguese culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
Group of agents $p_3=z_1$ sequentially perform/take turns doing $z_2$ in order $p_2$ for purpose $z_3$.
$f_1$ is capital stock distributed among shareholders $p_1=f_2$ issued by company/corporation/firm $p_2$ .
$f_3$ is a/are share/shares distributed among $f_2=p_1$, issued by company/corporation/firm $f_1=p_2$ under law $p_3$.
$x_1=p_1$ claims ownership of $x_2=p_2$ in condition $p_3$.
$d_1$ is the price of possessing/owning object $d_2=p_2$ for potential owner $d_3=p_1$ from vendor $d_4$ under law/custom $p_3$
valsi.notes: {ponse}+{jdima}. This variant of {jdima} is pedantically semantic distinction between the price of "ownership" of an object rather than the price of the object itself.

valsi.definition: $f_2=p_1$ is a/are a/the shareholder(s) of company/corporation/firm $f_1=p_2$ with shares/portions $f_3$ under law $p_3$.
$p_1=b_1$ is the Portuguese language used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$j_1$ is capital (factors of production) used to create goods/services $j_2=c_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a profit/gain/benefit/advantage to $x_{2}$ accruing/resulting from activity/process $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also (fe) $x_2$ profits from $x_3$ (= selterprali for reordered places); $x_1$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= selposprali for unambiguous {semantics}). See also {vecnu}, {cnemu}, {pleji}, {jinga}, {canja}, {sfasa}, {jerna}, {jdima}, {dunda}, {zivle}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ loves/feels strong affectionate devotion towards $x_{2}$ (object/state).
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ is loving towards $x_2$, $x_1$ is a lover of $x_2$ (one sense), $x_2$ is beloved by $x_1$ (= selpa'i for reordered places). See also {cinmo}, {xebni}, {nelci}, {djica}, {sinma}, {pluka}, {kurji}, {pendo}, {speni}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is perfect/ideal/archetypical/faultless/flawless/un-improvable in property/aspect $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_1$ is a biography of $x_2$, written/created/composed by $x_3$.
$d_1$ is a profile of person $d_2=p_1$ gathered by method $d_3$.
$x_{1}$ spreads/expands over/into $x_{2}$ from initial state $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a person/people (noun) [not necessarily human]; $x_{1}$ displays personality/a persona.
$x_{1}$ (quoted text) is a question/query about subject $x_{2}$ by questioner $x_{3}$ to audience $x_{4}$.
$g_1$ (agent) prints $p_1$ onto $p_2$ using $p_3$ (tool/method).
$x_{1}$ is wise/sage about matter $x_{2}$ (abstraction) to observer $x_{3}$.
$m_1=p_3$ is a printer/printing machine for printing $p_1$ on surface $p_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a print/impression/image on/in surface $x_{2}$ of/made by/using tool/press/implement/object $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is to the right/right-hand side of $x_{2}$ which faces/in-frame-of-reference $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_3$ is the standard of orientation for $x_2$. See also cmavo list {ri'u}, {mlana}, {crane}, {trixe}, {farna}, {zunle}.

valsi.definition: $xa_1=z_1$ is a/the right hand of $xa_2=z_2$, which faces/in-frame-of-reference $z_3$.
$x_1$ is a racoon of species/breed $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is prose about plot/theme/subject $x_{2}$ by author $x_{3}$ for intended audience $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Non-poetic written text, without intentional rhyme or meter; $x_2$ may be a convention rather than a subject. See also {cfika}, {lisri}, {cukta}, {pemci}, {finti}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a proton in quantum state $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a process with inputs $x_{2}$, outputs/results $x_{3}$, passing through steps/stages $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$ resource (= selru'e, but also ru'etci, (ru'er-/ruc- or selru'e-/selruc- modifying:) selxaksu, selsabji, livla). See also cmavo list {pu'e}, {farvi}, {tadji}, {grute}, {tcini}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ predicts/foretells/anticipates to $x_2$ fact(s) $x_3$ (du'u) about subject $x_4$ by epistemology $x_5$.
$p_1=l_1$ is preceding $p_2=l_2$ in sequence $l_3$.
$n_1=l_1=p_1$ is the night before $p_2=l_2$ at location $n_3$.
$d_1=p_1=l_1$ is yesterday; $d_1=p_1=l_1$ is the day preceding $p_2=l_2$, day standard $d_3$.
$n_1=p_1=l_1$ is yesteryear; $n_1=p_1=l_1$ is the year preceding $p_2=l_2$ by year standard $n_3$.
(adjective:) $x_{1}$ is elastic/springy.
$pun_1$ prepones/moves forward $pun_2$ to before $pur_2$.
$s_1$ is the ex-wife/husband of $s_2$ under law/custom/tradition/system/convention $s_3$.
$x_{1}$ is spiritual/pertains to the soul in nature [either energy or being]; $x_{1}$ is ghostly/ethereal.
time tense relation/direction: did [selbri]; before/prior to [sumti]; default past tense.
pluka modal, 1st place pleased by ...
pruce modal, 1st place (in manner 1) by process ...
modal aspect: can and has; demonstrated potential.
interval event contour: in anticipation of ...; until ... ; inchoative ----| |.
abstractor: process (event) abstractor; $x_{1}$ is process of [bridi] proceeding in stages $x_{2}$.
time tense: was going to; (tense/modal).
time tense: past actuality; modal aspect.
time tense: was then; (tense/modal).
time tense: before and after; (tense/modal).
time tense: before and during; (tense/modal).
$x_{1}$ is dust/precipitate [suspensible solid] from $x_{2}$ in medium/on surface $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a police officer/[enforcer/vigilante] enforcing law(s)/rule(s)/order $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Police officer, as an agent of authority (= {ca'irpulji}, {ka'irpulji}), as part of a police force (= {puljysoi}, as part of {puljyselsoi}); military police (= {jempulji}, {bilpulji}). See also {catni}, {sonci}, {bilni}, {flalu}, {bandu}, {jemna}, {zekri}, {krati}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a pulley [tool] for performing action/function $x_{2}$ rotating on axle $x_{3}$.
$l_1$ (agent) dusts $l_2$ with $l_4$
$x_{1}$ (agent) puts/places/sets $x_{2}$ on/at surface/locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a swelling/protrusion/convexity [shape/form] at/in/on $x_{2}$, of material $x_{3}$.
time tense: had earlier been; (tense/modal).
$x_{1}$ is in the past of/earlier than/before $x_{2}$ in time sequence; $x_{1}$ is former; $x_{2}$ is latter.
valsi.notes: Time ordering only (use lidne otherwise); aorist in that $x_1$ may overlap in time with $x_2$ as long as it starts before, $x_1$ starts before $x_2$ but is continuing during $x_2$ (= {cfaprucabna}); non-aorist before, i.e. $x_1$ is over/ended before $x_2$ starts (= {fampru}), $x_1$ is completed before $x_2$ starts (= {mulpru}). See also {lidne}, {balvi}, {cabna}, {farna}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a garden/tended/cultivated field of family/community/farmer $x_{2}$ growing plants/crop $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is the last time/previous time that $x_2$ happened.
$x_{1}$ is a powder of material $x_{2}$.
$p_1=z_1$ previews $z_2$ by means $z_3$ under condition $z_4$.
$x_1$ is adolescence by standard $x_2$
$x_1$ is stellar evolution
time tense: a medium time before; (tense/modal).
time tense: for a medium length interval some time in the past; (tense/modal).
time tense: for a short interval some time in the past; (tense/modal).
time tense: for a long interval some time in the past; (tense/modal).
time tense: a short time before; (tense/modal).
time tense: a long time before; (tense/modal).
letteral for p.
Tibet.
pro-sumti: a recent sumti before the last one, as determined by back-counting rules.
srana modal, 1st place pertained to by ... (generally more specific).
$x_1$ is a relative clause attached to argument $x_2$ with predicate relation $x_3$ among arguments $x_4$.
digit/number: repeating digits (of a decimal) follow.
$p_1=r_2$ are the retained earnings of company/corporation/firm/partnership $p_2=r_1$ resulting from business activity $p_3$.
krasi modal, 1st place from source/origin/starting point ...
$g_1$ maintains $g_2=r_1$ (event/state) over interval $r_2$.
$x_1$ is the integral of $x_2$ with respect to $x_3$ over $x_4$.
flag GOhA to indicate pro-assignment context updating for all pro-assigns in referenced bridi.
discursive: chiefly - equally - incidentally.
discursive: chiefly - equally - incidentally.
discursive: chiefly - equally - incidentally.
$r_1=b_1$ is the Arabic language used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$x_1$ is a dromedary/Arabian camel of breed $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ (action/activity/behavior) is sane/rational by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a rabbit/hare/[doe] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ admits/accepts/acknowledges/allows/concedes/recognizes that $x_2$ is true about $x_3$ on grounds/under compelling evidence $x_4$
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ radian(s) [metric unit] in angular measure (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Measured in degrees ({julra'o}); right ascension astronomical measurement. (= {cacryra'o}). See also {jganu}, {kilto}, {centi}, {decti}, {dekto}, {femti}, {gigdo}, {gocti}, {gotro}, {gutci}, {litce}, {megdo}, {mikri}, {milti}, {minli}, {nanvi}, {petso}, {picti}, {terto}, {xatsi}, {xecto}, {xexso}, {zepti}, {zetro}.

valsi.definition: $x_1=r_1=c_1$ abandons / gives up $x_2=r_2=c_2$ under condition $x_3=r_3=c_3$
$c_1=r_1$ is a title of $c_2=r_2$ used by $c_3$.
$x_{1}$ is an affix/suffix/prefix/combining-form for word/concept $x_{2}$, form/properties $x_{3}$, language $x_{4}$.
$x_1$ is the morphology of language $x_2$ according to methodology $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a Malpighian tubule [excretory organ] of insect $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is located across/on the other side of gap/boundary $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is opposite (fi) $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ is over there (across/beyond zo'e); directly across/beyond a boundary/gap, generally at the shortest plausible distance on the other side of the boundary. See also {dukti}, {kuspe}, {bancu}, {kruca}, {cripu}, {pagre}.

valsi.definition: traji modal, 1st place with superlative ...
$x_1$ is a column vector of dimension $x_2$ with coordinates $x_3$, $x_4$, ...
$s_1=rs_1$ is a vertical rock face / rock surface of rock / mountain $rs_2$ on side $rs_3$ with edges $rs_4$, vertical in reference frame/gravity $s_2$.
valsi.notes: Technically necessary ke (or bo) dropped. Cf. {sraji}, {roksfe}, {fenra}, {cmana}, {farlu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a tall acoording to standard $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a column/file of table/chart $x_2$.
$se_1=sr_1$ is a ladder / vertical stairway for climbing structure $se_2$ with steps $se_3$, vertical in reference frame $sr_2$.
$x_1$ itches at locus $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Iraqi culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$g_1$ is Iraq.
$x_{1}$ (object/person/event/situation) troubles/disturbs $x_{2}$ (person) causing problem(s) $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also afflicts, is disruptive to, troublesome; $x_1$/$x_3$ are a care to $x_2$, $x_2$ is troubled by/cares about $x_1$/$x_3$ (= selra'u for reordered places). See also {dicra}, {fanza}, {zunti}, {kurji}, {xanka}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is delicate/fragile/subtle/refined in property $x_{2}$ (ka).
valsi.notes: Easily damaged or rendered less pleasing/pure/effective. See also {jdari}, {ranti}, {tsali}, {milxe}, {kukte}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is principal/chief/leader/main/[staple], most significant among $x_{2}$ (set) in property $x_{3}$ (ka).
valsi.notes: Staple (= {ralselpra}); general/admiral/president/principal leader (= ralja'a, ralterbe'e; use additional terms to distinguish among these); also primary, prime, (adverb:) chiefly, principally, mainly; ($x_2$ is complete specification of set). See also {vajni}, te {bende}, {minde}, {lidne}, {jatna}, {jitro}, {gidva}, {midju}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a/the capital of $x_2$.
valsi.notes: Cf. {ralju}, {tcadu}. More general than {trutca}. May be the financial (e.g. New York in USA), industrial (e.g. Sao Paulo in Brazil) or religious (e.g. Mecca in Saudi Arabia) capital of its polity but not necessarily the seat of government.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ retains/keeps/holds $x_{2}$ in its possession.
$r_1$ is the frequency of the carrier wave of signal $b_1$.
Ramadan
$x_1$ is a rambutan (Nephelium lappaceum) of breed $x_2$
$x_1$ is the Ramadan/Ramazan of year $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ yields/gives way/surrenders to $x_{2}$ (force/agent) under conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the body organ [body-part] of body/species $x_{2}$ performing function $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is an orangutan of variety $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ (event/state) continues/persists over interval $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ (property - ka) is continuous over $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a myth/legend, a culturally significant story about $x_{2}$ in mythos $x_{3}$ of culture $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ is mythical/fairy tale; used adjectivally for non-humanoid creatures (= {ramda'u}) of story/myth/legend/religion, e.g. dragon; fairy tale (= {veryranmi}). See also {lijda}, {lisri}, {crida}.

valsi.definition: $s_1=p_1$ finds $s_2=p_2$ at/in location $p_3$.
